story:
Here's the situation...

Hi there...My name is Bryan and I am from Toronto. I am a proud father of 4 beautiful children!

Today, I had watched a TV news clip about Sarah Vibert, a mother in Edmonton, Alberta who has been in a long term care facility since 2009, due to Multiple Sclerosis. Her husband was given primary care of her children Emma and Emily in 2011, but since June 2013, he has run off and now she must look for foster care or to give her girls up for adoption.

Every mother's greatest fear is to loose a child, but to have to giveaway your child up for adoption is probably one of the most difficult things to do!

To offer Sarah, some peace of mind, my goal is to help find funding that can be set-up as a trust fund for both girls for future support. The funds does not have to be much, but think if you can spend $5.00 at Starbucks than take a day off of coffee and donate to this cause. Oh, by the way, I have no connection to Sarah, I am a total stranger, but what us Canadians do best is helping others in need!

Please visit these website to read more about the situation:

Global TV Video Clip: http://globalnews.ca/news/1171853/edmonton-mother-desperately-seeks-a-home-for-daughters/

Her Blog: http://helpmygirls.blogspot.ca/2014/02/help-me-find-emma-and-emily-home.html

My Goal...

I am looking to raise $50,000.00 CAD (less any Indiegogo/Paypal fees), of which the funds will be divided equally between Emma and Emily. Should additional funds be raised than, I would also divide the funds equally between the two girls. 

The Impact..

In advance, I want to thank everyone for their support, as if each one of us can make a differences to someone's life, than we should!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this link with your friends, family, FB friends and Twitter...

Also show your support on Sarah's Blog or on Global TV comments!

story:
The Singles and Exes Story

I had an idea almost 2 years ago to create a late night radio talk show.  It would be a show like nothing else on Little Rock radio. It would be like Happy Hour, LIVE on air.  A groundbreaking independent show that talked about all the adult stuff that you talk about with your friends after work, sitting on a deck, having an adult beverage and laughing...a lot. It's basically my life on air along with some of my best friends.

The show started from nothing.  Thanks to wonderful business owners in the Little Rock we have been very successful for the last year and a half.  Our fan base that listens on News Radio 102.9 KARN or via the website streaming live on www.singlesandexes.com has become very loyal.  Recently we took the show on the road, broadcasting live from sponsors locations and everyone involved loved being a part of those shows.

We are a small business who wants to help other small business.

I actually own Singles and Exes, even though it is broadcast on Cumulus Radio; I am an independent small business owner.  I am able to create my own rates and advertising campaigns.  This makes this show very appealing to small businesses that don’t have a huge advertising budget. However, I also need to cover the expenses of the show and the small staff so my rates have to be set at a certain level. 

This money would allow us to lower our rates, which would help more small business owners to reach our very loyal listeners and allow our current advertisers to increase their exposure.

What this funding would do

 This funding would not only secure Singles and Exes remaining on KARN 102.9 but would open up advertising opportunities that many small local business owners would love to have available but currently can't afford.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please help to get the word out, tell everyone you know and make some noise about our campaign.

story:
Idyllwild Design's Boutique on Wheels!

Mobile shops have sprung up all over the West Coast. They are in LA. Orange County, San Diego and it is now time for the LBC (Long Beach) to share in the fun. Idyllwild Designs features a carefully curated selection of vintage inspired clothing and accessories  for a modern life. We have an existing on-line boutique  idyllwilddesigns.com and with our mobile shop, we strive to become a (mobile) destination where local artists can showcase their original designs , and where customers can purchase 'I can still pay my rent'  friendly, one-of-a-kind items in a fun, creative and intimate space.

Our plan is to create a unique and inspired pop-up shop for the streets of Long Beach CA. We will we park our truck at various So Cal Flea Markets, Farmers Markets and festivals. Plus we will be available on random street corners too!

We have the followers, the inventory, the website and the truck! We NEED to renovate the interior!

Who's Driving This Crazy Thing?

Hi all! I'm Connie Idyllwild, nice to meet you, and might I say, aren't you lovely! (Flattery, at least with me, will get you everywhere.)  Idyllwild Designs started as a blog almost two years ago as a way for me to let off some creative steam. Last month it became an on-line store. Through starting the blog, and opening the store I have kept my day job, which I am completely miserable at I might add. And, yet I go, every day and be the best I can be in the time I'm there. I think it's called integrity, but mostly I like to say it's cause I'm classy like that.

I work my nine to ten hour shift and once I clock out I make the two hour commute back home. Then the fun starts!  I log on to my computer and I go to work on my passion of blogging and maintaining my on-line boutique. I pretty much work twenty four/seven. Once every two or three months I take a 'me day' beyond that I work.

Driving (pun totally intended) manically towards a brighter future. A future where I can once again step confidently away from the viscous corporate ladder and into the creative life I was born for. 

Six years ago I owned my own store, spent my days designing clothing and selling it to lovely people. Then, the economy crashed. My world crashed. I lost the ability to dream, much less to dream big. I put my head down and I spent the last five years living the status quo and quietly rebuilding. Today, a bit older, a bit wiser and a lot stronger I face the chance to jump off that cliff into the unknown once again.

What'cha Doin' With That Cash?

As I said before, we have the inventory, the online store and we have the truck. What we need is the extra capital to renovate the interior into a beautiful custom boutique for you.


We are asking Indiegogo for $5,000, of which:

100% will go to the build out and renovation of our Ford Truck.

Anything extra will go towards additional  inventory.

Truckin'

We know not everyone can donate. But love goes a long way! Any help (even a cyber hug) takes us one step closer to getting Idyllwild on the road. Even if you can't help financially please help spread word of this IndieGoGo Campaign, and drop us a line if you are a designer interested in having your goods on the truck! Join us on our Blog to watch as the journey unfolds. www.idyllwilddesignsblog.com

Follow us: 
Facebook
Twitter
Instagram
Bloglovin
Pinterest
Tumbler
Google+

story:
Free Trade Beer.


**UPDATE: 10 DAYS TO GO**

Check out just some of the news coverage we have been getting across the country recently!

http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new-brunswick/booze-border-limit-challenge-could-be-revolutionary-judge-says-1.2760525
http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/new-brunswick-man-takes-constitutional-fight-over-beer-rights-to-court/article26088730/
http://news.nationalpost.com/news/canada/new-brunswick-residents-buying-beer-in-quebec-an-an-everyday-occurrence-says-investigator-in-import-trial
http://ici.radio-canada.ca/regions/atlantique/2015/08/26/007-temoins-proces-gerard-comeau-nouveau-brunswick.shtml
http://www.thestar.com/opinion/editorials/2015/09/06/absurd-booze-laws-are-due-to-fall-editorial.html
http://munchies.vice.com/articles/canadas-booze-laws-might-be-unconstitutional

**


When Gerard Comeau went on a run to pick up a few cases of his favourite brew, he didn't know that bringing them back from Quebec to his home in New Brunswick was illegal.

He does now. 

Mounties stopped Gerard, confiscated his beer and slapped him with a fine for $292.50. He was fined for breaking an unconstitutional and unjust part of New Brunswick's Liquor Control Act.

It turns out that in 2015, it is somehow still illegal to bring certain amounts of legally purchased alcohol across the border. 

The worst part? The framers of our constitution always intended that goods "be admitted free into each of the other Provinces". All the way back to 1867. Any Canadian reading that line from our constitution should be able to see how unjust this protectionist law is.

It's time our courts saw this too.

Gerard has decided to not pay this fine. In fact, he is challenging this law. The
Canadian Constitution Foundation is helping him with legal support. And we're running this campaign to give you an opportunity to help too.

Our constitution is supposed to ensure the free movement of goods between the provinces. And since the prohibition era, provincial governments have been content to violate this principle based on some bad and outdated legal precedent set by the Supreme Court in 1921.

It's time to FREE BEER and follow the constitution. It's time to free consumers and small business from government control.

By donating to the campaign, supporters can ensure the CCF is fully prepared to fight for the constitutional rights of all Canadians – and to make sure that this time, freedom wins.


What We Need & What You Get 

CCF is a non-profit and charitable organization. The people we work with are volunteering their services. All of the money we receive will go towards the support fees inherent in participating in the legal process and helping Gerard fight this challenge. 

And because CCF is a registered charity, donations are tax deductible*.  As of August 13, 2015 you MUST leave a mailing address, email address and your full name in order to receive a tax receipt. If any of these are left out, we cannot issue you a receipt.

Our initial campaign goal of $20,000 won't cover all of our costs (even with our lawyers volunteering), but the money will help pay for:

  • Filing Fees
  • Document review costs
  • Expert response reports
  • Flying in constitutional experts (these laws are so old we need to dig up an expert from England)
  • Record procurement
  • Transcripts (if it goes to appeal)
* Due to the regulations surrounding charity law, tax-deductible donations are only available for the donation minus the value of any campaign 'perk' we may be offering. For this reason, our perks are small or symbolic as we try to raise money for this legal case.

Perks

And while fixing broken laws offers its own rewards, we thought we'd honour your contribution with a memento as outrageous as our most outdated laws, ie:

  • The "Free Beer" pins your backpack is dying for

  • Canada Post issued stamps

  • A courtroom sketch of you, drawn with your choice of innocent or guilty look


The Impact

Gerard Comeau and the CCF are fighting for a stronger interpretation of s. 121 of our constitution.

“121. All Articles of the Growth, Produce, or Manufacture of any one of the Provinces shall, from and after the Union, be admitted free into each of the other Provinces.”

Success in this challenge for Gerard could mean a lot more than a new era in booze runs. It could mean a new era in Canadian commerce. A broader application of s. 121 from this case gives Canadians a stronger legal bulwark against all kinds of government meddling. And though we are challenging a law in New Brunswick, we are challenging it with a constitutional argument that can have a wide-reaching effect across the country.

“If Gerard wins, similar cases are almost certain to follow Canada-wide,” said CCF Executive Director Marni Soupcoff. 

These protectionist laws benefit government monopoly sales agencies while constraining private businesses and citizens. Government alcohol agencies determine what products are bought and sold and at what price. There are billions of dollars at stake for the provincial governments. It’s almost guaranteed that they will try to defend their monopoly through all possible avenues of appeal. As the CCF presents Gerard’s case, every province will be watching.

 A win for Gerard will be a win for all consumers – more choice, more freedom.

Read more about this case on our website.


About Us

The Canadian Constitution Foundation (CCF) is a registered charity, independent and non-partisan.  We defend the constitutional rights and freedoms of Canadians in the courts of law and public opinion.


Through education and litigation, the CCF supports:

Individual freedom – the “fundamental freedoms” in section 2 of the Charter: freedom of association; freedom of peaceful assembly; freedom of conscience and religion; freedom of thought, belief, opinion and expression.

Economic liberty: the right to earn a living and to own and enjoy property

Equality before the law: Section 15 of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms guarantees equal rights and equal opportunities for all Canadians, special privileges for none.

To learn more about our work please visit us on line at www.theccf.ca


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, but believe in the spirit of the case:

  • Help us get the word out. Talk about it over a beer. 
  • Have any social or traditional media clout? Express your freedom and write about the case or the campaign.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
In December 2015, non-profit organization Make Life Skate Life completed construction of the Pushing Myanmar skatepark, the first free-of-charge international-standard concrete skatepark in Myanmar. Now that the skatepark is open, an equipment loaner program has been established to provide local youth with free access to skateboarding equipment, safety gear, and skate shoes so that all children in Yangon can enjoy the park, regardless of economic standing. Help sustain the skatepark's equipment loaner program and allow us to share skateboarding further in Myanmar by contributing now! 

Project Background

A community of skateboarders has existed in Yangon since the mid 1990's. Living under a military regime isolated from the rest of the world, skateboarders in Yangon spent decades riding poor quality skateboards while receiving no support from their government. With the opening up of the country in recent years, quality skateboarding equipment has begun to make its way to the country. Prior to construction of the skatepark there were already over 100 active skateboarders in Yangon.

Construction of the 400 sq. meter skatepark was completed in December 2015, led by a team of professional skatepark builders from around the world working as volunteers. They not only donated their time and skills to build a skatepark, but worked with local skateboarders to share their knowledge in the art of skatepark construction, creating a truly community-built skatepark. Local skateboarders were provided with the tools, materials, and knowledge to create their own skatepark. After construction, the skatepark was painted by local youth and partner organization AptArt - Awareness and Prevention through Art. 

The skatepark now provides a shared community space where interested youth can learn from more experienced skateboarders, allowing the Burmese skateboarding community to grow and flourish for decades to come. Children from all different ethnic, religious, and economic backgrounds can find common ground through skateboarding in a country rife with ethnic and religious conflict. In a city with 9 major ethnic groups and 4 major religions, the existing skateboarding community of Yangon is already a strong example of how skateboarding has been able to connect youth from all different backgrounds toward a shared passion.

A skateboard equipment loaner system has been established, providing youth with free access to quality skateboarding equipment, safety gear, and skate shoes so that anyone can use the skatepark, regardless of economic standing. There is a full-time skateboarding teacher on-site to lend out equipment and teach classes for beginners. The skatepark is filled everyday with a mix of youth just starting out and the existing community of experienced skateboarders.

Future plans for skateboarding in Myanmar

A skateboarding teacher has been hired full-time on a temporary basis to run the skateboard equipment loaner program to provide youth with free access to skateboarding equipment and to teach daily skateboarding classes. The impact is already incredible, with over 100 new skateboarders ages 5-12 skateboarding every day. By supporting the skatepark's loaner program, you will allow us to continually provide the youth of Yangon with free access to skateboarding equipment and classes.

We also plan to begin outreach classes in 2016 to begin sharing skateboarding with communities outside of Yangon. Our initial goal is to begin running weekly skateboarding classes for street kids in the cities of Bago and Pyay. By supporting outreach classes, you will help cover transportation costs for skateboarding teachers to travel with loaner skateboards, safety equipment, skate shoes, and a mobile skate-ramp to Bago and Pyay, allowing us to spread skateboarding's positive impact even further in Myanmar.

About Make Life Skate Life

Make Life Skate Life is a German registered non-profit organization that works to share skateboarding with youth around the world by constructing free of charge community skateparks. Our skatepark projects India, Bolivia, Jordan, and Myanmar have provided countless youth the opportunity to enjoy skateboarding who would not have otherwise been able to. 

Our projects achieve success through local community involvement from start to finish, providing local communities with the tools, materials, knowledge, and inspiration to create their own projects. The professional skatepark builders that volunteer on Make Life Skate Life projects donate their time and skills, not only to create a skatepark, but to share their knowledge in the art of skatepark construction with skateboarding communities around the world. By involving local skateboarders in the planning and construction process, there is nothing stopping them from replicating the process to create more skateparks for their community. 

Since completion of Make Life Skate Life's Holystoked skatepark project in 2013, local skateboarders have completed over a dozen skatepark projects around India.

Thank you for your support!

For the latest updates on skateboarding in Myanmar, follow @pushingmyanmar on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Feel free to shoot us an e-mail us at pushingmyanmar@gmail.com.

Show your support for the youth of Yangon and Contribute Now! All donations go through Make Life Skate Life, a German registered non-profit organization.

Project Background
A community of skateboarders has existed in Yangon since the mid 1990's. Living under a military regime isolated from the rest of the world, skateboarders in Yangon spent decades riding poor quality skateboards while receiving no support from their government. With the opening up of the country in recent years, quality skateboarding equipment has begun to make its way to the country. Prior to construction of the skatepark there were already over 100 active skateboarders in Yangon.
Construction of the 400 sq. meter skatepark was completed in December 2015, led by a team of professional skatepark builders from around the world working as volunteers. They not only donated their time and skills to build a skatepark, but worked with local skateboarders to share their knowledge in the art of skatepark construction, creating a truly community-built skatepark. Local skateboarders were provided with the tools, materials, and knowledge to create their own skatepark. After construction, the skatepark was painted by local youth and partner organization AptArt - Awareness and Prevention through Art. 
The skatepark now provides a shared community space where interested youth can learn from more experienced skateboarders, allowing the Burmese skateboarding community to grow and flourish for decades to come. Children from all different ethnic, religious, and economic backgrounds can find common ground through skateboarding in a country rife with ethnic and religious conflict. In a city with 9 major ethnic groups and 4 major religions, the existing skateboarding community of Yangon is already a strong example of how skateboarding has been able to connect youth from all different backgrounds toward a shared passion.

A skateboard equipment loaner system has been established, providing youth with free access to quality skateboarding equipment, safety gear, and skate shoes so that anyone can use the skatepark, regardless of economic standing. There is a full-time skateboarding teacher on-site to lend out equipment and teach classes for beginners. The skatepark is filled everyday with a mix of youth just starting out and the existing community of experienced skateboarders.






Future plans for skateboarding in Myanmar
A skateboarding teacher has been hired full-time on a temporary basis to run the skateboard equipment loaner program to provide youth with free access to skateboarding equipment and to teach daily skateboarding classes. The impact is already incredible, with over 100 new skateboarders ages 5-12 skateboarding every day. By supporting the skatepark's loaner program, you will allow us to continually provide the youth of Yangon with free access to skateboarding equipment and classes.
We also plan to begin outreach classes in 2016 to begin sharing skateboarding with communities outside of Yangon. Our initial goal is to begin running weekly skateboarding classes for street kids in the cities of Bago and Pyay. By supporting outreach classes, you will help cover transportation costs for skateboarding teachers to travel with loaner skateboards, safety equipment, skate shoes, and a mobile skate-ramp to Bago and Pyay, allowing us to spread skateboarding's positive impact even further in Myanmar.

About Make Life Skate Life
Make Life Skate Life is a German registered non-profit organization that works to share skateboarding with youth around the world by constructing free of charge community skateparks. Our skatepark projects India, Bolivia, Jordan, and Myanmar have provided countless youth the opportunity to enjoy skateboarding who would not have otherwise been able to. 

Our projects achieve success through local community involvement from start to finish, providing local communities with the tools, materials, knowledge, and inspiration to create their own projects. The professional skatepark builders that volunteer on Make Life Skate Life projects donate their time and skills, not only to create a skatepark, but to share their knowledge in the art of skatepark construction with skateboarding communities around the world. By involving local skateboarders in the planning and construction process, there is nothing stopping them from replicating the process to create more skateparks for their community. 



Since completion of Make Life Skate Life's Holystoked skatepark project in 2013, local skateboarders have completed over a dozen skatepark projects around India.

Thank you for your support!

For the latest updates on skateboarding in Myanmar, follow @pushingmyanmar on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Feel free to shoot us an e-mail us at pushingmyanmar@gmail.com.

Show your support for the youth of Yangon and Contribute Now! All donations go through Make Life Skate Life, a German registered non-profit organization.

story:
I’ve documented many projects for the SAFE Foundation charity over the past few years, including visits to India, Nepal, Cambodia and Ghana.  I’ve so far, self supported these trips and now with your help, I can complete another project this September in Uganda.

The charity will be running a clay oven project in Tororo, Uganda, building 3 community clay ovens that the local people can use to start social enterprises baking bread. Until now people in the district of Tororo can only get bread from the capital Kampala which is expensive and not fresh by the time it reaches the rural district.

This project will be able to bring fresh bread to the communities living in some of the poorest regions of Uganda and help them run three small sustainable local enterprises.

Over the project's’ duration of sixteen days, I will photograph & film the process, as well as helping to build these ovens. Your donation will help support the covering the costs of travel,board and expenses (whilst my time documenting/editing will be free of charge)


Links to my work and the charity:

  • A self funded book I made from my trip to Ghana
  • My website
  • The Safe foundation website

story:
This is a heart breaking statement, Yasereh, Synia's mother, wrote:

"The worst imaginable has happened, Synia is my darling of all darlings, the most precious little girl, my beautiful angel.
I am writing this with tears rolling down my face. 
On March 31st, we had just entered NS and were looking forward to coming home for a month, to give the kids a party each, see our friends, record a new CD, and then start our tour back out West.
We were caught in a sudden ice storm, it was foggy, trucks had started pulling off the road to be safe, we thought of making it to the next motel. But as we came towards a downward hill, we decided to pull off the road to be safe, we were only going 10 kilometres an hour, and every time we tried the brakes we skidded. We had just pulled to a stop behind a truck, when we were rear ended by a huge truck, which squashed into the one in front. I don't know what happened, there were three big shattering smacks, it felt like a few giants were playing ball with us, and we were the ball being smashed from wall to wall. 
The car was totalled, all of our belongings pulverized, all windows shattered.
The miracle is that Kai, Rohan and the all four pets, were all physically fine. The horror is that my beautiful little Synia, who was going to have her 7th birthday, died! 
I climbed out of my window, not caring about the broken glass that was cutting me, I saw the car smoking and I wanted to get my children out fast! I was in my socks with no coat, in the icy snow. I first went to my daughters door, and right away saw that she was dead, I couldn't stop screaming, it worse than any nightmare, worse than the worse horror movie, I couldn't believe that it was real.
She died as peacefully as she lived, one super smack to her head while she was napping.
She was the sweetest of children, delightful in every way, she never caused any trouble, she was fun, sweet, cute, funny, spunky, loving, wise, kind, creative, clever, imaginative and spiritual. 
In short, she was as perfect a little girl as I could ever have hoped for. She had so many talents: She loved to sing, dance, act and draw, play with her 100 children cuddlies. 

She had so much wisdom and common sense, she was a teacher and an inspiration for us all, there was the time where I was having a conflict with Rohan, who can be very strong willed. 
And she said Mommy the problem is that Rohan is a dragon, and you don’t understand dragons. I said oh please help me to understand, and she did, sitting in the park, she chose for hours to tell me all about dragons, unicorns and phoenixes, instead of playing with her friends.
My friend had a tipi in her house, and she sat and did an Ohm Sat Nam, for half an hour with total third eye focus. She would play with her little plastic baby animals for hours in the bathtub, singing to them. She sang all the time, she used to sing 
“May there always be sunshine, may there always be blue skies, may there always be Mama may there always be me” in her beautiful loud clear child voice. And I would sing may there always be Synia. I have tried to sing this song to her wherever she is, but I cannot sing any song without chocking up. 
I am right now too full of deep pain to be wise, I have had three children, and only one is left, one who didn’t want to be an only child. 

Rohan her older brother is devastated, and my heart also breaks for him, we un-schooled them, and felt that by having them home with us, their friendship was so much stronger than average. They were like two puppies frolicking together all day long. Rohan would invent imagination cat games for hours, (though he tells me that they are not games or invented that they are real). Synia and him totally believed in them. There were whole worlds, legends, from the far past, different dimensions, and cat characters that they knew by name and behaviour. It was a very funny and loud world, that would have both kids shrieking and giggling with joy for hours. 
They did everything together...
He has lost his best friend…He is full of pain and is regressing back to the maturity of a baby, he needs us 100% of the time. He cannot enjoy anything without thinking that Synia would have loved it, and that thought makes him so sad. Much of his life with her, he loved to make her happy. She was the perfect sister and best friend.

We all know that whatever we do, and of course, life will go on eventually. 
But there will never be another Synia, there will never be my amazing little daughter again, at least not in her beautiful little body that I can hold and love.
As for me, I keep wanting to wake up out of this nightmare.
She taught me how to love, and be totally connected, she was my daughter, my sister, my guru and my friend for life. I have never loved another being quite so deeply, of course I love Rohan and Kai, very, very much. But Synia and me were made of the same stuff, we understood each other perfectly, we were kindred spirits, I slept with her in my arms every night until she died. 
I carried her in my sling and breast-fed her until she was 4 1/2 but like most other mothers facing their loss, I wish that I could have given her so much more. 
She was going to go Jam camp, and Pony camp this summer, she wanted to start voice lessons though she didn’t really need them, she wanted to do musical theatre, and travel, she was excited about spring. Right now I can't imagine a future without her. I'll have to find refuge in the present...

Words cannot express how much delight, love, magic and balance she brought to our family. I don’t know how we are going to manage without her.
She had such total sweetness she would melt right into you. And when she would hug or kiss you, there was so much love coming from her. She would believe that she was a unicorn and she would give us unicorn healings with her horn, it felt amazing.
She was the little baby who stared with delight at people’s auras, supposedly a crystal child or a star child. She was born with wisdom and love, void of jealousy or greed. In short she was pretty enlightened. 
She walked always on her tiptoes, loved to perch on tree tops, cried when she found out that the pretty fairy wings I had bought for her birthday didn’t work for real.
She taught me how to speak to fairies, when she was fed up with being sick I told her a story of how she was taken to fairyland and healed, and the power of her own imagination healed her.
She only liked cute dolls and stuffies, she had the natural good sense to find Barbie dolls and brats scary. 

I am soooo sad, I feel like I will never be able to sing or dance again.
I loved her more than I have ever loved before, she was my precious one, my soul.
Without her, life doesn’t make any sense, it feels void of joy, I cannot stop crying. My little girl, our instruments, all our ideas of where our life was going, of what kind of a family we were has all been smashed. 

I want her back with all my heart!
That someone so beautiful, so incredibly sweet, can be gone, irretrievably feels impossible, I am a fighter I don't give up easily, but there is nothing to fight but myself. 

There’s nothing that I can do, but connect with her spirit and grow in wisdom. I will do my best…"

story:
*FIND THE ENGLISH VERSION BELOW*

Die Idee – Musikunterricht 2.0

get2play ist eine zentralisierte Online-Musikschule, die es Lehrern und Schülern weltweit ermöglicht, sich online zu finden und via Videokonferenz den Unterricht durchzuführen.

SCHÜLER können ihren idealen Musiklehrer anhand von Filterkriterien wie Instrument, Ort, Genre und Preis auch unabhängig vom Standort finden und JEDERZEIT bequem von zu Hause aus ihr Instrument lernen.

LEHRER können sich besser selbst vermarkten, indem sie durch das Netzwerk der Plattform mehr Schüler erreichen, die sie sogar von zu Hause aus unterrichten können. Es ist ebenfalls möglich, eigene Videotutorials zu veröffentlichen und zu verkaufen.

Speziell bekannte Musiker können über get2play leicht ihr musikalisches Wissen in Form von Videotutorials oder online Workshops an ihre Fans weitergeben.

Wer würde nicht gerne die Grundakkorde von Eric Clapton, Solotechniken von Kirk Hammett (Metallica), die Basics des Jazzpianos von Keith Jarrett oder Gesang von Annette Dasch lernen? - get2play macht es möglich !!!

Warum get2play?

Weil get2play folgende Probleme löst:

  • Regional limitierte Auswahl an Musiklehrern
  • Aufwendiges Suchen und Vergleichen der regionalen Lehrer
  • Lehrer für seltenere Instrumente zu finden ist fast unmöglich
  • Geringe Wahrscheinlichkeit einen Experten für ein spezielles musikalisches Genre in der Umgebung zur Verfügung zu haben (z.B. Free-Jazz, Flamenco, Percussive Fingerstyle)
  • Aufwendige Terminabsprachen (lange Arbeitszeit oder belegte Termine)
  • Zeit und Kosten für den Weg zum Musiklehrer/Schule

Wie funktioniert get2play?

get2play umfasst den kompletten Prozess von der Suche des perfekten Lehrers bis hin zum eigentlichen Unterricht. Dies geschieht wie folgt:

  • Passende Lehrer werden anhand von Filterkriterien einfach gefunden.  
  • Lehrer präsentieren sich mit einem eigenen Profil  
  • Die Termine sind mit dem Kalendertool leicht abzustimmen
  • Ein Video-Probeunterricht wird zum Kennenlernen vereinbart
  • Die Vertragsabwicklung geschieht online (Stunden Buchsystem)
  • Der Zahlungsvorgang ist sicher
  • Der Musikunterricht wird via Videochat mit musikrelevanten Features wie Notenplugin, Metronomfunktion und Filesharingoption für die Unterrichtsmaterialien durchgeführt

Was wir brauchen & Was du bekommst

Um mit get2play das bestmögliche Lernerlebnis bieten zu können, brauchen wir initiale Unterstützung speziell beim Web und Userexperience Design. Ferner benötigen wir das Kapital, um die nötige Infrastruktur zu entwickeln und die Beta Version fertig zu stellen.

Je nach Höhe der Unterstützung warten Perks auf euch, die von der Nennung auf der Homepage, über Werbung und privaten Musikunterricht bis hin zum Partnering reichen.

* Unterstützer ab 10€ erhalten Zugang zu einer exklusiven Facebook-Gruppe, in der wir regelmäßig die Projektfortschritte vorstellen. Ihr seid somit direkt am Geschehen und könnt euch auch jederzeit mit uns in Verbindung setzen und eigene Vorschläge einbringen.

** Unterstützern ab 25€ bieten wir "Shoutouts" (Werbeposts) über unsere Social Media Kanäle Facebook und Twitter an. Der Zeitpunkt des Werbeposts kann dabei selbst bestimmt werden.

*** Unterstützer ab 50€ haben die Option Privatunterricht über get2play zu bekommen. Dieser kann momentan nur für Gitarrenunterricht bei Tobias Rauscher garantiert werden, gilt aber unter Vorbehalt auch für andere Instrumente und Lehrer.

Du kannst auch auf andere Weisen helfen

Wir freuen uns über jede Art der Unterstützung. Wenn du z.B. Leute kennst, die Interesse hätten uns zu helfen, kannst du diese Kampagne sehr gerne weiterleiten, ganz einfach über Facebook, Twitter, Google+ etc.

Wenn du Musiker, Musiklehrer oder Menschen kennst, die gerne ein Instrument lernen möchten, kannst du diese auch gerne mit uns in Kontakt bringen.

Wir suchen zudem noch Unterstützung im Team! Speziell halten wir Ausschau nach einem ROCKSTAR DESIGNER und noch einem weiteren ROCKSTAR DEVELOPER. Wenn Ihr also einer der genannten Rockstars seid oder welche kennt, könnt ihr euch gerne melden unter tobias@get2play.de

Willst du unsere Beta Version testen, melde dich ganz einfach an unter www.get2play.de

VIELEN DANK!!!!!!!! :)

 

 

 -  get2play is the Startup Weekend Hamburg 2012 "Overall Winner"  -

 
 

 ENGLISH VERSION

The Idea – Music Lessons 2.0

Get2play is a centralized online music school that allows teachers and students to find each other and have lessons online from home via a live video chat.

STUDENTS can find their ideal music teacher based on search criteria such as instrument, genre and price and can learn their instrument whenever and wherever.

TEACHERS can better promote themselves, get more potential students, teach them online from home or sell their videolessons and thus increase their income.

How does get2play work?

get2play takes care about the whole process from finding the right teacher till having actual lessons:

  • finding the perfect teacher based on specified filter criteria
  • teacher create an online profile and present/promote themselves easily
  • easy scheduling of lessons via the online calendar tool
  • initial online test lessons to get to know each other
  • online contracting / booking flexible hours
  • Secure payment
  • Finally both parties have real time online video lessons with music relevant chat features such as a notationtool plugin, metronome function and filesharing options

What We Need & What You Get

To create the best possible learning experience we need initial support in the field of web development and userexperience design. Further, we need capital to set up the required infrastructure of get2play and to create the beta version.

Supporters get perks ranging from listing their names on our website, providing online music lessons and ads up to a partnership.

You Can Help Us As Well Non-Monetary 

We deeply apprechiate all kinds of support. You can already help us a lot with:

  • Sharing this campaign with people that migth be interested in supporting or participating get2play
  • Share this campaign via your social networks
  • We are still looking for support in our team, so if you know rockstar developer or designer just get in touch via tobias@get2play.de
  • Would you simply like to participate our beta testing then just sign up to get2play under www.get2play.de

Our perks in short

10€ - mentioning as a supporter and access to our facebook page
25€ - additionally we will shout out your name/company over our social media channels
50€ - 30 min. live lessons with get2play page OR 2 weeks ad placement on our page
75€ - 45 min. live lessons get2play OR 4 weeks ads placement on our page
100€ - 2*45 min. live lessons get2play page OR 8 weeks ads placement on our page
250€ - 4*45 min. live lessons get2play page OR 5 months ads placement + live or video meeting with our team
500€ - 6 months exclusive placement of your companies logo on our homepage
1000€ - 24 months exclusive placement of your companies logo on our homepage

THANK YOU SO MUCH !!! :)

** Unterstützern ab 25€ bieten wir "Shoutouts" (Werbeposts) über unsere Social Media Kanäle Facebook und Twitter an. Der Zeitpunkt des Werbeposts kann dabei selbst bestimmt werden.
*** Unterstützer ab 50€ haben die Option Privatunterricht über get2play zu bekommen. Dieser kann momentan nur für Gitarrenunterricht bei Tobias Rauscher garantiert werden, gilt aber unter Vorbehalt auch für andere Instrumente und Lehrer.
Du kannst auch auf andere Weisen helfen
Wir freuen uns über jede Art der Unterstützung. Wenn du z.B. Leute kennst, die Interesse hätten uns zu helfen, kannst du diese Kampagne sehr gerne weiterleiten, ganz einfach über Facebook, Twitter, Google+ etc.
Wenn du Musiker, Musiklehrer oder Menschen kennst, die gerne ein Instrument lernen möchten, kannst du diese auch gerne mit uns in Kontakt bringen.
Wir suchen zudem noch Unterstützung im Team! Speziell halten wir Ausschau nach einem ROCKSTAR DESIGNER und noch einem weiteren ROCKSTAR DEVELOPER. Wenn Ihr also einer der genannten Rockstars seid oder welche kennt, könnt ihr euch gerne melden unter tobias@get2play.de
Willst du unsere Beta Version testen, melde dich ganz einfach an unter www.get2play.de
VIELEN DANK!!!!!!!! :)
 
 
 -  get2play is the Startup Weekend Hamburg 2012 "Overall Winner"  -
 
 
 ENGLISH VERSION
The Idea – Music Lessons 2.0

Get2play is a centralized online music school that allows teachers and students to find each other and have lessons online from home via a live video chat.
STUDENTS can find their ideal music teacher based on search criteria such as instrument, genre and price and can learn their instrument whenever and wherever.
TEACHERS can better promote themselves, get more potential students, teach them online from home or sell their videolessons and thus increase their income.
How does get2play work?
get2play takes care about the whole process from finding the right teacher till having actual lessons:

finding the perfect teacher based on specified filter criteria
teacher create an online profile and present/promote themselves easily
easy scheduling of lessons via the online calendar tool
initial online test lessons to get to know each other
online contracting / booking flexible hours
Secure payment
Finally both parties have real time online video lessons with music relevant chat features such as a notationtool plugin, metronome function and filesharing options

What We Need & What You Get
To create the best possible learning experience we need initial support in the field of web development and userexperience design. Further, we need capital to set up the required infrastructure of get2play and to create the beta version.
Supporters get perks ranging from listing their names on our website, providing online music lessons and ads up to a partnership.
You Can Help Us As Well Non-Monetary 
We deeply apprechiate all kinds of support. You can already help us a lot with:

Sharing this campaign with people that migth be interested in supporting or participating get2play
Share this campaign via your social networks
We are still looking for support in our team, so if you know rockstar developer or designer just get in touch via tobias@get2play.de

Would you simply like to participate our beta testing then just sign up to get2play under www.get2play.de


Our perks in short
10€ - mentioning as a supporter and access to our facebook page25€ - additionally we will shout out your name/company over our social media channels50€ - 30 min. live lessons with get2play page OR 2 weeks ad placement on our page75€ - 45 min. live lessons get2play OR 4 weeks ads placement on our page100€ - 2*45 min. live lessons get2play page OR 8 weeks ads placement on our page250€ - 4*45 min. live lessons get2play page OR 5 months ads placement + live or video meeting with our team500€ - 6 months exclusive placement of your companies logo on our homepage1000€ - 24 months exclusive placement of your companies logo on our homepage
THANK YOU SO MUCH !!! :)

story:
Hey everyone. So in order to get some feedback we did a soft launch with about 100-200 people during the first 3 days of our campaign. Based on this feedback, we decided to put our campaign on hold for a couple days so we can be fully prepared for our official launch. We realized we still had a good amount of work to do before we go all in. Thank you all for the constant support, we really appreciate it. Please contact us if you have any questions.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Abdellah Smita, and I am a graphic designer from Er Rachidia (southeast Morocco). I am also the Founder and Creative Director of Maures, a T-shirt and paper goods brand that aims to revive Moroccan visual culture and spread awareness of the Moroccan identity through products of a daily use.
  • Maures is a design group based in Errachidia, Morocco. Maures, which means “Moors“ in English, is the name that was given to the people who inhabited Morocco, western Algeria, Mauritania and Muslim Iberia whether they were Muslims, Jews, Arabs or Berbers. The word “Moors” has taken many other definitions throughout time, but its first meaning has remained, which shows the diversity of this region. Our goal is make the culture of Morocco more accessible to people in a new and creative way combining unique, modern designs with everyday items like T-shirts, calendars, home decorations, and office supplies. The true culture and history of Morocco is somewhat diluted and misunderstood by people, so our goal is to educate and excite people about everything Morocco!
  • At this point, there is no money available to continue producing or selling new merchandise. Funding is needed to be able to purchase blank cotton t-shirts and print new designs on them along with other costs associated with producing more work. Contributing to this campaign will help us continue our work of promoting the culture of Morocco in a positive and genuine way.
  • So far our designs have included various historical and cultural stories that would be unknown to many young Moroccans and other people in the region. We also have larger, long-term goals of providing people in the region the opportunity to share and enhance the culture/art scene of Morocco. You would be helping us in this first step to achieve our goals!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funding right now for the purchase of around 500 cotton T-shirts, other materials needed like paper tags and packaging, shipping costs, and payment to a local printer to create the shirts. A very small portion (around $100) of the funds will also be used for some marketing of the new products.
  • If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funds will still be used towards the same materials needed such as the cotton T-shirts, tags, printing, packaging, and shipping. The only difference would be less of those items. If we receive the full amount (which we carefully calculated), we will be able to purchase the cotton shirts at a more reasonable price than a smaller quantity.
  • Our perks you would receive include one-of-a-kind pieces of art created by a team of young, rising Moroccan graphic artists. Maures’ unique works have been featured in international art/culture magazines and other local media, so you would be receiving perks that are very unique and modern pieces of current Moroccan art and culture. Right now we have built some excitement about Maures, but we are missing the money to continue operating and producing T-shirts. The designs represent the stories and cultural legends of Morocco, so you would be receiving a unique part of Morocco by helping us fund our campaign. 

Examples of our perks:

 

 

Legends Calendar - Moroccan traveler: Ibn Battuta

Legends Calendar - Moroccan myth: Aicha Kandicha

Isli d'Tislit T-shirt - Moroccan legend

Booyah Omar T-shirt

Kandicha, Waterman Joker and other prints.

 

The Impact

  • Maures is valuable first and foremost to Morocco and its people. The merchandise produced at Maures are things of a daily use and through these things, we can communicate the Moroccan identity and culture. One of our goals is to fight the stereotypical image of Morocco. Even within the region of North Africa and the Middle East, Morocco is a country with a very unique history and culture. We want to share the uniqueness of the Moroccan culture to the world through graphic design, comics, and other artistic means.
  • Maures is a young company, but we have a history of hard work paying off with some great successes. We have participated in a local art/design market in Marrakesh in which we were the “coup de coeur” or the “hotspot” of the whole event. We’ve also organized our own exhibitions in Casablanca and Marrakesh that were both very successful. We’ve been highlighted in an international magazine, Brownbook. Local Moroccan artists and media are excited for the future of Maures, but we really just need help right now to continue operating and to create something better for the future!

An article about Maures in Brownbook magazine: http://www.brownbook.me/eureka-moment/

 

Our busy stall at "The Souk" designer market in Marrakesh.

Artist Hindi Zahra visiting our stall at “The Souk” designer market in Marrakesh.

Artist Khansa Batma on a Moroccan TV channel wearing Booyah Omar T-shirt.

  • Right now we are at a crossing point in the short history of our company because we have a lot of excitement built around the brand along with a lot of great ideas for new designs and new products, BUT the big problem is that we do not have the money to purchase the materials needed to produce more. Without the money we can’t produce anything, and without production of the T-shirts our goal of promoting Moroccan culture in a positive and accurate way will fall short. Maures consists of a team of young Moroccan entrepreneurs (and one U.S. Peace Corps volunteer) looking to create something better for not only ourselves but also the communities around us and for the people that share a passion for Moroccan culture. We hope you can help us out by contributing to our campaign!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word and share this campaign on your social media accounts.
  • Get the word out if you have friends who share the passion of Moroccan culture or if you live by any Moroccan community or shop.
  • Tell your Moroccan friends because they'll be glad to see a Booyah Omar T-shirt!

Right now we are at a crossing point in the short history of our company because we have a lot of excitement built around the brand along with a lot of great ideas for new designs and new products, BUT the big problem is that we do not have the money to purchase the materials needed to produce more. We hope you can help us out by contributing to our campaign!
Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out if you have friends who share the passion of Moroccan culture or if you live by any Moroccan community or shop.

story:
Who Is CIANA and What Do We Do?

Picture a room full of children laughing, reading, writing, coloring, and calculating. Imagine that the children are of a great variety of ethnicities, have come from very different countries and backgrounds, and speak several different languages. They are newcomers to America and they have a lot to learn. These children have a difficult battle ahead of them; they will face an unfamiliar school system, a new language and culture, and may be critically behind in school, even in danger of being held back a grade. Their families face a battle as well; they too will encounter new customs and language, new systems, unfamiliar tasks, and immigration challenges. The barriers they face are intimidating, but luckily for these families, they have found an oasis of support, camaraderie, and friendship at CIANA.

The Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, Inc. (CIANA) arms these children and their families with language and education skills as well as immigration services. We offer conversation-based adult ESL classes at the same time as our youth program so that the students’ mothers can take part. We have found that for these women the ESL classes are a rare opportunity, perhaps the only opportunity that they have to take part in their own education and integration.

 Our volunteer staff, many of whom are immigrants themselves, offer culturally competent and language-appropriate assistance; they are tutors, teachers, friends, and most importantly, partners, working to help ease the transition to a new home.

CIANA’s goal is two-fold – we aim to engage the hardest to reach immigrant families and secondly, to provide resources and support so that these families have all the tools they need in order to participate successfully and positively in society. We are located in Queens, New York, the hub of immigrant communities in New York.

Why Do We Need You?

Our services, for both the children and their families, are free! We pay our volunteer staff in a currency of appreciation and experience. Unfortunately, our program expenses are rapidly increasing, and we need your help!

Due to the wild success of our education programs, CIANA is bursting at the seams; the need for our tutoring and ESL services are growing daily. In order to continue to offer the individual-centered tutoring and ESL lessons, and expand our programs to reach the immigrant families still in need of our services, CIANA needs you! Every little bit goes a long way. Thank you!

 

What if I can't give money? 


All we ask for is a dollar, but if you just don't have the funds we understand. 

Still want to help? 

Share our website and campaign on Twitter/Facebook!

Contact us to volunteer your time! 

Send some mental love our way!

story: My name is Taina Glasgow and my husband's name is Dwayne. We have been attempting to have a child for 6 years, and have failed due to medical reasons. We need your help to fund a round of in-vitro fertilization. We plan to adopt in the near future but we would like to be blessed with a biological child as well. Dwayne and I have known each other since the 8th grade and been married since 2007, we have plenty of love and are more than ready to share it by expanding our family. We want to thank all of you in advance for our contribution.

We want to thank all of you in advance for our contribution.

story:
This campaign is 100% AHPRA COMPLIANT 

Imagine being part of a NATIONAL CAMPAIGN that gave Chiropractic access to the premium media space that big brands use for less than 1% of the traditional cost...but the longer you wait to join our Independently funded Chiropractic Campaign, the more expensive it gets...


                                  Please read on to find out about the campaign

                The only way we can achieve this is by pooling our funds together

                        but only ONE chiropractor can participate in each suburb


                          CLICK HERE TO SEE THE LIST OF SECURED SUBURBS

     
We will introduce the Australian public to Chiropractic like never before

keep reading to find out more...

So, here's how it works
We will be pooling our money together
so that we can access the mainstream media


 
Using Advertising Banner Campaigns that only the BIG BUDGETS get access to

          

                  

We will target the perfect demographics of

health orientated audiences



on premium websites


and no deals will be offered


through a variety of banners

and


our campaign will drive people to a central website


where only 1 participating chiropractor will be shown
        

                
                                  
and then encourages them to call THAT local Chiropractor

                            

The campaign will be run by NewsCorp Australia and Partners and have access to the largest online marketplace of premium advertising inventory, including a highly trained Social marketing team and Google Certified Advertising Managers.                            
The campaign will be far reaching for best results:

                         
                          
We use a proven method to direct clients to your office

                    
                         
If you don't have a website, it doesn't matter because we will create one for you

                                              

so everything is measured for success


How many times your details were shown, how many people clicked on your advert and how many people called your business so you know how effective it is.

You can download the NewsCorp media kits using the links below:
  • NewsCorp Xtend
  • Sample Case Study

CAMPAIGN LAUNCH DATE

Once this campaign has reached it's target and the funds have been transferred to Client Source Pty Ltd, Client Source will then sign a contract with NewsCorp Pty Ltd and then be able to book the media placement.

All participants will be notified once the media has been booked.

CAMPAIGN OBJECTIVE

1/ Drive qualified patients to participating clinics
2/ Increase Chiropractic awareness

HOW WE WILL MEASURE THE SUCCESS

This is a performance based direct response campaign and results will be measured using the following KPIs:

1/ Number of advert impressions
2/ Facebook engagement (likes, shares, comments)
3/ Click through rate
4/ MOST IMPORTANT: Calls to your individual practice

PROFESSIONAL MANAGEMENT

Advertising: The 630 Agency

Campaign Management: NewsCorp

Call Tracking: Client Calls

WHAT IF IT WORKS

As with any advertising, there is no guarantee of results but the combination of top tier professionals and the combined experience there is a good chance of success. So if it works well, you will have the option to join the next campaign too.

WILL CHIROPRACTORS SUPPORT THIS

We only need about 100 Chiropractors (out of 4,684 practicing across Australia) to each contribute $499 to make this campaign a reality.

WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH OUR TARGET

If we don't reach our target then all monies will be returned less 9% Indigogo.com fees and the 5% PayPal fees. That's about a $70 risk or less than 2 adjustments.

YOUR RISK IN PERSPECTIVE

$499 is less than 1 new patient, who visits your office 10 times. Assuming that you are charging $70 for the initial visit and $50 for a regular visit..or about 2 hours of your time!

To place a single advert in the local newspaper costs about the same, with very limited success - because we all know that you need to run your advert constantly for weeks on end.

*NEW CLIENT CALLS

Each participating Chiropractor / Clinic receives a dedicated smart telephone number, that is diverted through our system, directly to your office. Our patent pending technology can identify if a caller is NEW or something else.

OUR GUARANTEE

As we can only control the user journey up to the point where we connect the caller to your clinic, our responsibility ends when the call is diverted to you.  

We have no control over your office hours, your out-of-office handling procedures, front desk or customer service.

We guarantee that we will send you at least 5 NEW CLIENT CALLS. However we cannot guarantee that you will convert those callers into paying clients.

We will send you all caller ID's, dates and times of calls and we can even record all the calls for you (it's on by default but we can turn that off for you on request.)

If you don't get at least 5 NEW CLIENT CALLS then we will continue to keep your website landing page live (the one we used for the campaign link) until you receive the 5 calls.


The level of reach and exposure required to achieve results is expensive and is not something that an Association is responsible for nor is it financially feasible nor geographically practical for an individual or small group to attempt on their own.


MANY WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE!

Even if you don't have the money right now, you can help us turn the National  Chiropractic Campaign into a reality by sharing this campaign with your friends. Just click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons and let the world know about our awesome Campaign!

We only need about 100 Chiropractors (out of 4,684 practicing across Australia) to each contribute $499 to make this campaign a reality.
WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH OUR TARGETIf we don't reach our target then all monies will be returned less 9% Indigogo.com fees and the 5% PayPal fees. That's about a $70 risk or less than 2 adjustments.YOUR RISK IN PERSPECTIVE$499 is less than 1 new patient, who visits your office 10 times. Assuming that you are charging $70 for the initial visit and $50 for a regular visit..or about 2 hours of your time!To place a single advert in the local newspaper costs about the same, with very limited success - because we all know that you need to run your advert constantly for weeks on end.




*NEW CLIENT CALLSEach participating Chiropractor / Clinic receives a dedicated smart telephone number, that is diverted through our system, directly to your office. Our patent pending technology can identify if a caller is NEW or something else.


OUR GUARANTEE
As we can only control the user journey up to the point where we connect the caller to your clinic, our responsibility ends when the call is diverted to you.  
We have no control over your office hours, your out-of-office handling procedures, front desk or customer service.
We guarantee that we will send you at least 5 NEW CLIENT CALLS. However we cannot guarantee that you will convert those callers into paying clients.
We will send you all caller ID's, dates and times of calls and we can even record all the calls for you (it's on by default but we can turn that off for you on request.)
If you don't get at least 5 NEW CLIENT CALLS then we will continue to keep your website landing page live (the one we used for the campaign link) until you receive the 5 calls.




The level of reach and exposure required to achieve results is expensive and is not something that an Association is responsible for nor is it financially feasible nor geographically practical for an individual or small group to attempt on their own.
MANY WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE!Even if you don't have the 
money right now, you can help us turn the National  Chiropractic Campaign into a reality by 
sharing this campaign with your friends. Just click on any of the 
Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons and let the world know 
about our awesome Campaign!

story:
Help Nepal 

Abril 2015 un Sismo en Nepal mato a mas de 6 mil personas, mas de 160 mil hogares destruidos , mas de 3 millones de personas sin acceso a agua potable y de calidad. 

Para water4happiness el acceso a agua limpia es un derecho humano, por ello llevaremos sistemas de purificación que consisten en un Ion ag (bactericida que no dosifica ningún químico) un bebedero rustico. ( sistemas sin necesidad de electricidad, mantenimiento y bajo costo duración de dos años de vida) 
Esta campaña va dirigida a 26 familias en situación vulnerable 147 personas incluyendo 52 niños.
Es importante lograr este impacto ya que es una solución con replicas positivas principalmente para erradicar enfermedades gastrointestinales en niños menores de 5 años , el cual ya se ha llevado a diferentes puntos de México e  India. 
Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
  • Necesitamos de tu apoyo para esta causa que no solo afecta a Nepal sino al mundo y obtén la garantía y satisfacción que absolutamente todos los donativos llegaran a estas familias, dándote detalles de nombres y fotografías de ellos dando gracias. 

El impacto

Hemos replicado estos proyectos con éxito en comunidades indígenas de México e India, www.water4happiness.org  (ver video)

 Llevando agua limpia y confiable a familias en situación vulnerable 


Riesgos y desafíos

El desafió de estos proyectos que emprendemos es principalmente la problemática que tiene el mundo para abastecer a la población del vital liquido, así como la geografía de algunos países y territorios. No podemos llegar al mundo entero pero podemos lograr algo en pasos, pasos cortos pero precisos. 


Si no puedes ayudar con fondos lo puedes hacer difundiendo la campaña , ayúdanos a llegar a las personas a ser mas fuertes como sociedad y comunicar los problemas del mundo.

story:
About

We are a website providing individuals an opportunity to both offer and receive services independent of established businesses, organizations, governments, or schools. Our goal is to allow individuals to teach, serve, and consult one another.

 Assist Others Empower Yourself

Our Vision

Our vision at Assistance is to create the largest, most comprehensive online market for the individual service economy. We want individuals to apply their unique knowledge, abilities, and passions in a creative, entrepreneurial marketplace. 

How it Works

Assistanceus.com is a website where individuals offer services to other individuals independent of formal businesses, organizations, governments, or schools. It allows individuals to teach, serve, and consult other individuals through a virtual marketplace driven by the entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to empower one’s self while assisting others. We want you to leverage your passions by providing services so that others can learn from your experience and knowledge, and you can earn income for doing so.

Providing Services: Assistance is an online market, one that gives you exposure to a national and international customer base. Providers list their specialized services through the site. Assistance bridges the gap between professionalism and individuality. Service providers will find future clients, develop relationships, use an online payment system, and receive reviews. Partnerships are built on more than economic practicality and incentive, but through a mutual desire to empower and assist the individual.

Receiving Services: For those seeking services, be they virtual or in-person, Assistance provides a market that will connect you with the individual who can help you. Users are not required to create an account until they find a service that they wish to make an initial payment for and begin assisting others and empowering themselves. Once an account is created it can be used for all further transactions and service listings.

Payment System: All users receiving or depositing payments and writing reviews need to have an account. The secure account system will require users to add basic personal information and a payment method.  Those offering services can customize their profiles by indicating their level of education, experience in their field, reviews from past clients, and much more. The more services a user provides the more their status will rise on the site.

story:
Greetings, My Name is Sebastian Vitale. I've been Growing most of my life (not just plants, but communities, and personally). I am now trying to bring education and fresh herbs to the New Orleans area. My intentions are to help neighborhoods rehab open lots into lush Green Spaces, which can provide food and relaxing environments. Also, to offer places for people to gather outdoors for positive goals.



Currently, I'm working with others on a few lots around the city. I am hoping to get a space for this business to call it's own. I am in need of upgraded business tools as well (i.e. computer equipment, dehydrators, tools, building materials, et cetera). I will be working with local small businesses to supply the perks listed. Trying to improve the local economy as well! Hopefully all perks will be shipped before Christmas, but may not go out til New Years.


The Impact, this project will have, hopefully will be community building, education with a hands on focus, and a greater sense of well being for all involved! I am hoping to offer a space for younger people to learn a vocational training in growing. Also a space where older people can enjoy sharing their knowledge and skills!  Locally grown herbs and produce are better for you, and the local economy. Greater focus on Green Spaces, help everyone. More plants equal more fresh air, which leads to better living!


I understand not everyone can contribute financially, but sharing the word and link for this page/program is the greatest contribution I could ask for! Another way, anyone could help is plant a tree, garden, plants in general! Thank you All for your time, and help!

story:
SUMMARY OF PROJECT

We are Fundación En Vía, a non-profit organization working to fight poverty and support community development through responsible tourism in Oaxaca, Mexico. We do this by using funds from tourism to provide interest-free microloans and educational programs to women and their families in largely indigenous communities.

Our microloan program gives women the opportunity to create or expand small businesses, empowering them to better provide for themselves and their families. Also, since the average interest rate on a standard microloan in Mexico is 74.2%, the highest in all of Latin America, our interest-free loans provide a far better option for women working to get themselves and their families out of poverty.

Our educational programs provide the women with the knowledge to make better financial decisions in order to fully capitalize on their loans.

Our responsible tourism financing-model gives visitors an opportunity to both support the economic advancement of these women and their families, and learn about Oaxacan communities and their customs. 

OUR BORROWERS

We are currently working in five villages outside of Oaxaca City: Teotitlán del Valle, San Jerónimo Tlacochahuaya, Villa Díaz Ordaz, San Sebastián Abásolo and Santo Domingo Tomaltepec.

Our programs have supported over 300 women, and these borrowers have used their interest-free loans to invest in their businesses/projects.

These hardworking and resourceful entrepreneurs have a variety of different skills and activities. They are bread and tortilla makers, seamstresses, market vendors (selling things such as cheese, poultry, and vegetables), farmers, artisans, food vendors and much more!

The women use their microloans to start or improve their businesses. For example a woman may invest in a flock of chicks to raise and sell; purchase a grill to start selling tacos; invest in wool and dye to make artisanal textiles; or buy a measuring scale and bulk bags of beans and corn, for her small home-based convenience store, allowing her to sell them by the kilo to customers.

These communities are often marginalized from access to services and development of infrastructure.  A few statistics paint a picture of the economic status of these communities: 

  • Households with dirt floors: from 7% to 37%
  • Women in our program with a primary education: 65%
  • Women in our program with high school education or higher: 16%

A small amount of money can make a big difference.

SUSTAINABLE TOURISM EN VÍA STYLE

We lead tours comprised of visitors primarily from the US, Canada, Australia and Europe into the communities where we work. Tour participants have the chance to meet our borrowers, learn about their loans and project plans, and offer support for their success.

We use 100% of the tour fees to provide interest-free microloans.  

Repaid loans then go to support our various educational programs such as English and business classes, new loans, and administration costs, including an annual van rental cost of approximately $10,000 – which is the equivalent of 100 first-time loans. 

The tours provide a special glimpse of life in Oaxaca including different artisanal trades, traditional foods, and an introduction to local customs and way of life. Whether talking about business plans or wedding customs, hearing the ancient Zapotec language, or seeing the preparation of chapulines (grasshoppers -- a local food favorite), the tours provide the opportunity to cross cultural boundaries and connect people to people.

These tours fund 86% of our interest-free microloans and are crucial to our mission of fighting poverty and empowering women entrepreneurs to succeed on their own terms.

WHAT WE’RE ASKING FOR

Since 100% of tour fees and loan repayments go first to fund our loan and educational programs and then to cover our administrative costs, we have launched our Indiegogo campaign to buy a van.

By owning our own van we will reduce our total annual operating costs by 10%.

With the amount we pay yearly on renting the van we could give out 100 first-time loans to women borrowers who are currently waiting for the chance to participate. This is money that women could be using right now to invest in businesses that support their families and communities!

IMPACT

En Vía’s programs have a positive impact on the individual women borrowers, their families and entire communities. Our borrowers have been able to launch, expand and diversify their own businesses through interest-free loans.

Equally important to the loans, our educational classes have given our borrowers the tools and support to better manage their finances and build confidence to run their businesses.

The profits gained from improved business practices can make the difference in providing a fully nutritious meal for their family, improving living conditions, or sending the first member of the family to high school. 

As more borrowers join our foundation, communities are being strengthened one woman, one business, and one family at a time. The phrase “En Vía” can be translated as “on the path,” and these women are, step by step, on the path to greater economic and personal empowerment.

We hope you will join us in our efforts to support more women as they bring themselves and their families out of poverty.

Learn more about En Via at http://www.envia.org. 

A special thanks to Joe DeFrancesco for putting togethr our video. As well, a very special thanks to Joyce McKinney for all her work on this campaign, and for having the idea to do it!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone and welcome to our story.  My name is Andrew VonFrank.  I have worked in the service industry for all of my adult life.  From carpentry to bicycle mechanic/sales to catering and tent rentals for parties and weddings, I have worked for these companies and owned and operated a building business as well as a tent rental company.  Underlying the work, I have been a passionate sailor since I bought my first sailboat, at the age of 23.

With the help and support of my wife, Sarah, and my young son, Ian, as well as close friends, I have been able to start a change in career.  What started as a dream to  sail across the ocean, has  given me the opportunity to turn my passion for sailing into a  career.

It has been a difficult road both emotionally and financially to get where we are today.  We have made an epic trip from the Azores(where we purchased our boat) to the Canary Islands, across the Atlantic to Sint Maarten, then solo back to Maine.

We now need some financial support to follow this through.  We are going to offer our boat, with me as Captain, for sailing charters with locally sourced food for as little as a few hours sail up to offshore experiences depending on guests chosen itinerary. 

Sailing has the ability to change lives through its simplistic idea of traveling by an unseen but  powerful force; the wind.   The unbelievable throws of emotion one has to tackle, especially to be a, "Bluewater" sailor, are to be thrown into the heights of adventure and adrenaline, down to the lows of fear and loneliness.  With your help, I want to share these stories to others and show folks just how beautiful our coast of Maine is from the sea.


What We Need & What You Get

I have set a goal of 25K to be put toward many items on the list to get Shadowfax in top condition to receive her first charter guests.  Her immediate needs are to get hauled out of the water and brought back to our house, so I can start the engine overhaul and prep for paint in the spring.   I would love to re-power with electric drive and lithium batteries, recharged by solar, thus the large funding goal.  We also need to create a website for the business, which I already own the domain name, "sailingshadowfax.com."  Also, we need to cover costs such as insurance, and licencing.  The more we raise, the more can be used to hire local people to do what they do best, and help our small economy here in Maine. 
We will be offering perks of coasters, soaps and glasses that my wife and I will be making ourselves.  For higher amounts we will be offering days of charter.

If we do not reach our goal, we will at the very least, be making steps towards making this dream a reality sometime in the near future.

The Impact

I want to introduce and re-introduce sailing at a price point that people can afford.  With help from our friends and community we want others to have a great experience and possibly a lifelong passion.   I think it is important to see the world we live in, from the perspective of the sea and our impact on it. 
There aren't words to express the feeling from raising sails, peeling off a mooring and heading out to sea with no engine noise, only the rush of water and the wind in the sails.

Risks & Challenges

Many of the risks are behind us.
However, we have a short sailing season here in Maine and the weather for sailing won't always be in our favor.  That is why we are also going to include some great food and music on those days when folks just may want to sit on the mooring enclosed in the cockpit having a warm cup of soup.  Through our own knowledge and the vast knowledge of friends that have done many sailing and kayaking trips, we know of many quiet anchorages for those in need of a quiet repose and we also are in touch with finding great places along the coast that have live music right on the waterfront.
Shadowfax does have a heater down below to take the chill off those early mornings and should extend our sailing season well in to fall and early in the spring. 
We also plan to recognize and offer the suggestion of travel insurance for those that plan an extended trip. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a financial contribution of your own, and even if you do, please help us send out the word of our plans.  This site has tools to share this with friends, family and colleagues.  Thanks you so much for your time and thanks in advance for your support, financial or otherwise!
