story:
We did it - come see what happened next!

In 2010, we ran a successful campaign to seed fund StartSomeGood, a crowdfunding platform for social innovation. Our campaign on indiegogo was just the first of many lessons we've learned in what it takes to run a raise funds and build a community of supporters with crowdfunding. If you have an idea that will change the world for the better, visit us at StartSomeGood.com. We have the tools, the knowledge and the passion to help you make it happen. 

January 17 Update: 60 Hours to Go!

We're thrilled to have surpassed our initial goal, but we are still raising funds beyond our $2,000 target.  Why? It's simple: there's still so much more good to accomplish.  Your donations to our campaign are more than just financial help: they are a vote in support of social innovation.  Because your donation comes with a FREE giftcard to use on our site, it's a way of proving that there's a community ready to help other great social enterprises launch.  These last 60 hours provide you with a chance to do double-the-good with your donation: you will help our dream of StartSomeGood become a reality, while simultaneously creating an initial community-driven commitment to our launch-partner ventures.  
 
Thank you everyone for the incredible support.  Your donations, offers to volunteer and suggestions of ideas and connections mean so much to us.  
 
A heartfelt thanks to everyone for truly helping us "Start Some Good!"

Our Story

We are four UCLA Bruins and an Australian dude, and we are building StartSomeGood.com to leverage the power of the crowd to empower people from around the world to launch their own social enterprise.There are so many people with ideas for how they want to make a difference in the world, yet they lack the resources that they need to get started.  StartSomeGood connects budding social entrepreneurs with the financial and intellectual capital that they need -- all in a fun, engaging and community-driven way.  Our site taps into the power of the crowd, allowing social entrepreneurs to ask for small amounts of money from lots of different people -- just like here on IndieGoGo -- rather than hope for one lump sum.  It's crowdfunding for social enterprises, but we've also got a few tricks up our sleeve!

 

What Makes Us Unique

The crowdfunding model is becoming increasingly popular -- especially in the arts-world -- and we believe it is perfect for supporting the growth and development of social enterprise. Here's what makes StartSomeGood stand out from the pack:

  • We focus on social enterprises and organizations, as opposed to other "social good fund-raising" sites where people raise money for things like running a marathon for charity.  Though those sites are great too, we are looking to help launch the type of organizations that will create long-term, meaningful change in the world.

 

  • We have created a hybrid crowdfunding model unique to the needs of a social enterprise.  Social entrepreneurs select a "tipping point" -- the amount of money that is necessary to start doing good -- and fund-raising up until this point is done in an all-or-nothing way.  Supporters pledge funds, but are only charged if a venture reaches its tipping point goal by its deadline.  Beyond the tipping point, though, we allow the venture to raise additional funds -- limited only by the same time deadline -- and keep all funds raised beyond the tipping point.  This empowers social entrepreneurs to tap into the power of the crowd  to launch their venture as well as to begin creating real change in the world.
  • We provide a platform for launching brand new social enterprises, unlike other sites that focus on fund-raising for already-established organizations.
  • In addition to launching a social enterprise on our site, we support the ongoing launch of projects and new endeavors by a social enterprise using the same hybrid, tipping-point crowdfunding model.  We give social enterprises a dynamic home for launching their crowd-powered projects both at the start and into the future.
  • We recognize that starting a social enterprise takes more than just money; it takes people!  We connect social entrepreneurs with people from around the world who want to use their talents for good.  Are you a social enterprise looking for an hour or two of pro-bono legal help?  Maybe you're a graphic designer looking to use your Photoshop skills for good.  We connect do-gooders with social enterprises that need help getting launched, creating exciting opportunities to contribute. 

 

By focusing on the combination of these things, we make StartSomeGood stand out from the pack, and well-positioned to be a force in driving meaningful change in the world through social enterprise. 

 

The Impact

Social entrepreneurship is a movement that is growing rapidly in popularity and awareness, yet according to Change.org, 72% of social entrepreneurs say that access to capital is their greatest challenge.  Though funds exist for organizations that are already off the ground, so many brilliant, game-changing ideas never come to life because of the hurdles that exist for starting a social enterprise.  StartSomeGood seeks to simplify things, based on the premise that we want more people to do more good in the world.  We lower the barriers to entry of starting a social enterprise, and connect social entrepreneurs with the people, passion, ideas and support they need to do great things in the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We've got a great team, ambitious plans and a ton of energy, but your support will allow us to get the word out and conduct innovative and exciting outreach strategies.  Your financial support will be used to found our StartSomeGood Ambassadors program which recruits people passionate about social enterprise and allows them to leverage our platform to reach out to their networks to help people start their own ventures.  Your support will be especially key in our outreach to University students where we seek to get ambassadors from leading colleges to help grow the social entrepreneurship movement via StartSomeGood on campuses nation-wide.  Additional funds will be used for smart and targeted advertising campaigns, including Google Adwords and Facebook ads.  Your support will bring the results of our countless hours of outreach and marketing brainstorming to life!

 

Your donation today has the ability to start good in more ways than one. In addition to recognition on our site as an early supporter, you'll also get a gift certificate to use on our site!  Once StartSomeGood is launched, you'll be able to use your gift credits to find the venture that speaks to you and give them a boost just like you did with us.   You'll help get our site off the ground today so that we can help others start good.  Then, once our site is launched and filled with lots of ventures for improving the world, you'll be able to reinvest part of your initial donation via a gift certificate to help others do good as well.  Your support today is an investment not only in us, but also in other great social enterprises that will launch on our site.  StartSomeGood by paying it forward!

 

 

Sneak-Peak

As an early supporter of StartSomeGood, we're excited to show you a glimpse at what our site will look like once it is built (with your support, of course)!
 
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are a social enterprise ourself, and we wouldn't be where we are today without the incredible support from our family and friends who have provided us with ideas, support, legal advice and more.  Are you as excited about StartSomeGood as we are?  We'd love to hear from you.  Email alex@startsomegood.com to learn more about the roles we have for people that want to be a part of our mission, or tell us what YOU do best.  

 

 

Questions?

We're happy to answer them!  Ask your questions in the comments section, and we'll answer them here for all to see.  
 
Question: Are you a 501(c)3?
Answer: Nope, we are a socially-conscious for-profit business.  We plan to apply for B-Corporation certification shortly to signify this status.
story_txt:
We did it - come see what happened next!

In 2010, we ran a successful campaign to seed fund StartSomeGood, a crowdfunding platform for social innovation. Our campaign on indiegogo was just the first of many lessons we've learned in what it takes to run a raise funds and build a community of supporters with crowdfunding. If you have an idea that will change the world for the better, visit us at StartSomeGood.com. We have the tools, the knowledge and the passion to help you make it happen.

story:
The art of Stacy is the registered business of freelance artist Stacy Parker. I had to register to be able to sell at conventions and such. I do fantasy and nature art, mainly in digital form, but also real media, including pencils and needle felting. 

Since 2012 The art of Stacy has appeared at Shockacon, a WV horror and Sci-fi convention. The convention has only been around since then. As a WV native, being a part of a convention that so nicely fits the theme of my work is very important, especially since it is in my hometown. 

I not only have been affected by the WV water crisis, I have the age old problem of having a hard time selling my art. Conventions are always where I sell the most art, usually doing super well. I just need funds to register my table, and make things for the con. 

What We Need & What You Get

My first and foremost goal is $150 to register a table. for a 3 day con, that is a great price. (update, there was a typo here, but I am nearly at my $150 (at 110 at this writing) so It is all good 

Then I need supplies, such as more roving to needlefelt with, and display materials, like bags to put my prints in. Not to mention funds to actually print them with. 

If you choose to help contribute, not only will you help a small time artist live her dreams, you also help support a local community, by supporting their local convention. This convention helps bring in tourism, and help revitalize a community hurting after a really big crisis. My table fee helps them be able to make the con bigger and better. 

Also, I always like to work for my money, so if you contribute, I draw for you.

story:
What Am I Doing in India?

I'm going to India for a fellowship with an awesome non-profit called Swami Vivekananda Youth Movement. SVYM's mission is to build a new civil society in India by promoting local, innovative, and cost effective solutions to community problems. They do some really incredible work in education, health, and economic development at both the grassroots and the policy level. Check out this nice (if slightly hokey) CNN India profile on SVYM's founder, Dr. Balasubramaniam here.

The Deets

From May through August, I will be living in Sargur, a small town in the Mysore District of Karnataka, India. During these 3 months, I'll have a chance to observe, participate in, and document SVYM's economic empowerment and rural health programs to help them refine their approach, communicate their goals, market their cause, and expand their impact.

Why Am I Doing It?

I'm doing this because I believe that organizations like SVYM are the future of countries like India. I am fascinated by their community-driven model of change, and excited by the challenge of telling their story in a way that is compelling to a wider global audience.

How You Can Help

This trip is 100% self-funded. I will be covering all of my travel, living, medical, and all other expenses, so anything you can contribute will help me out enormously.

 

The Cost Breakdown

 

Plane ticket: $1,468

Visa: $130

Housing: $1,875

Food: $600

In-country travel: $200

Want to help but can't donate? 

No worries! Just by sharing this page with your friends, family, and coworkers, you are expanding my network of connections and helping me fund my fellowship!

story:
Short Summary

 

I am an aspiring photographer with the motivation and the competitive nature to provide the best service available to my customers.

Several years back when I worked in a studio, I had an unforgettable experience with one of my customers. The first time they came in was to have photos taken of their newly born daughter. A year later, on their daughter's birthday, they came back with a photo I had taken the previous year. I noticed that they only brought their four year old daughter with them to the studio. I soon learned that three months after the original photoshoot, the baby passed away. 

During the emotional photoshoot, the older daughter posed with the photo I had taken of their youngest a year prior. The whole time the parents were in tears. My first son just so happened to have been born about a month before this. During this shoot, I was speaking with the parents about what all happened and the connection we made was unreal. Even today, just writing this, I cannot help but tear up when I think about them. Having so much emotion behind a photo and the story is why I can't do anything but this. I love it and nothing will change that. I love the feeling I get after making that personal connection with my "customers." At that point they aren't a customer, they are much more. 

There is a service I would like to volunteer for called "Now I Lay Me Down to Sleep." It is a organization that connects parents with photographers free of charge to take photos with their babies who didn't make it. I cannot think of a better way to volunteer my time and services. It really is an amazing program. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

I am looking at raising $5000 to get started with.

Break down of where your funding is going. (These are a ball park price without shopping around to find cheaper sources, which I intend to. Also, tax and shipping has not been figured in the following base numbers.)

  • Bowens Gemini 1000w total two light setup with remote and travel pack, stands, softbox, umbrella: $1,784
  • Canon 70-200 F/2.8 (Instead of getting two seperate lenses (one for portrait, and and a telephoto for action, I have decided to get one to save on cost.) $1,349
  • Adobe Lightroom: $80
  • Battery grip for my camera: $50
  • 42" 5n1 Reflector w/stand $75
  • Trigrip Diffuser: $60
  • Sekonic L-358 Light meter: $309 

TOTAL FOR THE ABOVE IS $3707.00, but I will continue to shop around and get the lowest price possible.

 

  • Business cards: 5000 for $45.70 (gotprint.com)
  • Door Hangers: 500 to test $97.08 (gotprint.com)
  • Flyers: 5.5x8.5 1000 for $88.82 (gotprint.com)
  • Site at zenfolio.com $250/year
  • Email: Domain w/Google Business $10
  • Online Backup: $47.40/year
  • Mobile marketing app: Stickyphoto $166/year

Total for Marketing is $695.00

The leftover amount would be applied towards taxes, shipping, and any unforseen expenses or any price changes.

If I do not reach my goal, I will have to do some major trimming. I want to deliver my customers with the highest quality product I can. The lens and lights are my biggest ticket items and also the most important for what I am doing. Every little bit helps, If I have to make more cuts than I already have then I will. Everything listed above will allow me to fully jump in and take on a wide variety of jobs.

The Impact

With your contribution, not only will you allow me to get my dream off the ground, but I will provide the kind of service that I think only I can provide.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know it's not possible for everybody to contribute monetarily but please share with anybody you can. If you have advice you would like to share, I am open minded to anything that comes my way. Also, if you know of any sources for equipment or other useful items that would help me in my endeavor, please share.

story:
I strongly believe that building an informed and engaged community is the only way that lasting social change will ever take place. The organizers from around the country will attend the “Localize This” training offered by the Backbone Campaign (localizethis.org) to accomplish this.  As an organizer, I want to learn new skills, so I can implement best practices in my own community.  I first met the Backbone Campaign crew in Denver and later in D.C. Their artful activism is unique and inspiring. They specialize in the creation of spectacle imagery, innovative messaging and political theater through festival arts, flash mobs, music and other theatrical forms of nonviolent direct action. Upon completing this training, I will go back to my community and use my skills to help others come forward to make a difference.

My Story

Before hiding in my usual excuse of “what can one person do?” I decided to open my eyes and see what’s happening all around me. The picture was ugly and forced me to see many unpleasant facts:  For example, my best friend died for lack of health care. At first I thought this was an extreme case, but later I found that her story is very common. The lack of health insurance is responsible for 45,000 preventable deaths in USA each year according to a studypublished in 2009 by the Harvard Medical School.  Instead of creating a single payer health care system which is most humane and most feasible, President Obama and U.S. legislators created a mandate to buy private health insurance. What the recent Supreme Court ruling really means is that corporations now can use federal law to force people to buy their products.

As an immigrant, I saw that the real engine that drives immigration is the demand for cheaper labor to boost profits, so much that for years capitalists have sent trucks to the U.S./ Mexican border to haul workers to the agricultural, meatpacking, construction jobs that educated Americans left behind.

I am still paying off the student loans for my education and see the student-loan debt is yet another leash for young people who worry about the cost of bucking authority, losing their jobs, and being unable to pay for their education.

As a native Middle Easterner, I found that all the wars in that region were caused by corporations exploiting those countries’ natural recourses.

As a teacher, I personally witnessed how schools educate for compliance and not for democracy. Obey orders blindly is the theme of today’s educational system. If the students refuse to follow orders, then they are diagnosed with some sort of disruptive disorder.

The list goes on. And for me, this is not a time to say “what can one person do?”  I believe that every Journey has a first step and small changes are a great way to start, because the quick successes will motivate us to keep going.  Therefore, I am focused on how I can be the change.

I have served as a project manager in a humanitarian organization for the Bam earthquake’s victims and I was responsible for construction of health houses, an obstetrics unit, an emergency room and a school building for the victims.  Later, I had a vested interest in health care education issues in regards to the single payer system (Improved Medicare for All). I have now created a Social Forum to organize, educate and empower people on critical issues; sharing knowledge; and teaching skills to build alternative and sustainable systems that better meet our human needs.  Through the Social Forum model, individuals reflect on their own purpose and how to make a difference, and finally, I hope to create the consciousness that we have the knowledge and skills and the power to create the change we desire.

Investing in Localize This!

The cost for attending this training is about $800; about $400 goes toward training and living expenses and an additional $400 to covers the ground transportation and airfare.

If you are unable to contribute, please help by asking folks to get the word out or by encouraging your friends to attend.

Upon completing this training, I will go back to my community and use my skills to help others come forward to make a difference.
My Story
Before hiding in my usual excuse of “what can one person do?” I decided to open my eyes and see what’s happening all around me. The picture was ugly and forced me to see many unpleasant facts:  For example, my best friend died for lack of health care. At first I thought this was an extreme case, but later I found that her story is very common. The lack of health insurance is responsible for 45,000 preventable deaths in USA each year according to a studypublished in 2009 by the Harvard Medical School.  Instead of creating a single payer health care system which is most humane and most feasible, President Obama and U.S. legislators created a mandate to buy private health insurance. What the recent Supreme Court ruling really means is that corporations now can use federal law to force people to buy their products.
As an immigrant, I saw that the real engine that drives immigration is the demand for cheaper labor to boost profits, so much that for years capitalists have sent trucks to the U.S./ Mexican border to haul workers to the agricultural, meatpacking, construction jobs that educated Americans left behind.
I am still paying off the student loans for my education and see the student-loan debt is yet another leash for young people who worry about the cost of bucking authority, losing their jobs, and being unable to pay for their education.
As a native Middle Easterner, I found that all the wars in that region were caused by corporations exploiting those countries’ natural recourses.
As a teacher, I personally witnessed how schools educate for compliance and not for democracy. Obey orders blindly is the theme of today’s educational system. If the students refuse to follow orders, then they are diagnosed with some sort of disruptive disorder.
The list goes on. And for me, this is not a time to say “what can one person do?”  I believe that every Journey has a first step and small changes are a great way to start, because the quick successes will motivate us to keep going.  Therefore, I am focused on how I can be the change.
I have served as a project manager in a humanitarian organization for the Bam earthquake’s victims and I was responsible for construction of health houses, an obstetrics unit, an emergency room and a school building for the victims.  Later, I had a vested interest in health care education issues in regards to the single payer system (Improved Medicare for All). I have now created a Social Forum to organize, educate and empower people on critical issues; sharing knowledge; and teaching skills to build alternative and sustainable systems that better meet our human needs.  Through the Social Forum model, individuals reflect on their own purpose and how to make a difference, and finally, I hope to create the consciousness that we have the knowledge and skills and the power to create the change we desire.
Investing in Localize This!
The cost for attending this training is about $800; about $400 goes toward training and living expenses and an additional $400 to covers the ground transportation and airfare.
If you are unable to contribute, please help by asking folks to get the word out or by encouraging your friends to attend.

story:
Who are we?

Hi! We are A Spoon Full of Sugar Childminders! Our names are Shannon and Sarah. We have both worked in childcare for over 10 years, either as ECE's in daycares, or as nannies.

We have learned so much in our time working with children and their families, and noticed a giant gap in the childcare in Manitoba. Most daycares are open 730 AM- 530 Pm Monday to Friday. So what about families who work shift work? Single parents that have longer days? Parents who need some time off to relax with other adults? That is where we come in.

What do we do?

We offer casual, part time, and full time childcare to those who need it. We are available 24 hrs a day, 7 days a week. We are never closed. We can accomodate short notice plans, and we can plan as far ahead as needed. Check out our site for more info! HERE Or our Facebook page HERE

Our goal for this campaign is to raise funds for families who are struggling to find affordable care for their children. Our services are not necessarily cheap as we only hire highly qualified sitters and nannies.

 All our employees have:

  • criminal record checks
  • child abuse registry checks
  • CPR and First Aid
  • references personally checked by the owners

 Our business is registered and insured. We would love to be able to help out families who need services but would not normally be able to afford them. Since we do not qualify for subsidy as we are not a day care, we needed to find another solution.

This is where you come in.

Any money donated will go directly to funding childcare for those who need it the most. You will be providing parents a chance to have a break, go look for jobs, get grocery shopping done, take care of themselves while their children are being safely cared for. You will be providing a service for a deserving family.

We are looking to raise $500 in this campaign. This will serve 5 families! It will provide those 5 families with approximately 6 hours of babysitting.


You can find testimonials written by families who have used us HERE

FAQ's straight from our website

story:
Grow Goldstar!

Why am I doing this? About ten years ago I found my way into this industry through curiosity then fell in love. After exploring every corner of cannabis and consuming as much knowledge as possible, it's time for me to spread my wings. Unfortunately, medical cannabis is a highly regulated industry and expensive to get into. This campaign will help me attain some of the basic building blocks necessary such as legal counsel and regulation consultants.

Goldstar Goals

  • Facility for cultivation and genetics breeding projects
  • Brick and mortar storefront
  • User database to help better understand effect on different body types
  • Arts collective to support and showcase emerging artists

Vision

To create a  cannabis collective that is a connoisseur experience with a focus on...

Quality- Goldstar strives to bring you the best cannabis in the world, from the best cultivators in the world.

Education-  Host cannabis tastings and workshops to get you familiar with a truly amazing plant.

Professionalism- Your third grade teacher was right: there is no stupid question. At Goldstar we will welcome everyone from the seasoned stoner to the first time patient. Whatever your experience level, you can rest assured that we will help you navigate the vast forest of Medical Cannabis.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just don't have the funds right now you could help tremendously by spreading the word. Share the Indiegogo link, like Goldstar on Facebook or just say, "Hi." :)

story:
Our Story

Like many new pet parents, you learn on the job.  Our pup, Melou was very shy and confused when he first came home with us.

We learned that the first few weeks your new pet is with you, they may have a tendancy to runaway out of confusion and a very important time to get him an ID tag right away.  Melou is micro-chipped but only Vets and shelters can read that information. 

We bought fancy metal ID tags and were startled in the middle of the night by the jingling of the tag.   This began our search for the quietest tag on the market.  We went through personalized collars which were great but he grew out of them and were expensive.  We bought the plastic ones which did not last long.  Then a pocket that the tags went inside – we lost 3 of them.  We began taping the tags together and that was dirty but it worked.  None of these was ever the one and we just removed the tags off Melou.   

Twigo Pet ID Tags was our solution

Twigo Pet ID tags are the ONlY tag on the market that is 100% Silent, made from silicone and self attach.  No jingling or jangling to drive you or your pet crazy. 

Our tags are simple to use,   Simply write, boil and wear.

Create a tag for your dog walker, pet sitter, daycare or bording facility.  You can even write a medical condition or an allergy.  Or even get creative on our tags.   

Twigo Tags are Unique, Fun and Vibrant.



What We Need & What You Get

We need  $6,000 to help pay for the cost of our new molds  Every penny will be used to pay for these molds. 

In return, you will get some of our existing tags, new products, re-usable bag and even a vintage leather cuff. 

To help you choose your perk

Re-usable Tote

New Love Tag

 

Vintage Leather Cuff


Customize-able Tag


    Twigo is growing

    • We are in 100 stores and 4 different countries.  
    • We have awesome PR and Marketing Plans that are generating new leads and creating a buzz about our brand.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      There are many ways to contribute! Even if you don't have the money right now, you can help us turn these headphones into a reality by sharing this Indiegogo campaign with your friends. Just click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons let the world know about our awesome headphones!

story:
The Bitcoin GR Project

Many of you may know me, and for those that do not my name is, Nigel Morford.  I am a Northview graduate, and currently working on obtaining my Bachelors degree in Finance.  I was born, and mostly raised, in the great city of Grand Rapids, and if any of you are like me, you too think that this city is great, and only wish to see it become greater.  I can remember growing up as a teenager, coming from Northview to downtown Grand Rapids, and always thinking about how beautiful the city was.  It always seemed like a treat, and it was somewhere I always wanted to be.  Whether it was on the boardwalk, the fish ladder, the amazing fireworks on the 4th of July, Blues on the Mall all summer, or just exploring the Amway Grand, I loved to be downtown.  Who remembers how exciting it was when the J.W. Merriott came in?  I do, it was great to see some new architecture around the city.  How about the new(er) farmers market?  If you have not been there it is great, there are a ton of friendly people, great deals, and great products.

Unfortunately, after returning from my six year military journey, I cannot help but feel left wanting.  Grand Rapids could be so much more, and I want to help make it that.  I want you to help me take our already great city, and make it more.  I am driven and motivated by this city, and its potential.  But even with all of the drive and motivation in the world, without money I cannot make much happen.

This campaign is just for that.  I want to use Bitcoins to help fund projects, events, and charities around Grand Rapids and the greater Grand Rapids area.  Every contribution counts.  If every person in Grand Rapids donated $1, on one day, we could raise almost $200,000.

What is a Bitcoin and how do we get them?

At this point you may be asking yourself "What is Bitcoin?", and simply put, it is a relatively new form of money, known as Crypo-currency, and is a speculator investment.  It is a digital dollar, and just like gold, and silver, these too can be mined.  But instead of pickaxes, and dynamite, our tools are super powered, algorithm solving machines networked together to solve complex problems in return for a piece of a bitcoin.  Once these machines are built and functioning they are basically money making machines, they mine 24/7 to collect Bitcoins.  At the moment I am writing this one Bitcoin is trading at $1,014 (https://www.mtgox.com/).  For deeper insight into the potential value of Bitcoin you can look at the recent market change.  Bitcoin went from trading at approximately $60 per coin to $1,200 over night.

What does it take to get a Bitcoin?  You have two options.  Option one, you can invest, purchase a Bitcoin at market price, and hope that prices inflate.  Option two, our option, which is to build a Bitcoin mining rig.  

Mining is measured in what is known as "Gigahash(s)".  According to coinminers.net, "

Basically a hash is a mathematical equation which is created in the hopes of solving within the Bitcoin and Litecoin mining process. A Bitcoin and Litecoin block is made when the mathematical equation is solved.  A specialized mining rig is designed to process massive amounts of mathematical equations per second. One Gigahash processes one BILLION hashes per second, pretty amazing computational power! And one Gigahash equals one thousand Megahash per Second."

Will this really make money?  Yes!  According to BitcoinX.com, we can currently make about $127.00/day with an investment of $1,200 (assuming a 300gh/s with a 175watt power consumption).  If we divide our $127 profit a day by $1,200 we get 0.105 cents/dollar invested.  So if we multiply our 11 cents by $5,000, we get a potential earnings of approximately $500/day. 

Note:  I think that $400 is a more accurate number.

The Impact

Can you imagine what an extra $500 a day could do for this community?   It could help restore buildings, feed the hungry, support parks, schools, events and so much more.  You can help me contribute, every dollar helps.  This project is ongoing, and will continue to be ongoing.  The great thing about Bitcoin mining is that we can build a functioning worker with just as little as $1,200 and we can always add additional parts onto it.  So every dollar after $5,000 still gets invested into the machine.  Invest in your community and help it flourish .

Unfortunately, this project like all others cannot be perfect.  As more and more mining takes place it becomes harder and harder to mine these coins.  This means that it will slowly, over time, become less and less profitable. There is also a limited amount of coins to be mined, and once all of them have been mined, that is it, there are no more to be mined.  There are also going to be associated electrical and maintenance costs.

But, there is also a small light in that dark hole.  There are other mineable crypto-currencies that are also quite profitable, Litecoin, being second only to Bitcoin, is a great example.

However, there is still time to invest in this market, and it is looking very bright.  Many companies already accept Bitcoin, and everyday in the news you hear something more.

For more information:

http://bitcoin.org/en/

http://techcrunch.com/2013/04/08/how-to-mine-bitcoins/


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share this with your friends, and on your social networks.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Batter Me Up is the first step in fulfilling my dream, owning my own food truck. The focus of Batter Me Up will be on “fair foods”. Menu items will include hand dipped corn dogs, hand battered onion rings, deep fried Snickers, Twinkies, and Oreos as well as funnel cakes. The plan is to start small by operating a food booth at local events in the St Helens area. Over the next couple of seasons I hope to build our clientele and transition into a class IV food truck.  

I would love your support in opening Batter Me Up so please take a look at the perks being offered. Also, don’t forget to stop on by one of our community events this summer and say hi.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to purchase LP gas fryers, Two general fryers and one corn dog fryer. The corn dog fryer is $1200.00 and the two general fryers are $300.00 each. In addition to the fryers I need to purchase a tent, coolers, tables, cooking utensils, and condiment containers.

story:
An Angel In Queens

Jorge Muñoz is an average Queens bus driver who hands out 100-120 meals every night on the corner of Roosevelt Ave and 73rd St in Queens, NY. Jorge has handed out these meals for almost ten years without fail and does so with the purpose of "stealing a smile from hunger." 

Jorge has been funding the mission out of his own pocket since day one- Almost ten years ago when he stopped to ask a couple of day laborers on the street if they had eaten and was moved by their answer when they told him that if they did not find work for that day then they would not eat that night. Now the mission has grown and over 100 people depend on him every night in order to not go to sleep without a meal in their stomachs. To this day, Jorge has handed out around 350,000 meals which has gained him recognition by President Obama (Citizen's Medal Award), CNN (Top 10 CNN Hero 2009), and various other organizations.

Jorge greatly depends on donations to keep the mission running as his income alone does not suffice. 

Jorge Needs Your Help

The $100,000 will all go towards the mission to buy the supplies required to hand out the meal (food, food containers, utensils, cooking supplies). Jorge's weekly expenses exceed well over $3,500- an amount he cannot bear on his own. The $100,000 would aid in the expansion of the mission and would help Jorge make sure that "no one goes hungry tonight."

The Impact

Your donation will greatly help feed hundreds of people who have to endure hunger in the cold and unforgiving New York winter. 

Many times we see people who are in need and do not know how to help. This is our chance to make a big difference in someone's life by providing them with a warm meal that is made with care.

Other Ways You Can Help

We thank you for taking the time to learn about Jorge's mission. In addition to monetary donations, Jorge can make very good use of the following items:

  • Food containers
  • Plastic Forks
  • Styrofoam Cups
  • Cooking Utensils
You can also share this campaign and spread the word about Jorge's (and now your) mission. Together we can make sure "no one goes hungry tonight"

story:
I am ali abuusaad from Gaza

Before the war, i was live on a tent

and when I intended to build a house to safe me from snakes and rodents
The war on Gaza was started and I could not build a house for a full one year from the start of the war because of the blockade and not to the entry of construction materials into the Gaza Strip, but the high price of available materials, which cost me a lot of money out of the ground and access to the roof
Now that this topic has reached phase of the development of the home have become 'incapable of completions for lack of money I have to complete the construction
Still I can not provide some cement and stones in order to get rooms that will inhabit inside me and my family 4 people
Mother, father and my sister, and I
And my brother's family, consisting of 9 people
4 girls and 2 boys and my brother and his wife
I now need to 5000 stone and 70 bag of concrete
Tools electricity like a power cord , water and paint 
and doors and windows

story_txt: I am ali abuusaad from GazaBefore the war, i was live on a tentand when I intended to build a house to safe me from snakes and rodentsThe war on Gaza was started and I could not build a house for a full one year from the start of the war because of the blockade and not to the entry of construction materials into the Gaza Strip, but the high price of available materials, which cost me a lot of money out of the ground and access to the roofNow that this topic has reached phase of the development of the home have become 'incapable of completions for lack of money I have to complete the constructionStill I can not provide some cement and stones in order to get rooms that will inhabit inside me and my family 4 peopleMother, father and my sister, and IAnd my brother's family, consisting of 9 people4 girls and 2 boys and my brother and his wifeI now need to 5000 stone and 70 bag of concreteTools electricity like a power cord , water and paint and doors and windowsall This stuff are available in the market in order to complete my work and succeedWith your help to me and to the humanityDo not be a shy if you helped a little bitAll of you generous people are part of this first step toward a better Gaza, so BIG THANKS, HUGS and LOVE to all of you! You make me believe in the world, and the good that is in it. Ali Abusaad

story:
Our Story

Just as the name suggests, we are a Christian maid service serving clients in ten counties throughout South Carolina.  In existence since 2009, we've done a great job operating from an office in the back of my home.  However, two years and a few (part-time) employees later, it is clear that office space is necessary.  It is now time to move forward but a lack of capital is an obstacle. Though I've raised some of the capital, $7,200 is still needed to make the move a complete success. 



What You're Funding & What You Get

We have located a 1,400 square feet building for lease, that is conveniently located downtown, and suitable for this stage of our growth!  Your contribution will fund the building's first month's rent and deposit; telephone system, and other office equipment; alarm system; and professional signage. I have identified the various levels of contributions and the gifts you will receive for your kindness.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! ;-)  God bless!

story:
Nearly two years after the devastating earthquake that struck Haiti on January 12, 2010, much of the country remains in ruins with millions of displaced people living in impossible conditions. The necessary grieving process for the 300,000 people that perished compounded by the loss of homes and livelihoods, has been interrupted by the sheer need of survival.


Ayiti Resurrect is a grassroots collective that formed in the aftermath of the earthquake based on principles of solidarity, creativity, and collective resilience. A team of visionary artists, community builders, and holistic healers with bloodlines in the Caribbean and African Diaspora, we have organized ourselves to work in collaboration with local Haitian organizations to facilitate psychological and spiritual healing for earthquake survivors. Through art, movement and music therapy, yoga and meditation, plant medicine, environmental sustainability initiatives, peer to peer counseling, and mental wellness clinics, Ayiti Resurrect is dedicated to transforming trauma through collective healing.


Between December 27, 2010 and January 16, 2011 Ayiti Resurrect in partnership with Ayiti Cherie Healing Project travelled to Cormier, a rural community in the state of Leogane, and partnered with local artists, community organizers, and healers to facilitate art and music therapy workshops, implement a mental wellness clinic, and commemorate the anniversary of the earthquake.


This first delegation and set of programs were such a success that our partners and participants in Cormier invited us to return. Ayiti Resurrect is now gearing up to travel to Haiti coinciding with the second anniversary of the earthquake to continue assisting the Comier community in charting their way back to wholeness, and forgiving the past to make way for a brighter, more promising future.


We've assembled an incredible team of holistic healers, artists, musicians, dancers, yoga instructors, permaculture gardeners and environmental innovators who will be traveling to Haiti during the first two weeks of January, working in collaboration with artists, healers and community builders living in Haiti, to implement a Mental Wellness & Stress Relief clinic, initiate an environmental sustainability education project, and facilitate art and music therapy workshops with and for quake survivors. Workshops and sessions will be organized by Haitians and international allies through collaboration and shared facilitation, and the coalescing of our energy, creativity and wisdom promises to be powerful!!!


Learn more about our delegate team, what we are offering, and our strategy for sustainability at www.ayitiresurrect.org. You can also find out more details about our history, past work, and the partnerships we have here and in Haiti.


Interconnected Roots

We are a grassroots endeavor of two communities coming together across bloodlines and continents to facilitate healing from within. We are not an NGO with foundational or institutional backing, we are representatives from our hometowns, our neighborhoods, and our lineages. Your support means everything as we engage in this all volunteer work dedicated to cultivating genuine people-to-people solidarity among members of the African diasporic family while reinforcing the strength and autonomy of the Haitian community.


Please considering making a donation to make possible this critical work, and see below for other ways to contribute to this mission. Through the realization of this project dedicated to transforming trauma through collective healing, we hope to contribute in a small but significant way to building a saner, more just existence for the future generations of all Haitians.



What We Need & What You Get


Our continued work hinges on raising enough funds to cover expenses on the ground, and to assist our Haitian partners, collaborators, and the community in general. We have $9834 left to raise before we depart!


HERE'S THE BREAKDOWN:

1) Airfare subsidies: $1500 (All but 2 of our 14 delegates are covering their own airfare, but we must raise money to support two collective members who have invaluable offerings and can't afford their flights)

2) Ground Transportation (for Haitian partners, to/from airport, & btw where we are staying & working): $2500

3) Food and Lodging International Delegates and Visiting Partners in Haiti: $3690

4) Food for Workshop Participants and Curriculum Building Meetings: $1000

5) Cups/Plates/Utensils: $300

6) Water: $100

7) Materials and Supplies for Workshops: $1000

8) Generator: $2000

9) Gas for Generator: $200

10) Translator stipends: $300

11) Print materials (business cards and fundraiser promo): $282

12) Certificates of Participation for Facilitators: $120

13) Monetary Contribution- to collaborating orgs in Haiti, and tips for drivers/cooks etc.: $800

14) Overhead (percentage of donations going to fiscal sponsor/Indiegogo/Pay Pal etc): $450


We have already raised $2638 from two successful fundraisers this fall (a holistic health fair in Brooklyn and a Fet Gede celebration in the Bay), $1425 from grant from the Giving Tree, and over  $1000 in individual donations prior to the launch of this campaign. We are confident we will be able to raise the remainder of our budget and nothing will stop us now!!!


Please help us reach our goal so that we can provide all of the support we intend to offer to our brothers and sisters in Ayiti. You will be blessed with our endless gratitude, rippling out from all of the hearts who will be impacted by this cross-continental collaboration, as well as some beautiful gifts as a tangible expression of our appreciation. Check out the awesome perks!



Other Ways You Can Help


1) Spread the word!-- Please help et the word out about Ayiti Resurrect and this campaign. Use the share tools to make it easy. Together we can do this!!!

2) Shop for a cause--Still need to do your holiday shopping??!! Use the link below to go to Amazon and if you purchase during that browser session 5% or more of your purchase gets donated to Ayiti Resurrect for the upcoming delegation this January. NO extra costs or hidden fee! http://amzn.to/vkyBgc

If you can find what you are looking for on Amazon shop on GoodShop.com. More than 2, 500 major brands, and over 100,000 coupons and discounts. A percentage of your purchase is donated to Ayiti Resurrect. Search below, enter the cause, donate and save with no extra cost or fee for you! SIMPLE. http://www.GoodShop.com

3) Donate your frequent flier miles-- 2 of our delegates participation (Daniel Brevil and Ajayi, drummers from Rara Tou Limen Bay Area Haitian Folkloric Dance Company) are contingent on support for their airfare. Their contribution will be invaluable, but they can't come unless they get support!

4) Sponsor a delegate-- all of the delegates from our U.S./diaspora team are paying for their airfare to and from Haiti, and all personal expenses, in addition to volunteering their time. We are committed to this model to ensure that all of our collective fundraising goes directly to the community in Cormier. That said, many of us are struggling to be able to afford these costs. Airfare is between $600 and 900, and lodging and food is $35 a day. Please consider support us in our commitment to working in Cormier.

5) Heal the healers-- consider making an offering specifically to delegates for self-care to prepare or rejuvenate from the trip. We will all be experiencing, giving, and taking in a lot, and it's crucial that we take care of our bodies and spirits in the process. Offerings for acupuncture, reiki, or massage to support our team would be greatly appreciated!

6) Donate a laptop-- members of the community of Cormier have asked for support and help to build a small computer lab in their community center. In a country where 100,000 computers go obsolete every day, consider donating an unused working laptop to realize this dream in a place where the closet computer is almost an hour away. We also need to raise $1000 more dollars to purchase a generator because there is no electricity in the area.

7) Donate art supplies-- consider donating materials for creative expression for children and teens.

8) Donate a boom box/CD player/mp3 player/speakers-- any battery operated music player and speakers that can live in the community center to provide healing grooves and festive rhythms to the place. Playlists/CDs also welcome!

9) Donate instruments, yoga mats, fabric-- and other workshop materials that you have or can acquire.

Contributions must be received by January 2nd. Thank you for any help you can offer!

Please contact us with your offerings at ayitiresurrect@gmail.com


We are truly grateful for all the support and blessings we have received and continue to receive. And we are thrilled and humbled to be doing this work with our brothers and sisters in Ayiti. We appreciate all of your prayers and meditations and continued blessings as we embark on another journey for collective healing.

With Love and Gratitude,

Naima, Angelique, & Beatrice
Ayiti Resurrect Core Collective

story:
Introduction

Hello, my name is Shruti Kapoor. I am the founder of Sayfty; a startup that helps women in India protect themselves against violence and abuse with the help of personal safety products, self-defense training & awareness.

The horrific gang-rape of a physiotherapy student in December 2012 in New Delhi, India shook me to the core. The brutality of the incident opened my eyes to the fact that India indeed is unsafe for women. While looking for information relating to women’s safety, I came upon a disturbing fact: In India, a woman is raped every 20 minutes. 

In 2011, India was voted the fourth most dangerous country for women according to a global poll by the Thomson Reuters Foundation. Over 24,000 rapes and 220,000 cases of molestation and abuse were reported, but experts believe the number of unreported cases is much higher.

For the average Indian woman, sexual abuse and harassment are also a part of her daily routine. From being leered at, to being groped, verbally abused and even masturbated on, women in India are at a constant threat of being sexually assaulted. Crowded streets, buses, trains and other public spaces are the most common locations for such assaults. Such public sexual harassment is colloquially called ‘eve teasing’ and has become so institutionalized in Indian society that more often than not, women are advised to ignore it. Most Indians don’t even view such behavior as abuse, but rather as a pesky reality of life in India.

I want to help and provide women in India the same sense of security I feel when I walk the streets of New York City. I feel free and I feel safe. A vast majority of women in India feel neither! I want to help by creating awareness. I want to help by equipping every woman in India with personal safety tools that are portable, effective, safe and easy to use. Tools like pepper spray that can be effective in warding off danger.

To do so, I need your help. These products are not ‘THE’ solution but they are “A” solution. A solution, that is quick, effective and immediate. The laws in India will change when they change and the government will take its time to fix things, but we cannot and must not wait. The presence of a personal safety tool along with appropriate mental and physical training will help these women become more aware and alert of their surroundings. Support me in this mission because an “alert”, “equipped” and an “educated” mind will lead to a safer body!

What We Need & What You Get

While personal safety items such as pepper spray and stun guns are common knowledge in countries like the United States, they are largely unheard of in India. Despite being legal, pepper spray is not readily available in most parts of the country. In cases where people are aware of its presence, they do not know where to buy it.

We at Sayfty wish to provide women in India with such items, so they can feel protected and empowered as they go about their daily activities.

Our aim is to equip 1800 women with a can of Pepper Spray each in Delhi & Mumbai. We will give 200 women in India access to self-defense classes. We have tied up with two companies (Justice for Women & Sportz 360 India Pvt. Ltd.) in Mumbai and Delhi that will provide 15 hours of self-defense training per woman.

To achieve our goal we need $25,000 in total

1 can of pepper spray will cost US $10
15 hrs of self-defense classes will cost US $35 per person

1800 women * 1 can ($10) = $18000

200 women * 1 self defense class ($35) = $7000

Total = $25,000

100% of money raised will go towards supplies, education and marketing around the issue of violence against women.

Why carry personal safety products

From April – July 2013, we interviewed 1200 respondents about how safe they felt in India. Over half admitted that they had been sexually assaulted/harassed at least once. Most respondents admitted that they would like to carry personal safety products.

A detailed report of our findings is available here.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you might not be able to help us monetarily. Don’t worry there are other ways in which you can make this project successful.

  • Contribute any amount to the campaign before January 31. 
  • Help us by promoting our campaign. Use Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and emails to spread the word about our campaign.
  • Volunteer for us. For more details check out our website.

Finally

We have repeatedly been asked, “What if attackers get a hold of pepper spray and use it to hurt victims?”

First of all, we are not simply handing cans of pepper spray to women and asking them to do with it as they please. We are educating them about usage, spreading awareness and via classes, giving them an opportunity to defend themselves. These are all resources that they do not currently have.

We are happy to address any concerns you may have via email.

story:
Wellness Adventure Tours

Halcyon Backpacking Company is excited to offer a new take on travel. We provide fully guided outdoor-adventure tours for young adults between the ages of 18 and 35 who are living with mental illness or their related symptoms. We offer the best of everything when it comes to travel: sight-seeing through world famous cities, the excitement of once-in-a-lifetime adventures, and the catharsis of outdoor living, all while having fun and improving health and well-being. We know that travelling alone can be an intimidating thought, especially if you are dealing with the symptoms of mental illness. By travelling with us you'll get a chance to meet like-minded people with the same struggles as you and then travel the world together with new friends.

We team up our tour guides with mental health professionals to provide a safe, friendly, and inclusive tour experience that will be highly enjoyable and have a positive impact on your well-being. Visit a museum, hike a mountain, swim in the ocean, all in the same day! Then sit around the campfire at night, cook some marshmallows, and listen to the personal stories of others who are going through similar struggles you are. Make new friends, learn more about yourself, and have the time of your life; that is Halcyon.


Our Campaign Goal

Our main campaign goal is to reach $10,000 so we can officially launch our business operations and begin development on our first tour destination through Western Canada, which we will hopefully offer in early 2015. By running our first tour we can provide future clients with valuable examples and testimonials for our trips, grow our client base, and show the public the benefits and values of our services. Reaching our goal will also allows us to take care of all the behind-the-scenes business stuff required to get us off the ground, so we can then start preparing for our first tours as soon as possible.

If we surpass our initial campaign goal, we will be able to create additional tour options to offer upon launch, and offer a higher number of tours in our first year.


About Our Tours

You do not need a formal medical diagnosis in order to go on one of our tours. Everyone suffers differently and we all deal with our struggles in our own ways. And not everyone has the ability or means to seek out formal medical assistance. We want our tours to be available to anyone, so we don't require you to get a doctor's referral or prove your symptoms. We want to help you, so all we ask is that you are willing to participate in the counselling sessions offered while on tour and be a productive and positive group member.

Our tours have been carefully designed in collaboration with our mental health professionals, so the therapy sessions are seamlessly incorporated into the tours. They are informal in nature and nothing to be intimidated about, but they are a vital part of our service. Most of the therapy sessions will be done in group settings, though we may also allocate some individual time with the counsellors depending on the tour. Sometimes the counsellors will have activities planned on top of mountains, while eating lunch beside a lake, or around the campfire at night. It will be a friendly and non-threatening environment for you to talk about your life with people who understand what you are going through.

We don't just want you to improve your mental health while on our tours, we also want you to have an amazing time that you will never forget. That is why we fill our trips with tons of great and exciting things to do. Kayak in the Pacific Ocean, bike along the Columbia River, take a gondola to the top of the Rocky Mountains, walk on a glacier in Iceland, or see Seattle from the top of the Space Needle. Don't worry, we mix in some relaxation and free time too, but from the moment our tours depart, we will keep you busy.

We believe that nature has naturally therapeutic effects on all of us, that is why so much of our trip itineraries are designed with nature in mind. We get outdoors: walk through forests, explore canyons, hike mountains, and swim in lakes. Each tour has a recommended gear list, but good hiking shoes and some active clothing will always be encouraged. Each tour will have a different difficulty rating and activity level, so you can choose if you would prefer something more leisurely or more challenging.

You can find out much more about our tours and service offerings on our website.


Perks and Rewards

How contributing and claiming perks works: you can contribute any amount that you are comfortable with, even as little as $1, and you do not need to claim a perk if you so choose. If you do wish to claim a perk, and we hope that you do, then you just need to contribute the amount associated with that perk (though you can contribute more than that) and select your desired perk upon checkout.

There are a combination of merchandise and exclusive offers available for you to choose from as a campaign supporter based on your contribution level.

We are offering a variety of discounts to save our supporters money on a future Halcyon tour. Discounts are fully transferable, meaning you can claim a discount for yourself to use or for someone else to use and they do not expire. These discounts can save you hundreds of dollars, so if you or someone you know wants to go on a Halcyon tour, become an early supporter and save!

There are two exclusive tour opportunities available just for our Indiegogo contributors:

  1. You can be a part of our inaugural tour, the very first tour we ever send out! You will forever be a part of our history and will play an important part in our company's future.
  2. Or, you can claim an all-inclusive trip which includes: a free tour of your choice, the airfare to and from your destination, three nights in a hotel before your tour starts, and all your food and activities while you explore. The offers are also fully transferable and do not expire, so you can claim these tour opportunities for yourself or someone who you may think would benefit from participating in a Halcyon tour. (The flights and tour of the all-inclusive trip must take place on the same continent).


Klean Kanteen is an environmental conscious manufacturer of reusable water bottles, as well as a variety of other products. We have partnered with them to create an exclusive Halcyon Backpacking Company stainless-steel water bottle, yours to claim with a contribution of $35 or more. Visit Klean Kanteen's website to see their full line of products.



Poler Stuff is an apparel and outdoor gear maker who produces a wide range of stylish and useful outdoor items, and for a contribution of $75 or more, you will get a Poler Stuff t-shirt and beanie (referred to as a toque by us Canadians). Just indicate your desired shirt size and if you would like a men's or woman's shirt during check-out; beanies are one-size-fits-all . Visit Poler Stuff's website to see their full line of products.


Please note: The t-shirt and beanie you receive may be a different design/colour from the examples shown above.


The Finer Details

All Inclusive: A Halcyon tour comes with no extra expenses or hidden fees. When you agree to go on one of our tours, you know exactly what you are getting. Unlike some of our competitors, we don't want you paying extra for things you thought were included and having to stretch your budget. Once your tour starts we want you to just focus on having a good time and making lifelong memories.

Meals: Each tour lists exactly how many meals are included so you won't have to budget extra for food. When we are in camp, or out in the wilderness exploring somewhere, we will always provide all your meals. The only meals not usually provided will be when you have free time in a city so that way you can choose from anything you feel like in that moment.

Attractions: If we list an attraction in the tour description, then that attraction is included in the tour price. Simple as that. We won't take you somewhere then make you pay extra just to enjoy it. Each tour description will list every attraction included. The only attractions not usually included are when we have free time, then you can choose to do whatever you wish; though our tour guides will probably give you a bunch of awesome recommendations and the tour bus will drop everyone off wherever they want to go.

Accommodations and Transportation: All of your accommodations and transportation are fully included in the tour price. We list how many nights will be spent in a hotel or hostel, and how many will be spent in camp. No surprises here.

Tour Guides: All of our tour guides have received their CAG certificate and have up-to-date First Aid/CPR certifications as well. You will always feel in safe hands with them. They have experience leading tour groups and have extensive knowledge of all the locations you will visit. They will be your go-to source for anything you need while on tour. Once a tour departs, they are never off duty until the tour concludes.

Mental Health Professionals: Our counsellors are university educated and fully qualified to lead all counselling and therapy sessions while on tour. They have experience providing therapy in both individual and group settings and are eager to help you in whatever ways you need. Don't be afraid to chat with them outside of the planned therapy sessions too, as long bus rides can be a good time to talk.

Mental Illnesses We Plan To Support Upon Launch:

  • Mood Disorders (depression, bipolar disorder, etc.)
  • Anxiety Disorders (panic disorder, general anxiety, social anxiety, etc.)
  • Attention Deficit Disorder and Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
  • Personality Disorders (antisocial personality disorder, borderline personality disorder, avoidant personality disorder, etc.)
  • Eating Disorders (anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, etc.)


Useful Links

  • View an example tour through Western Canada
  • View an example tour through the US Pacific Coast Trail
  • View an example tour through Iceland
  • Join our mailing list and be the first to find out when tours become available
  • Learn more about which mental illnesses we support and how we make sure tours are safe and fun
  • Follow Halcyon Backpacking Company on all the social media


Official Campaign Partners

Klean Kanteen (www.kleankanteen.com)

  Poler Stuff (www.polerstuff.com)


Frequently Asked Questions

When are tours going to be available?

We have no confirmed dates as of yet, but our goal is to get our first set of tours out sometime in 2015. You can join our mailing list to hear about tour availability as soon as they are released.

Are you just in North America?

Halcyon Backpacking Company is a Canadian company, based out of Victoria, British Columbia. We are going to be initially offering tours solely across North America until we are able to grow and expand our operations to additional countries and continents. We hope to constantly grow our tour operations and be continually adding to our list of available destinations.

Do I have to live in North America to participate in a tour?

Not at all! Our tours are open to anyone from around the world. Each tour starts in a large city with a major international airport to make it easier for anyone to participate. All you need is a passport, an ability to communicate in English (more languages to be supported in the future), and any applicable tourist visas to join our tours.

What is the anticipated or ideal size of each tour group?

Each tour will have a different minimum and maximum number of participants allotted dependant upon: length of trip, which mental illness(es) are to be supported, and various other factors. Once tours become available, the tour information pages will clearly outline those numbers. With that said, the ideal group size we are striving towards will between 15 and 20 participants per tour.

What qualifications do tour guides have?

All tour guides are held to top industry standards and must pass our own requirements before being allowed to lead a tour. Each tour guide has at a minimum, a CAG (Certified Assistant Guide) certificate and a valid and up to date First Aid/CPR training. Our tour guides also have personal experience with outdoor survival and have experience leading others in adventure activities. You are always in good hands.

What qualifications do counsellors have?

Our counsellors are a team of wonderfully hard working people whose main job on tour is to make sure all your needs are being addressed and that your therapy time is a time of learning and growth. All counsellors are university educated with a degree that is best suited to assist the mental illnesses they are assigned. They also have a background in counselling individuals in both a one-on-one and group dynamic. They love to travel and have adventurous personalities, which is why they are on tour with you and not stuck in an office somewhere.

Do I need to bring my own gear?

We will be constantly adding to the range of gear available for participants to rent from us, which can be found here. Each tour will have a list of recommended gear that you will likely need, but if you don't have something, you will be given the option to rent it from us while you are booking your tour. The only gear you will need that you won't be able to rent from us is a backpack and some good walking shoes.

What does Halcyon mean, and why is that the name of your business?

Halcyon (adjective): (1) Describing something that is happy, carefree, or thriving; a blissful, peaceful or joyous occasion. (2) Denoting a period of time in the past that was joyous and peaceful. We felt that the word halcyon perfectly and fully encapsulates the type of experience we wish to offer our customers. We not only want to provide you with great experiences and unforgettable memories, but we also want to provide you with a healthy and happy state of mind as well.

Do you have any investment opportunities available?

Yes, we currently have investment opportunities available for those who wish to become shareholders with Halcyon Backpacking Company. To learn more and to request an information package, you can visit the investment page on our website, or send an email to halcyonbackpacking@icloud.com.


Risks and Rewards

Your support for our vision is greatly appreciated and will not go unnoticed. Your contribution is a vital part in the development of our company, and will allow us to begin offering memorable tours for those living with mental health issues who dream of travel and well-being. 

The risks associated with your contribution are very small, but we want you to know that we are prepared for any situation.

1. Our company is in the start-up stages of operations and as such, our future could be unpredictable. The funds we raise will go towards research and development and will hopefully help launch operations in early 2015. However, unforeseen delays may occur and we will do our best to maximize our crowd-funding contributions and get tours out and running as soon as we can. We want to be on the road.

2. Delays in perk shipping may occur. We are working with external partners in some instances and due to stock quantities or other circumstances, your perk may not reach you by the estimated delivery time. If there are any delays, we will be sure to inform you of them and get your package to you as soon as we can.

3. Our campaign is a flexible one, meaning all the contributions we receive will be kept. If you face any issues while contributing, have questions about your financial statements after contributing, or wish to inquire about refunds, please click here to read Indiegogo's refund policy.
story_txt:
Wellness Adventure ToursHalcyon Backpacking Company is excited to offer a new take on travel. We provide fully guided outdoor-adventure tours for young adults between the ages of 18 and 35 who are living with mental illness or their related symptoms. We offer the best of everything when it comes to travel: sight-seeing through world famous cities, the excitement of once-in-a-lifetime adventures, and the catharsis of outdoor living, all while having fun and improving health and well-being. We know that travelling alone can be an intimidating thought, especially if you are dealing with the symptoms of mental illness. By travelling with us you'll get a chance to meet like-minded people with the same struggles as you and then travel the world together with new friends.We team up our tour guides with mental health professionals to provide a safe, friendly, and inclusive tour experience that will be highly enjoyable and have a positive impact on your well-being. Visit a museum, hike a mountain, swim in the ocean, all in the same day! Then sit around the campfire at night, cook some marshmallows, and listen to the personal stories of others who are going through similar struggles you are. Make new friends, learn more about yourself, and have the time of your life; that is Halcyon.Our Campaign GoalOur main campaign goal is to reach $10,000 so we can officially launch our business operations and begin development on our first tour destination through Western Canada, which we will hopefully offer in early 2015. By running our first tour we can provide future clients with valuable examples and testimonials for our trips, grow our client base, and show the public the benefits and values of our services. Reaching our goal will also allows us to take care of all the behind-the-scenes business stuff required to get us off the ground, so we can then start preparing for our first tours as soon as possible.If we surpass our initial campaign goal, we will be able to create additional tour options to offer upon launch, and offer a higher number of tours in our first year.About Our ToursYou do not need a formal medical diagnosis in order to go on one of our tours. story:
Help us start our company:

Help us raise money for our company

Hi everybody all around the world.

We will revolutionize the way of finding favorite fashion brands and makes it easy for people to trade their favorite fashion clothes with other fashion addicts.

With your help we are able to establish communication in between people with the same interest for clothes / fashion.

We are two young guys from Denmark (Copenhagen) and we have a great idea. We have thought a lot about what we could create, that would revolutionize the fashion industry.

We both love all about fashion and take really good care of our clothes and spend a lot of time finding clothes that we like. But the difficult part is that the brands and clothes we are looking for is difficult to find in the stores.

This problem made us think about what we could do to make it easy to find our favorite brands in the stores with the easiest solution.

And that’s how we came up with the idea BRANDSEARCH.

BRANDSEARCH is an mobile app where you can search a clothing brand, and the app will give you a list of stores that sells the brand and locates the nearest store where you can purchase your favorite fashion / brand. This is not all, when you download the free BRANDSEARCH app, you get the opportunity to upgrade the app and get to enter a social fashion trading network, where you can trade your clothes and accessories with other fashion loving people and their clothes instead of putting it for sale.

But as you all know, it costs money to start up a big project like this. We have a lot of friends and family members, who are helping us right now, but there are things that need to be bought and some things can’t be done for free unfortunately.

That is the reason why we need your help to finance starting our company. We can promise you that we will make the best app and website ever and it will be filled with surprises and awesome features. We will be forever grateful for your help and we are not going to disappoint you guys and girls.

We’d love to make it possible for every single shopper.

Best regards.

Follow us on twitter:
https://twitter.com/BrandSearchApp

story:
Short Summary

Hiiiiyaaaaa,  Kiaaappppp, Focus, Power, Discipline, Self-Control, COMMUNITY is what Full Element Martial Arts (Fullelementkarate.com) has provided for over a decade.  With the economy being where it is now we are in dire straits.  Serving the community for a Decade changing, inspiring, motivating lives one student at a time we are asking for your help.
  My name is Michael Simmons and am the Head instructor here at Full Element Martial arts.  I have been teaching Martial Arts for over 25 years and receive each student as if they were my own child.  We are located in the Pelham Parkway Area of the Bronx and quite frankly, this school is the only positive outlet in the area for this long.  Because of the economy many families were unable to continue theirs or their child's lessons, which forced them to pull out and place the school in financial hardship.  The economy is picking up now but not fast enough to keep our landlord happy.    
We need your help to save it with the utmost intention of keeping children off of the streets and unifying families together through Martial Arts Education.  
The purpose of the funds are to completely pay off debts that are owed and utilize remaining funds to give the children and adults an Airtrack mat so that they continue to stay off of the negative streets and learn advance Martial Arts Skills.  

Please help us!!!

Sincerely 

Michael Simmons
Chief Instructor Full Element Martial Arts
story_txt: Short SummaryHiiiiyaaaaa,  Kiaaappppp, Focus, Power, Discipline, Self-Control, COMMUNITY is what Full Element Martial Arts (Fullelementkarate.com) has provided for over a decade.  With the economy being where it is now we are in dire straits.  Serving the community for a Decade changing, inspiring, motivating lives one student at a time we are asking for your help.  My name is Michael Simmons and am the Head instructor here at Full Element Martial arts.  I have been teaching Martial Arts for over 25 years and receive each student as if they were my own child.  We are located in the Pelham Parkway Area of the Bronx and quite frankly, this school is the only positive outlet in the area for this long.  Because of the economy many families were unable to continue theirs or their child's lessons, which forced them to pull out and place the school in financial hardship.  The economy is picking up now but not fast enough to keep our landlord happy.    We need your help to save it with the utmost intention of keeping children off of the streets and unifying families together through Martial Arts Education.  The purpose of the funds are to completely pay off debts that are owed and utilize remaining funds to give the children and adults an Airtrack mat so that they continue to stay off of the negative streets and learn advance Martial Arts Skills.  Please help us!!!Sincerely Michael SimmonsChief Instructor Full Element Martial Arts

story:
Short Summary

    Hi, my name is Dariel Rosado, and I want to share with you an idea to offer a great quality transportation service for a low rate for any budget.

    My service will provide 100% customer satisfaction in the current city I'm living in, Lowell, MA. I'll offer student discounts, senior shopping services, a jump start service for automobile break-downs, and most importantly, a designated driver service.

    My cars will be equipped with dash cameras to provide safety and security for clients, and if needed, car seats for the added safety of young passengers.

    In order to move this forward, I'm coming to Indiegogo for support. Your generous contributions will go towards equipment, such as dash cams, car seats, and proper vehicles to provide said services.

    All donations and contributions will be rewarded with prizes from 100zombies.bigcartel.com (an independent T-shirt company) as thanks for your support on this endeavor.

    Thank you for taking the time to read my idea, and helping this small dream become a big reality. Thank you and God Bless.
