On a local free site, I recently noticed a woman wanting to 
give away warm clothes in trade for food. She has a teenaged son, and after paying bills every month has less than $100 for necessities like food, not to mention luxuries like Internet and cable. I think it is devastating that 
someone would have to trade necessities like this, and I would like to 
put together enough food for her that she wouldn't have to give away her
 mittens, scarves and toques.  My aim is to put together a grocery delivery so that at least that issue is taken care of for this family. Christmas is coming and I think being able to make a difference for Melanie and her son would be a tremendous, generous gift.

story:
Rebel Nell creates defiant jewelry with a purpose. Using abundant local materials like graffiti, Rebel Nell's focus is to employ, educate, and empower disadvantaged women in Detroit. 


WHO IS REBEL NELL

Rebel Nell evolved from two proud Detroiters with a passion for making and designing jewelry.   We love the Motor City and the people who live here.  We created Rebel Nell as an opportunity to give back to the community that has given so much to us. Our mission is to employ disadvantaged women in Detroit to make jewelry, educate them on business and life management skills, and empower them to transition to an independent life.

We will use the money we raise during this campaign to hire our first round of women, rent the workspace, and purchase materials. We are so excited for this endeavour and we would love for you to be a part of the journey. Thank you for your encouragement and support!

 

OUR FUNDRAISING GOAL

We have set out to raise $25,000.  Reaching this goal will enable us to hire four (4) women and provide them with a monthly salary of $1500 a month for three (3) months.  We will use the remaining $6,500 for materials, tools, training and rent.  We plan to be sustainable not long after our initial fundraising campaign so that we can hire more women and continue to grow at a healthy pace.

We have an array of giving levels for every interest.  Regardless of your giving level, your contribution is a siginficant step forward in the future of Rebel Nell. Your generosity will help get Rebel Nell off the ground and change the lives of women ready for a transitional opportunity, one that will take them out of the shelters once and for all.  

Your contribution can really make a difference.

Here are some of samples of the pieces availabe in our giving level.

  

    

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please spread the love!  By sending out our message and talking about Rebel Nell, you are helping our campaign.  Please share our story on all of your social media platforms as frequently as possible. Feel free to copy and paste the link below:

www.indiegogo.com/projects/Rebel-Nell

 

Thank you so much for your support!

Amy and Diana from Rebel Nell

Creating Defiant Jewelry with a Purpose


Rebel Nell won the July 2013 Detroit SOUP crowd-funding award and a “Spirit of Social Entrepreneurship” award from Michigan Corps, the Michigan Economic Development Corp. and Great Lakes Entrepreneur’s Quest.

story:
For the celebration of the life of Diana Henderson

Diana has a beautiful spirit and was the person many people would call on for support and advise. She was a faithful employee of the United States Postal Service for more than 25 years and her selfless nature shined through there as well as she was a Union Steward by the end of her career. In life she suffered from cystinuria (an inherited kidney disease) , she was diabetic, and suffered chronic debilitating pain from a work accident where someone hit her as she was delivering mail early in her career. None of this stopped her from being kind, patient or selfless. Through it all she has been caring for her husband who suffers from multiple forms of cancer.

Why we are reaching out for help

Today we were informed that due to her being off work on disability for over 356 days her life insurance policy has been canceled. Apparently she failed to return a form that had been sent to her. The amount shown as the goal would be enough to cover the expenses thus far and a memorial ceremony. It is our intent to hold services outdoors, shoes opptional, at John Bryan State Park in Yellow Springs, OH as it was one of her favorite places. We further intend to acquire a plot at Byron Cemetery in Fairborn, OH and a monument to be installed there, but that is a less urgent matter. At this time her husband will keep her remains close to him until such time that they are reunited and can both be placed in the earth in proximity to other members of both sides of the family. 

What happens next?

We will continue to work on getting her policy reinstated, as it is a clerical issue as we see it. The issue here is time; it is not fair to her loved ones if they have to wait an extended amount of time before paying last respects. We need this to help us mourn and to start healing. We will, in the case that the full life insurance policy eventually gets honored, pledge the equivalent of any funds raised here to a charity or cause in her name. This would be her wishes, in my opinion, and we would be honored to do it.

A personal contribution from me to help you see her charicter

Following is a quote of my Facebook post the morning after receiving the tragic news:
"Many of you who know our family well know that we are not strangers to tragedy, pretty sure there is a curse in the family somewhere. For some of us it may be easier every time, and for some it may be harder. One thing I am sure of is that we persevere and we will carry on as always. Diana Henderson was not just our mother, not just my father's wife, not just a sister to her siblings, and not just a grandmother to our next generation. She put every ounce of her being into helping others and so many are feeling the burden of this loss. I will continue to be the man she built me into, but I will never be able to fill the gap she left behind. For those I have reached out to when I saw you hurting as I have always done and always will, I want you to know it was her working through me. My mother instilled peace, love and compassion into me from day one and the truth is I know not how to hate, I don't know how to hold on to anger. I owe her everything and I am a part of her legacy so for those who need her still as I do, know that I am here for you. As she was not well known for wearing shoes, the phrase "I could never fill her shoes" may not be fitting, but the sentiment is. I will continue down this path she paved for me, it will hurt looking back now and then and not seeing those impressions of her bare feet next to my footprints on the path where they always used to be, but path will continue to be paved by me now for our children and we will always welcome loved ones and strangers alike to stroll along our path with us. I see you all in the same light she did; every one on earth is my brother and sister. I love all of you."

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can also follow this link and act on the sentiment and share it: https://www.facebook.com/TheGoodLordAbove/photos/a.157796790974699.40772.157750900979288/1211319378955763/?type=1&comment_id=1212153155539052&notif_t=like 
  • Call and ask that her life insurance policy be honored.
  • Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools too.

story:
Did you know?
  •  The median age of a minor sexual assault victim in California is 9 years old  
  •  3 out of 4 females will be sexually violated in their lifetime   
When victims of sexual assault go to the hospital to undergo a Sexual Assault Response Team exam  (SART - a.k.a. "rape kit"), they are often asked to surrender their clothing as evidence, leaving them with nothing to wear home.  This is where The Grateful Garment Project comes in.  We provide SART facilities and community based organizations (cbo) throughout California with new clothing, toiletries, and snack items - to help facilitate the healing process and attempt to restore dignity to the victims during this traumatic experience and process.
We envision a world where sexual assault is no longer a threat; however, until that day comes we have to continue making all efforts to provide compassionate assistance to all that seek our services.

What We Need & What You Get

We need YOUR help so that we can continue to provide SART facilities and cbo's with the resources they need to help the victims.

Your donation dollars will not only go towards clothing and supplies for sexual assault victims, but also towards the establishment of the Grateful Giver Program. The Grateful Giver program is a channel that will help provide a regular inflow of resources for The Grateful Garment Project to continue providing care and support.

$25 - $35 is all it takes to provide a full outfit, toiletries, food, and some dignity back to victims of sexual assault.

From this Indiegogo campaign goal of $5,000, $2,500 will fund nearly 100 new outfits and $2,500 will support the establishment of the much needed Grateful Giver Program.

 

The Impact

 In the last fiscal year we provided over 15,000 items used by sexual assault victims.

Help us continue to make a difference and restore dignity to victims of sexual assault! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Volunteer with us! We need a volunteer coordinator, writers, designers, and photographers! For more information on becoming a volunteer please click
    here
  • Help us get the word out by sharing this campaign to your social networks.
  • Host a party: Gathering for Garments is a great way to donate!  Arrange a party where friends/family bring new clothing, toiletries, and/or monetary donations. A Gathering for Garments kit can be downloaded at our website.
  • Arrange a speaking event: The Grateful Garment Project is thrilled to speak at events or workshops. It's a great way for us to engage with new audiences who may be interested in getting involved!

We'd love to hear from you. Please visit our website or contact Angel@gratefulgarment.org if you have any questions.

story:
Le buone idee vanno indossate!
[English version below]

FYI: SE ORDINATE UNA T-SHIRT CON LA VOSTRA GRAFICA VERRETE CONTATTATI DAL NOSTRO TEAM: VI CHIEDEREMO DI INVIARCI VIA MAIL IL VOSTRO DESIGN!
Stiamo per lanciare una nuova piattaforma web che cambierà il mondo della raccolta fondi per progetti sociali e culturali. 

Il nostro sogno: che chiunque abbia un'idea la possa finanziare creando una T-shirt e vendendola sul nostro sito a tutti coloro che credono nel progetto!

Aiutaci a lanciare Worth Wearing a sviluppare una piattaforma web innovativa e accessibile e ad acquistare le prime 10.000 T-shirt eco-sostenibili e equosolidali Earth Positive®!


Come funziona?


È molto semplice. 

Chiunque può caricare un file con il proprio design personalizzato, scegliere il colore e il modello e creare la propria T-shirt. Questa verrà esposta nello shop del sito e potrà essere acquistata da tutti coloro che ne condividono il messaggio. Grazie ai proventi dell'acquisto, chi ha lanciato la T-shirt potrà sostenere il proprio progetto, la propria causa sociale, e allo stesso tempo diffondere la propria idea grazie a chi la indosserà ovunque.


Chi siamo? 

Siamo un team internazionale di professionisti del web.

Siamo un’agenzia creativa, Latte Creative, specializzata nel campaigning per il non profit.

Crediamo che il campaigning possa portare un cambiamento reale nella società.
Crediamo che il  design possa ispirare idee positive e di cambiamento.
Crediamo che una T-shirt possa sempre dare voce a una buona idea.

Crediamo che tu possa credere in noi.


Di cosa abbiamo bisogno? 

10.000 Euro è tutto ciò che ci serve per lanciare Worth Wearing: 5.000 Euro per sviluppare un sito web complesso ma estremamente accessibile e 5.000 Euro per acquistare le prime 10.000 T-shirt eco-sostenibili e equo-solidali Earth Positive® su cui stampare le T-shirt per sostenere i vostri progetti!

Vogliamo che Worth Wearing sia un progetto di tutti per tutti. A partire da subito!


Perchè vi potrebbe interessare?

Perchè fate parte di una ONG o un'organizzazione non profit o un gruppo culturale e avete bisogno di raccogliere soldi per realizzare un progetto, una buona idea.
Perchè Worth Wearing è senza rischi:  la vostra T-shirt, che sarà stampata on demand solo in seguito all'acquisto di un utente. Non è richiesto nessun investimento iniziale e il servizio è gratuito!
 

Cosa ci guadagnate?

Vogliamo mostrarvi la qualità delle nostre T-shirt e della nostra tecnica di stampa.
Come ringraziamento per il vostro sostegno, potete ordinare in anteprima la T-shirt di Worth Wearing edizione speciale o inviarci il vostro design e ricevere le prime Worthy T-shirts mai stampate, eco-sostenibili e equo-solidali, con il vostro messaggio.
Per le donazioni più alte abbiamo previsto un ringraziamento speciale: la consulenza strategica del nostro team creativo, per costruire insieme a voi la vostra campagna e creare l'immagine, il logo, l'illustrazione, il messaggio per la vostra prima T-shirt.

Volete partecipare attivamente?

Non potete dare il vostro sostegno economico ma volete far parte di Worth Wearing? Contattateci direttamente per scoprire come poter lavorare insieme! 


I nostri rewards?


20 € x 1 o 100€ x 5: T-SHIRT PER DIRE NO ALLA VIOLENZA!

Per la GIORNATA CONTRO LA VIOLENZA SULLE DONNE, BeeFree Cooperativa ha realizzato con Worth Wearing 5 T-shirt, create assieme a 5 artisti internazionali diversi per dire NO ALLA VIOLENZA SULLE DONNE. Scopri la campagna BeFreeFromViolence  http://bit.ly/BeFreeFromViolence! Parte del ricavato delle T-shirt andrà a sostegno della campagna!


T-shirts:

A, B: Tara McPherson - Crying up;

C: Anita Kunz

D: Yvonne Ekman - Una casa crollata

E: Jonathan Huxley - Ambiguity


18 €: WORTH WEARING T-SHIRT SPECIAL EDITION

Le buone idee vanno raccontate a tutti! 
Abbiamo creato una T-shirt a tiratura limitata, solo per chi ha sostenuto Worth Wearing e ha creduto nel nostro progetto!
Le T-shirt Special Edition saranno spedite a domicilio, complete di marker indelebile per dare voce ai vostri sogni!




25 € - 200 €: DA LE TUE PRIME T-SHIRT PERSONALIZZATE ECO-SOSTENIBILI

Sostenendo Worth Wearing potrete ordinare in anteprima le vostre T-shirt personalizzate con la vostra grafica e il vostro messaggio. Abbiamo scelto Continental Clothing Earth Positive come nostro unico fornitore, nel rispetto dell'ambiente e delle condizioni di lavoro.

INVITO ALLA FESTA DI LANCIO DI WORTH WEARING
Chi di voi ha sostenuto Worth Wearing donando 100 Euro o più, riceverà un invito ufficiale, via mail alla Festa di Worth Wearing che si terrà a Roma per celebrare l'inizio del sogno!

DA 400 €: DESIGN DELLA TUA T-SHIRT!
Se avete un'idea in testa, un progetto da realizzare e da indossare il nostro team creerà insieme a voi il progetto grafico della vostra prima T-shirt personalizzata Worth Wearing.

DA 2000 €: UNA NUOVA CAMPAGNA

Avete una campagna nel cassetto? Donando 2.000 Euro il nostro team creativo realizzerà insieme a voi:

• il progetto grafico (logo, lettering, illustrazione)
• il messaggio (naming, tagline, slogan)
• il template per la vostra newsletter (+ 3 mesi di abbonamento al nostro servizio di mailing) 

Inoltre studieremo con voi l'intera strategia di comunicazione, per il lancio e la diffusione della vostra campagna.

DA 5000 €: UN MINISITO DI CAMPAGNA

Un minisito di campagna 

Donando 5.000 Euro, oltre alla realizzazione della campagna, creeremo insieme a voi un minisito dedicato per ottenere visibilità e raccontare il vostro progetto a tutti!

10.000 €: BENVENUTI A BORDO!

Avete donato 10.000 Euro e volete diventare parte attiva del progetto? Vi contatteremo immediatamente per fissare un incontro e parlare formalmente della nostra collaborazione. Benvenuti in Worth Wearing! 


[English version]

Good ideas are worth wearing!

We are about to launch a new platform that will change fundraising for non-profit,  social and cultural causes.

We dream of a world in which, whoever has a project can get funds for it by creating a T-shirt and selling it online through our website.

Help us to launch Worth Wearing, develop a new accessible web platform and purchase the first 10.000 Continental Clothing Earth Positive® ethical T-shirts!

How does it work?

It’s really simple. You can upload a file with your personal design, choose the colour and model and create your T-shirt. Everyone will be able to buy it online directly from the Worth Wearing shop. The money you  get will help you to realize your idea, get funds for your causes and at the same time help you show your ideas around.

Who We Are

We are an international team of web professionals.

We are a web agency, Latte Creative, specialized in campaigning for non-profits.

We believe campaigning can effect real change in society.

We believe in design to inspire good causes.

We believe in T-shirts to spread messages.

We believe you can believe in our work too.

What We Need

10.000 Euro is what we need to make the dream come true.

We will develop the platform in house: 5.000 Euro will be necessary to develop a complex and accessible website and another 5.000 will be used to buy the first 10.000 ecological and fair trade T-shirts, ready to be printed on with your campaign ideas and messages.

Why You Should Care

Because you are part of a non profit organization, an NGO, a local shelter, a cultural group and you want to raise money to finance a project.

Because Worth Wearing is risk free: you will be able to upload your design and sell your T-shirts online, on demand. No investments is required.

What You Get

We would like to show you the quality of our tees by letting you pre-order a special  Indiegogo edition T-shirt and allowing you to submit your design to get the first Worthy Tees ever printed with your design and your message.

You can also have a taste of our apparel and our digital printing technique.

The highest donation will be given a special thanks in the form of a graphic and strategic consultation by our Latte Creative team to help you build and design your own brand new campaign and produce your first amazing tees.

Want to help in other ways?

Can't donate but like the project? Contact us and let's see how we can work together!

Our Perks:


20 € X1 o 100€ X 5: T-SHIRT TO SAY NO TO VIOLENCE!

For the INTERNATIONAL DAY FOR THE ELIMINATION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN, BeeFree Cooperative has made 5 Worth Wearing T-shirt, created together with five international artists to say NO TO VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.

Discover the campaign BeFreeFromViolence http://bit.ly/BeFreeFromViolence! Part of the proceeds of the T-shirt will go to support the campaign!


WORTH WEARING SPECIAL EDITION T-SHIRT 

Good ideas are worth telling everyone about! We have created a limited edition T-shirts for our Indiegogo supporters! They will be delivered along with a marker to write on them with, to spread your dreams everywhere.

YOUR FIRST CUSTOM ETHICAL T-SHIRT

By supporting Worth Wearing you will be able to order  your T-shirt, customised with your design and message, before everyone else. We have chosen Continental Clothing Earth Positive to respect the environment and labour conditions.

WORTH WEARING PARTY INVITATION

Those who donate more 100 Euros or more to Worth Wearing will get an official invitation to our launch party in Rome.

DESIGN OF YOUR T-SHIRT!

If you have an idea in mind or a project to wear our team will design your first customised T-shirt for you.

A NEW CAMPAIGN

Do you have a campaign just waiting to be brought to life?

Donating 2.000 Euro to our creative team will reward  you with:

  • image (logo, graphics, illustration)

  • message (naming, tagline)

  • newsletter template (and you’ll get 3 months free use of our mailer)

We will also help you to define your communication strategy.

CAMPAIGN WEBSITE

By donating 5.000 Euro you’ll get a brand new campaign designed together and a campaign website to tell everyone about your project!

WELCOME ON BOARD

Have you donated 10.000 Euro and do you want to be part of the project?

You’ll be immediately be contacted to schedule a work meeting and discuss our collaboration.

Welcome to Worth Wearing!

Le buone idee vanno indossate![English version below]
FYI: SE ORDINATE UNA T-SHIRT CON LA VOSTRA GRAFICA VERRETE CONTATTATI DAL NOSTRO TEAM: VI CHIEDEREMO DI INVIARCI VIA MAIL IL VOSTRO DESIGN!
Stiamo per lanciare una nuova piattaforma web che cambierà il mondo della raccolta fondi per progetti sociali e culturali. 
Il nostro sogno: che chiunque abbia un'idea la possa finanziare creando una T-shirt e vendendola sul nostro sito a tutti coloro che credono nel progetto!Aiutaci a lanciare Worth Wearing a sviluppare una piattaforma web innovativa e accessibile e ad acquistare le prime 10.000 T-shirt eco-sostenibili e equosolidali Earth Positive®!Come funziona?
È molto semplice. Chiunque può caricare un file con il proprio design personalizzato, scegliere il colore e il modello e creare la propria T-shirt. Questa verrà esposta nello shop del sito e potrà essere acquistata da tutti coloro che ne condividono il messaggio. Grazie ai proventi dell'acquisto, chi ha lanciato la T-shirt potrà sostenere il proprio progetto, la propria causa sociale, e allo stesso tempo diffondere la propria idea grazie a chi la indosserà ovunque.
Chi siamo? 
Siamo un team internazionale di professionisti del web.Siamo un’agenzia creativa, Latte Creative, specializzata nel campaigning per il non profit.Crediamo che il campaigning possa portare un cambiamento reale nella società.Crediamo che il  design possa ispirare idee positive e di cambiamento.Crediamo che una T-shirt possa sempre dare voce a una buona idea.Crediamo che tu possa credere in noi.
Di cosa abbiamo bisogno? 
10.000 Euro è tutto ciò che ci serve per lanciare Worth Wearing: 5.000 Euro per sviluppare un sito web complesso ma estremamente accessibile e 5.000 Euro per acquistare le prime 10.000 T-shirt eco-sostenibili e equo-solidali Earth Positive® su cui stampare le T-shirt per sostenere i vostri progetti!Vogliamo che Worth Wearing sia un progetto di tutti per tutti. A partire da subito!Perchè vi potrebbe interessare?Perchè fate parte di una ONG o un'organizzazione non profit o un gruppo culturale e avete bisogno di raccogliere soldi per realizzare un progetto, una buona idea.Perchè Worth Wearing è senza rischi:  la vostra T-shirt, che sarà stampata on demand solo in seguito all'acquisto di un utente. Non è richiesto nessun investimento iniziale e il servizio è gratuito! Cosa ci guadagnate?Vogliamo mostrarvi la qualità delle nostre T-shirt e della nostra tecnica di stampa.Come ringraziamento per il vostro sostegno, potete ordinare in anteprima la T-shirt di Worth Wearing edizione speciale o inviarci il vostro design e ricevere le prime Worthy T-shirts mai stampate, eco-sostenibili e equo-solidali, con il vostro messaggio.Per le donazioni più alte abbiamo previsto un ringraziamento speciale: la consulenza strategica del nostro team creativo, per costruire insieme a voi la vostra campagna e creare l'immagine, il logo, l'illustrazione, il messaggio per la vostra prima T-shirt.Volete partecipare attivamente?Non potete dare il vostro sostegno economico ma volete far parte di Worth Wearing? Contattateci direttamente per scoprire come poter lavorare insieme! I nostri rewards?
20 € x 1 o 100€ x 5: T-SHIRT PER DIRE NO ALLA VIOLENZA!
Per la GIORNATA CONTRO LA VIOLENZA SULLE DONNE, BeeFree Cooperativa ha realizzato con Worth Wearing 5 T-shirt, create assieme a 5 artisti internazionali diversi per dire NO ALLA VIOLENZA SULLE DONNE. Scopri la campagna BeFreeFromViolence  http://bit.ly/BeFreeFromViolence! Parte del ricavato delle T-shirt andrà a sostegno della campagna!

T-shirts:
A, B: Tara McPherson - Crying up; 
C: Anita Kunz
D: Yvonne Ekman - Una casa crollata
E: Jonathan Huxley - Ambiguity

18 €: WORTH WEARING T-SHIRT SPECIAL EDITIONLe buone idee vanno raccontate a tutti! Abbiamo creato una T-shirt a tiratura limitata, solo per chi ha sostenuto Worth Wearing e ha creduto nel nostro progetto!Le T-shirt Special Edition saranno spedite a domicilio, complete di marker indelebile per dare voce ai vostri sogni!25 € - 200 €: DA LE TUE PRIME T-SHIRT PERSONALIZZATE ECO-SOSTENIBILISostenendo Worth Wearing potrete ordinare in anteprima le vostre T-shirt personalizzate con la vostra grafica e il vostro messaggio. Abbiamo scelto Continental Clothing Earth Positive come nostro unico fornitore, nel rispetto dell'ambiente e delle condizioni di lavoro.INVITO ALLA FESTA DI LANCIO DI WORTH WEARINGChi di voi ha sostenuto Worth Wearing donando 100 Euro o più, riceverà un invito ufficiale, via mail alla Festa di Worth Wearing che si terrà a Roma per celebrare l'inizio del sogno!DA 400 €: DESIGN DELLA TUA T-SHIRT!Se avete un'idea in testa, un progetto da realizzare e da indossare il nostro team creerà insieme a voi il progetto grafico della vostra prima T-shirt personalizzata Worth Wearing.DA 2000 €: UNA NUOVA CAMPAGNAAvete una campagna nel cassetto? Donando 2.000 Euro il nostro team creativo realizzerà insieme a voi:• il progetto grafico (logo, lettering, illustrazione)• il messaggio (naming, tagline, slogan)• il template per la vostra newsletter (+ 3 mesi di abbonamento al nostro servizio di mailing) Inoltre studieremo con voi l'intera strategia di comunicazione, per il lancio e la diffusione della vostra campagna.DA 5000 €: UN MINISITO DI CAMPAGNAUn minisito di campagna Donando 5.000 Euro, oltre alla realizzazione della campagna, creeremo insieme a voi un minisito dedicato per ottenere visibilità e raccontare il vostro progetto a tutti!10.000 €: BENVENUTI A BORDO!Avete donato 10.000 Euro e volete diventare parte attiva del progetto? Vi contatteremo immediatamente per fissare un incontro e parlare formalmente della nostra collaborazione. Benvenuti in Worth Wearing! [English version]Good ideas are worth wearing!We are about to launch a new platform that will change fundraising for non-profit,  social and cultural causes.We dream of a world in which, whoever has a project can get funds for it by creating a T-shirt and selling it online through our website.Help us to launch Worth Wearing, develop a new accessible web platform and purchase the first 10.000 Continental Clothing Earth Positive® ethical T-shirts!How does it work?It’s really simple. You can upload a file with your personal design, choose the colour and model and create your T-shirt. Everyone will be able to buy it online directly from the Worth Wearing shop. The money you  get will help you to realize your idea, get funds for your causes and at the same time help you show your ideas around.Who We AreWe are an international team of web professionals.We are a web agency, Latte Creative, specialized in campaigning for non-profits.We believe campaigning can effect real change in society.We believe in design to inspire good causes.We believe in T-shirts to spread messages.We believe you can believe in our work too.What We Need10.000 Euro is what we need to make the dream come true.We will develop the platform in house: 5.000 Euro will be necessary to develop a complex and accessible website and another 5.000 will be used to buy the first 10.000 ecological and fair trade T-shirts, ready to be printed on with your campaign ideas and messages.Why You Should CareBecause you are part of a non profit organization, an NGO, a local shelter, a cultural group and you want to raise money to finance a project.Because Worth Wearing is risk free: you will be able to upload your design and sell your T-shirts online, on demand. No investments is required.What You GetWe would like to show you the quality of our tees by letting you pre-order a special  Indiegogo edition T-shirt and allowing you to submit your design to get the first Worthy Tees ever printed with your design and your message.You can also have a taste of our apparel and our digital printing technique.The highest donation will be given a special thanks in the form of a graphic and strategic consultation by our Latte Creative team to help you build and design your own brand new campaign and produce your first amazing tees.Want to help in other ways?Can't donate but like the project? Contact us and let's see how we can work together!Our Perks:20 € X1 o 100€ X 5: T-SHIRT TO SAY NO TO VIOLENCE!
For the INTERNATIONAL DAY FOR THE ELIMINATION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN, BeeFree Cooperative has made 5 Worth Wearing T-shirt, created together with five international artists to say NO TO VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.
Discover the campaign BeFreeFromViolence http://bit.ly/BeFreeFromViolence! Part of the proceeds of the T-shirt will go to support the campaign!

WORTH WEARING SPECIAL EDITION T-SHIRT Good ideas are worth telling everyone about! We have created a limited edition T-shirts for our Indiegogo supporters! They will be delivered along with a marker to write on them with, to spread your dreams everywhere.YOUR FIRST CUSTOM ETHICAL T-SHIRTBy supporting Worth Wearing you will be able to order  your T-shirt, customised with your design and message, before everyone else. We have chosen Continental Clothing Earth Positive to respect the environment and labour conditions.WORTH WEARING PARTY INVITATIONThose who donate more 100 Euros or more to Worth Wearing will get an official invitation to our launch party in Rome.DESIGN OF YOUR T-SHIRT!If you have an idea in mind or a project to wear our team will design your first customised T-shirt for you.A NEW CAMPAIGNDo you have a campaign just waiting to be brought to life?Donating 2.000 Euro to our creative team will reward  you with:
image (logo, graphics, illustration)
message (naming, tagline)
newsletter template (and you’ll get 3 months free use of our mailer)
We will also help you to define your communication strategy.CAMPAIGN WEBSITEBy donating 5.000 Euro you’ll get a brand new campaign designed together and a campaign website to tell everyone about your project!WELCOME ON BOARDHave you donated 10.000 Euro and do you want to be part of the project?You’ll be immediately be contacted to schedule a work meeting and discuss our collaboration.Welcome to Worth Wearing!

story:
YPN 4 HUGS

 The Hawaii Young Professional Network (YPN808) is raising awareness, DVDs and funds for HUGS Hawaii.  HUGS mission is to improve the quality of life for families as they face the emotional and financial hardships of caring for a seriously ill child.

What We Need

The goal is to raise:

  • $2,000 to go directly to HUGS.
  • 10 portable DVD Players, DVD binders and DVD binders for kids to enjoy a movie night.
  • items can be sent to:

        Young Professional Network
        1259 Aala Street, Suite 300
        Honolulu, HI  96817

story:
Recently featured in:

SF Weekly:
http://www.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2015/01/07/local-dudes-create-new-startup-board-game-thatll-let-you-live-the-life-of-a-rich-techie
SFist:
http://sfist.com/2015/01/08/win_this_tech_themed_board_game_by.php
The Bold Italic:
http://www.thebolditalic.com/articles/6599-new-board-game-lets-you-feel-like-a-startup-techie
Special thanks to all the reporters that have contacted us.

Short Summary

We love startups, San Francisco, and board games, so we combined them to created a Startups of San Francisco board game.

After overwhelming amounts of people started asking for the game map and rules, we decided to start this indiegogo campaign to share it with the world!

SHARE this campaign and email us at startupsofthebay@gmail.com and we will send you the PDFs for FREE. (PDF includes game map, pieces, growth hacking cards, and rules.)

What We Need & What You Get

SHARE this campaign, email us, and get the game PDF for FREE! See some pictures of us creating SOSF. http://startupsofsf.imgur.com/

We will be donating 100% of the money to a charity based here in San Francisco.

Tweet #StartupsofSF to @StartupsofSF for extras!

Have an awesome day everyone!
Team SOSF

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi I am Sayem Khan, Architectural Designer from Boston, MA. Also co-founder of Generation Roots a youth club for rural children in Fondwa, Haiti.  I have lived and worked in Haiti for the last four years since the earthquake, working on building houses and schools.
  • Haiti has the lowest coverage of electricity in the Western Hemisphere, only about 12.5% of the population have regular access to electricity. This does not include any rural areas because they simply don't have any access to electricity.

  • We are raising funds to purchase a compact solar system to enable these children from the youth club can have access to light to study at night, charge a laptop to learn basic computer skills, English and Math.

  • Poverty in itself is a vicious cycle, and these rural children with out access to electricity makes it impossible to get out of the cycle.  With your help we can make a small difference in a large problem, by keeping the hope and the learning enthusiasm of these children alive.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are working towards raising $600 USD to purchase:
  • A Sundaya Solar System w/ Hub and 2 DC lamps
  • (http://www.rpc.com.au/solar-systems/solar-lighting-systems/led-light-kits.html)
  • Also a Solar World Sunmodule 50 Wp Poly Soar panel.  (http://www.altestore.com/store/Solar-Panels/SolarWorld-SW50-Poly-50-Watt-12V-Solar-Panel-with-J-Box/p9865/)
  • For your contribution we will post a handwritten thank you note with your name on it by Generation Roots children on our Facebook Page.

The Impact

  • By making a contribution you will be supporting a global movement towards making solar energy more affordable and accessible.
  • On a local level you will be helping support small businesses in Haiti promote more solar energy which is much needed since using traditional fossil fuel energy to produce centralized energy and distributing it to rural families is not a reality.
  • You will be supporting a micro decentralized electrification and empowerment.

  • "Energizing economies with solar power" article on the benefits of solar energy towards improving impoverished communities                                            (http://www.eco-business.com/news/energising-economies-solar-power/)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, it doesn't mean you can't help.  You can always:

  • Make some noise about this campaign!
  • Share it with your family and friends!
  • Email it, Share it on your Facebook, Tweet it!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for your gernerousity and time.

story:
This is an unfortunate story about an amazing woman.

My mother was born in Cairo, Egypt in the 1930's. One of 6 children, she broke all expectations of a girl at that time and left Egypt alone to study at Vassser University in the USA. She eventually moved to University of California in Berkeley where she got her PhD in English literature.

After a long successful career, she retired in her 80's and had been enjoying her home that she bought.

That is, until the scammers started finding her. 

First it was an unscrupulous con man named Paul Hoffman who took many thousands of dollars for an investment opportunity, and then simply disappeared. 

Then it was a different family with a different investment scam. Preying on such a sweet old woman. They ran off with hundreds of thousands of dollars.

Then the last straw, a "Nigerian Diplomat" scam http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/419_scams for whom she took our a 3rd mortgage on her home with an unscrupulous lender. After one missed payment, they repossessed her home and sent her out on to the street. 

Her credit is ruined so she can't rent a place on her own. She has a pension so she has money to pay rent and bills, but she does not have enough to pay for 1st, last and deposit on an apartment. She is living in a hotel now. 

This in addition to her caring for a mentally disabled son (not me) is too much for this 86 year old woman to handle on her own. 

I'm her son and I am making this campaign as an appeal to help this poor woman out of a bad situation. The $10,000 would go to:

  • First, Last and Deposit on a 2 bedroom apartment for her. 
  • Cost of moving her things in. 
  • Set-up utilities

Once she is in this position, she can take care of herself. 

Please Help :)

story:
Family

The soldiers of the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) have been engaged in Operation Protective Edge to destroy the vast network of Hamas terror tunnels. The sole purpose of these tunnels is to attack, kidnap and kill Israelis. These young men are our family and we are there for them at this critical time. Whatever they need, we will provide. 

Give

Your contribution will go toward personal supplies, a thoughtful care package or a meal for a soldier in Israel who has served or is currently serving in the Gaza operation. 

    Connect

    You can have an even greater impact by including a personal letter or note to a soldier with your donation. Please send letters of support to noteforsoldier@gmail.com. These letters will be printed, placed in individual envelopes and delivered to the soldiers with the supplies, care packages or meals.

story:
Two of Brisbane's most active and giving members of the LGBTIQ community are having a tough time at the moment and we are respectfully asking community to contribute where possible to assist these wonderful women to get back on top of it all.

After over a month of not being able to work due to on-going health complications from Dengue Fever, Monique Forrest was hoping that she was beginning to turn a corner in her battle with chronic fatigue that has left her also unable to drive. Her wife Nicole had been valiantly caring for their three children whilst juggling her own job when an acute reaction to medication caused her to have a severe seizure at work that resulted in four days in a coma in the ICU.

Nicole is thankfully out of the coma now but her road to recovery will take some time due to the stress this episode has had on her brain. She has had to take medical leave without pay and along with Monique being unable to work, the couple have no immediate way of making their financial obligations and providing for their children. 

We are asking respectfully for members of the community where they are able, to donate to assist in relieving their hardship. They are in need of immediate financial assistance so we are making this a two week campaign only so that relief is on the horizon for them.

Many of us, both in business and on a personal level have benefited from both Monique and Nicole's contributions to the LGBTIQ community and this time they need us to be there for them. We know that many people have been looking for a way to assist so here is the perfect opportunity to give back.

People who are not able to assist financially can join the Charity Garage Sale facebook page here and donate goods or come along for a bargain:

All the details via this link.

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Monique-Nicole-Forrest-City-Lickers-Charity-Garage-Sale/1482888181933251 

All monies raised here will go directly to the Forrest family and thank you to the Brisbane community for their contributions so far and into the future.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Scott Chamness. Currently I'm a graduate student at the University of North Carolina Greensboro. On the night of the 27th, the window of my minivan was smashed in, the key ignition was pried off, and my car was stolen. My van was then taken north to Danville VA, used as a getaway vehicle in an armed robbery, and abandoned on the side of the road back in Greensboro. The car was recovered, but the thieves escaped into the night, like the anti-batmen that they are.

I just received the estimate from my awesome mechanic today, and it unfortunately totals around $600 (not counting what was stolen from the car itself of course). As $600 is roughly half the value of the car, it makes more sense to find another car.

My car was important to have, especially at this stage in my life. In the next year, I will be traveling around to interviews for work, many of which will be some distance away. Being without a car would be difficult in this upcoming year, especially with the amount of projects I am working on and conferences I am attending.

So, if you could help out, even just a little, I would very much appreciate it. To show my appreciation, I've attached some.... interesting perks which some of you might enjoy.

story:
WHO: 
Paul is raising money for a non-profit that makes wigs for kids.
WHAT: 
You pick Paul's next haircut to raise money for kids in need.
WHY:
Paul's hair is not long enough to donate but he still wants to help.
WHEN:  
The hair will be cut end of November, worn for  a minimum of 2 days.

VOTE:  Select a Haircut Perk and Contribute now!      ------------------------------>

WHAT'S THE STORY HERE:
My name is Paul and I have not had a haircut since August 2013.  It wasn't for any reason, except maybe that I've never had a ponytail before. Now that I've invested so much time, it should be put to good use. I was going to donate it, but the minimum length is 10 inches from the start of a ponytail which I do not have nor can I wait for. So now you get to choose my next haircut, we raise money to build wigs for children, and the world is a better place. 100% of proceeds go to Locks of Love and ANYTHING GOES. If it helps those in need to make their life just a little bit better, then I can deal with a bowl cut or combover for a couple of days. But please, no bowl cut. Not cool.

WHY IS THE MONEY NEEDED:
It costs about $1,000 to sponsor a child who lost their hair due to injury or illness. This pays for the total cost of providing one cranial prosthesis, or wig. The retail cost of one hairpiece is between $3-6k and requires 6-10 donated ponytails to create. 100% of your donations will go to this.

WHAT WILL I GET IF I DONATE:
You get all the fun of picking a ridiculous haircut for me and the feel-goodery of giving a child in need their self confidence back. Check out the different perks and haircuts, I hope you'll find them fun. You can pick my haircut, how long I keep it, and maybe a special appearance for some epic selfies. 

WHERE DO MY DONATIONS GO:
100% of donations go to the non-profit wig provider, Locks of Love.

WHAT HAPPENS IF THE GOAL IS NOT MET:
Every dollar donated is going to the non-profit, regardless of if we reach the goal. But c'mon, it's only $1,000, we can do this!! 

HOW DO I VOTE FOR A HAIRCUT:
Choose your favorite haircut you'd like to see me get in the Perks, add any Special Perks, and then donate your money. One donated dollar counts as one vote toward that haircut. At the end of the campaign, the haircut perk with the most votes wins. 

Any additional donation dollars will be counted as votes for whichever haircut perk you choose at time of your donation. More dollars equals more votes for the haircut you picked!

VOTE:  Select a Haircut Perk and Contribute now!      -------------------------------->


HOW WILL I KNOW YOU GOT THE HAIRCUT:
Thanks to social media, it will be almost impossible to hide my new haircut even if I wanted to. I'll be posting before and after photos and I work downtown with a wonderful bunch of people who love jokes and sharing them. There will be no shortage of photos and videos documenting my poor decision.

WHY GO TO ALL THIS TROUBLE:
I love people and the older I get, the less it is about me than it is about helping others and adding value to the world. I am always trying new things and if I can do them for a good cause, then all the better. This is fun for me. I produce special events in my spare time and have done several fundraisers with them. With my hair and your support we can do amazing things.

WHY IS THIS A WIN-WIN FOR EVERYONE:
I already have the hair, it needs to be cut. There's already a non-profit that has been providing wigs for children in need for 15 years. There are lots of children who have lost their hair from injury or illness and need wigs. The last piece of this puzzle is YOU. You get to support the non-profit, help the children, and add some laughter to the world when people see my hair. It's a win-win-win-win.

WHERE CAN I GET MORE INFO ON THE NON-PROFIT:
Glad you asked, right here: http://www.locksoflove.org/faq.html

WHERE CAN I GET MORE INFO ON YOU:
I'm everywhere, feel free to connect:
http://instagram.com/paulsabovik
https://www.linkedin.com/in/paulsabovik
https://www.flickr.com/photos/paulsabovikpresents/
https://www.youtube.com/user/paulsabovikpresents/videos

WHAT IF $1.00 IS TO MUCH FOR ME:
Seriously. A dollar. 

IS THERE ANOTHER WAY TO HELP:
Tell your friends. Sharing is caring too. Please. #PaulsNewHaircut

Thank you. Thanks for donating. Thanks for sharing. 
Thanks for just reading this. You are a good person.

Love,
Paul Sabovik
Kyle Harmor

story:
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • I'm a lifelong Midwesterner, but I've always had big dreams.  The time is now!  
  • All right, let's admit it:  living on the West Coast is expensive.  Coordinating a cross-country move is sure to have it's share of pitfalls.  I'm looking for a tiny security blanket, and not really expecting much.
  • You will help us settle in in our new town!  You can be the wind beneath our wings.
  • Also, we will reimburse you all when we get famous.  Pinky swear.
  • All of your funds will keep us crazy kids off of the street.

Share this with your friends, and keep us off the street!
story_txt:
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
I'm a lifelong Midwesterner, but I've always had big dreams.  The time is now!  
All right, let's admit it:  living on the West Coast is expensive.  Coordinating a cross-country move is sure to have it's share of pitfalls.  I'm looking for a tiny security blanket, and not really expecting much.
You will help us settle in in our new town!  You can be the wind beneath our wings.
Also, we will reimburse you all when we get famous.  Pinky swear.
All of your funds will keep us crazy kids off of the street.
Share this with your friends, and keep us off the street!

story:
Three Ways to Donate:

When you shop at Amazon, use the Baker Family Affiliate Link http://bit.ly/bakersamazon -- it doesn't cost you anything and can raise hundreds of dollars for the family. Just use it for your holiday shopping!

Donate with PayPal: Choose the "Send Money" option, then send via a credit card or your PayPal or bank account to bakersgreenacres@yahoo.com

Donate via check to:  Baker's Green Acres, Inc, 1579 Brinks Rd., Marion, MI 49665

FYI: The above video is from Christmas 2012 and the Bakers had to raise money to get through that winter, too. The trial should have happened by now but has been delayed time and time again. They thought they were going to trial early November 2013… but no. The state delayed again for another winter.

The state also changed the rules... Click here to hear Mark explain what just happened. The state knows it will lose in a jury trial so it is bending over backwards to keep that from happening. If they can bankrupt the Bakers in the meantime, that works for them.

Click here for the latest update from Mark Baker.

The Story:

The state of Michigan is determined to force the Bakers into bankruptcy for having the audacity to challenge its make believe authority.

If you are not familiar with the saga:

  • Read this blog post: http://www.fffky.org/stand-bakers-green-acres-save-family-farm/
  • Watch the video above. Here's a link to share: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RPVfduwUx-g
  • Here's a great article on the situation from the beginning: http://hartkeisonline.com/2012/03/30/humane-pork-producers-are-endangered-species-in-michigan/

There is a war on for our real food farms and farmers. Individual states have successfully closed down too many small farms -- watch the movie Farmageddon on Netflix. If you don't have Netflix, go here to see where else to watch it: FarmageddonMovie.com.

Michigan is after the Bakers for raising heritage pigs. The MI Pork Producers (MPP) don’t want these delicious pigs on the market. It wants only its heritage-doubtful pigs for sale. It has millions to throw at this and is not shy about spreading its influence around.

Why a Fundraiser?

MI's DNR has stopped all sales of the Baker's pork. Restaurants have been intimidated into not buying it. No USDA butchers will take in the Baker's pigs. They can't sell their live pigs in state. The DNR has fined the Baker's almost $1,000,000 for not killing their harmless pigs as the DNR ordered.

You can read those details here: http://www.farmtoconsumer.org/news_wp/?p=3800

Honestly, when you read the facts, you won't even believe this could be happening in America. But it is. Right now.

The Bakers:

The Bakers are a family of 9, farming land they own, staying cheerfully true to their faith and their mission despite these dismal events. Mark Baker is a veteran. He’s been a fearless, persistent warrior for his farm and his family.

The Bakers need our help to keep the state from winning and stealing their farm right out from under them.

The Good News:

Because of your activism, states are beginning to lose the farm food freedom battles: Vernon Hershberger, Max Kane, Alvin Schlangen, Shady Grove Farm, Quail Hollow Farm, raw milk at a Louisville Buying Club.

Now the Bakers need our help to join this growing list of victories. They need $40,000 to stay afloat through the winter, to feed the pigs and pay their bills until the trial in March. The trial and hearings have been delayed time and again in the hopes that the embargo will bankrupt the Bakers. Let's put that idea to rest!

Please donate $5 right now (see above for donation options) and share this link with all the people you know who like to eat real food.

At $5 each, you and I and 8,000 of our closest friends can stop this insanity for the Bakers. Plus we'll all have money left over to fight for farm food freedom tomorrow... because it ain't over yet.

A victory for the Bakers could be the tipping point for Michigan. It's a good start!

Please donate right now and share the link. Ask for an early Christmas present: a $5 donation to the Bakers. You have made a difference today.

Thank you.

P.S. All donors get a Friend of the Feral Farmers certificate suitable for framing.

story:
Hi Everyone! 

My name is Robby Southworth, from Vermont, and I've spent most of my adult life volunteering for a variety of organizations both in the United States and internationally. I recently traveled to El Porvenir, Honduras to teach English to adolescents in the community. I found the volunteer experience to be very morally  fulfilling and spiritually uplifting; however during my time there, I discovered a large need for restorations and repairs throughout the community. I came across tons of public health, infrastructural, and educational problems in the town, but the particular project that I have decided to put my efforts towards is a local preschool in the community called Rosa's Kinder. 

Rosa's Kinder is currently in a state of disrepair, which has put a damper on the especial necessity for elementary schooling in El Porvenir. I have plans to head back down to the school to take on some of this construction myself, so I returned to the United States to ask my community members to help support this little town to take one step closer to achieving self-sustainability. Any extra money left over from Rosa's Kinder Construction Project will be put toward the construction of the Finding Hope Women's Shelter which is currently undergoing its first stages of construction.

Please take a look at this Facebook page for photos and info about Rosa's Kinder. More information about Finding Hope Women's Shelter can be found here.

Thank you very much for your support!

Robert D. Southworth


Where are your donations going?

  • Cement block- $1
  • Bag of cement-$10
  • Truck Load of dirt- $50
  • Truck Load of rock- $80
  • Pressure treated 2x4 board- $3
  • Pressure treated 3/4x 6 board- $5
  • Bag of 3 1/2 inch nails- $4
  • Bag of 2 1/2 inch nails- $3

story:
Who We Are

The Belize Zoo Transformation Project is a collaborative effort to promote inclusion and accessibility in both the US and in Belize. Founded in 2012, the project raises funds to make social and physical inclusion a reality. 

Our Story

Our story begins with a man named Jerome who had grown up at and loved The Belize Zoo. While working, Jerome was injured, which eventually led to one of Jerome’s legs being partially amputated. When he went to The Zoo to visit after his surgery, Jerome realized that he could not maneuver his wheelchair through the gravel pathways. He could no longer access the place that meant so much to him.

So The Belize Zoo reached out to the Inclusive Recreation Resource Center at SUNY Cortland (IRRC) in the hopes that we would be able to help The Zoo create a more inclusive environment not only for Jerome but for all of The Zoo’s patrons.

A love affair was born. Working together to form The Belize Zoo Transformation Project, The Belize Zoo and the Inclusive Recreation Resource Center formulated a plan to not only make The Zoo more accessible but also to promote inclusion and accessibility in the US and Belize.

Students gained interest in the project and a class was born. The first group raised over $4000 towards the project and went down to help with the construction efforts.  

   


Our Fundraising Goal

We've made some great progress towards making an accessible environment at The Belize Zoo but our work is not done yet!

In order to finish our project, we need to raise $10,000!

  • Money (whether we reach our goal or not) will go directly to making The Belize Zoo a more inclusive and accessible place!
  • The funds will complete 5 miles of accessible, firm, and stable pathway for all patrons, no matter their ability, to enjoy The Zoo with!
  • When we’re done, The Belize Zoo will be one of the Most Accessible Places in Belize!

The Belize Zoo Transformation Project is working. It is transforming not only a zoo but people too. And that is what truly makes a difference. Thank you for considering our project and for your support, in this project, and in everything else.

We'd Love Your Help!

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
    • Check out our page on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BelizeZooTransformation
    • And Twitter: @Belize_Zoo
    • Visit our sister organizations: http://colfax.cortland.edu/nysirrc/index.html,  http://www.belizezoo.org/
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools!

 

Class of 2013 Post-Trip Video

Meet Jerome


      Perks

      When you donate at any level where you receive an 8x10 photo from The Belize Zoo, please indicate which of the following you would like:

      1.  2. 3.  4. 

      5.  6.   7.  8.

made some great progress towards making an accessible environment at The Belize
Zoo but our work is not done yet! 

In order to finish our
project, we
need to raise $10,000!

Money (whether we reach our goal or not) will go directly to making The
Belize Zoo a more inclusive and accessible place!

The funds will complete 5 miles
of accessible, firm, and stable pathway for all patrons, no matter their
ability, to enjoy The Zoo with!


When we’re done, The Belize Zoo will be one of the Most Accessible Places in Belize!



The
Belize Zoo Transformation Project is working. It is transforming not only a zoo
but people too. And that is what truly makes a difference. Thank you for
considering our project and for your support, in this project, and in
everything else.
We'd Love Your Help!

Please get the word out and
     make some noise about our campaign!

Check out our page on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BelizeZooTransformation

And Twitter: @Belize_Zoo 
Visit our sister organizations: http://colfax.cortland.edu/nysirrc/index.html,  http://www.belizezoo.org/


Use the IndieGoGo share
     tools!
 Class of 2013 Post-Trip VideoMeet JeromePerksWhen you donate at any level where you receive an 8x10 photo from The Belize Zoo, please indicate which of the following you would like:1.  2. 3.  4. 5.  6.   7.  8.

story:
Hi! My name is Heather, and I live in Edmonton, Alberta.

Through a social worker friend, I became aware of a precious little family that really needs our help! The four beautiful children- aged 21, 19, 16, and 6- lost their mom this week when she succumbed to AIDS. This woman did a wonderful job as a mother, and left as her legacy tender, caring children who want nothing more in the world than to give their mom a funeral that honours her for all the kindness and good she contributed to the world.

 She was a single mom with very little means, and there are no funds to cover more than a casket and burial. The cost of the farewell they so hope for- flowers, food for a reception, a blanket for her in the casket, a wig to cover her hair loss- no matter how simply done, it's just completely out of reach. Funds raised will go to cover as much of that as we can.

The wig is so important- unfortunately, it alone will cost $500-700.
There is still about $200 short on the casket.
Funeral brochures (what are they actually called?!) will be about $75 to print.
Flowers, candles, guestbook, misc decorating will be $100.
And the rest will go to food & coffee for the funeral and the wake.

Thank you to the church who is donating the space and the minister!

 

The Impact

There are no big perks to encourage you to donate. It doesn't change the world in any big, measurable way. But for four kids who are now completely alone in the world, this means everything. They've seen the incredible love and care their mom poured into them and into the lives of everyone she knew. They've watched her suffer through a long and horrible illness. This is their final act of love, their last opportunity to "give mom all the things we never could in life".

There is nothing in the world that matters more to these kids than being able to honour their mother. Please, please give them a final memory of her that they can be proud of as they struggle on to try to build lives alone. The impact of this in helping them to start to heal is HUGE.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, please share this campaign far and wide. Due to the nature of the event, we don't have a long time frame to raise funds. Every little bit makes a big difference.

If you live in Edmonton and have availability October 6 or 7 and would like to volunteer to prep food or host/usher, that would be amazing as well- email me at runninginthemud@gmail.com

Thank you so, so much for your support. It means more than I can ever explain.

Heather
