story:
Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2014

Thirty years ago when Robert Bly launched this conference, he provided men a chance to open-up, to talk about issues usually ignored or buried in their psyche and souls. That chance to communicate in fellowship has been a cornerstone of the work of the conference ever since.

This year, in honor of the 30th anniversary of the conference, we want to Assist 30 Men to Attend who otherwise would not be able to do so. The funds we are raising will go towards scholarships, full and partial. If you're reading this, you may have attended a conference and know the treasure that can be found there. Please help us give this gift to other men. Thank you for your support.

Men like this; farmers, craftsmen, laborers, painters, potters, poets, writers, performers, musicians, adventurers, doctors, dentists, professionals and English majors. Like all of us, these men have fought for their lives to get where they are today, and this place is where the honest words of men, and the real experiences they have had in their lives, are shared about.

Our Needs

Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2014
  • Each year there are a number of men that cannot afford the registration fees and in some cases even the travel to attend.  Over these years, many men have been given support through the generous donations of others.  Be part of supporting these men, this year.
The MMC Archive Project (more below)
  • The MMC Archive Project is a multi-year effort that entails digitally remastering the lectures, stories, readings, poems and discussions that were taken over the 30 year history of the MMC.  This effort is costly, time consuming and when finished will be a world treasure.

Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2014

  • Support men that cannot afford the registration fees for our annual Men's Conference.  In some cases the funds will cover travel costs as well.  
  • Supporting us helps real men.  Men that are young, old, middle age, senior and elder are all represented at the conference.  By putting your hands up and supporting men in this real way you are making a real-world difference.  We are also offering perks such as books, downloads, DVD's, and rare lectures or readings from world class poets like Robert Bly and all his friends from over the years.
  • We seriously need to reach our goal, but if we fall short all the proceeds will be still get the men that need it.
The MMC Archive Project
  • The MMC Archive Project is a multi-year effort that entails digitally remastering the lectures, stories, readings, poems and discussions that were taken over the 30 year history of the MMC.  
  • There are countless treasures among these recordings from Robert Bly, Martin Shaw, Daniel Deardorff, Robert Moore, William Stafford, Michael Meade, James Hillman, Lewis Hyde, Malidoma Some, Franic Weller, Doug Von Koss, Thomas R. Smith, Miguel Rivera and many more.. 
  • You can hear samples of these remastered files on the MMC website, powerful segments like the 25th retelling of the Iron John story

Youtube Playlist: IRON JOHN - PARTS 1-4


    • Also see various other segments on the MMC website -  http://www.minnesotamensconference.com/main/ 

    Rebuilding Community

    • By definition the MMC is a gathering of men and a way for men to practice and to interact with each other in community.  The value of reaching out and being open to communicating and to be heard and witnessed by other men is at the core of reclaiming the self, the family, the village and the world around us.
    • The MMC has been conducting it's annual event for 30 years and look many generations into the future as we establish new roots and honor the efforts of many men from its past.
    • Robert Bly, the MMC and thousands of men it has touched have been talked about on national television, countless radio programs and inside the halls of numerous universities.  Robert Bly's Minnesota Men's Conference and supporting the growth and evolution of men in today's world are inseparable.

    Risks & Challenges

    • Although the Minnesota Men's Conference has been around for a long time, we find ourselves having to evolve in a new culture with new challenges.  The MMC nearly disappeared just a few years ago due to the waining health of it's founder Robert Bly and related financial impacts.  
    • Through the deep commitment of the new board of directors and a the enthusiasm of a world class operational team the MMC seeks to re-establish itself and offer it's own treasures to many thousand more men.  
    • We need your financial contribution and word-of-mouth exposure to do that.
    THANK YOU and BLESSINGS
    John Ernst
    Executive Director
story_txt:
Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2014

Thirty years ago when Robert Bly launched this conference, he provided men a chance to open-up, to talk about issues usually ignored or buried in their psyche and souls. That chance to communicate in fellowship has been a cornerstone of the work of the conference ever since.

This year, in honor of the 30th anniversary of the conference, we want to Assist 30 Men to Attend who otherwise would not be able to do so. The funds we are raising will go towards scholarships, full and partial. If you're reading this, you may have attended a conference and know the treasure that can be found there. Please help us give this gift to other men. Thank you for your support.


Men like this; farmers, craftsmen, laborers, painters, potters, poets, writers, performers, musicians, adventurers, doctors, dentists, professionals and English majors. Like all of us, these men have fought for their lives to get where they are today, and this place is where the honest words of men, and the real experiences they have had in their lives, are shared about.

Our Needs
Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2014


Each year there are a number of men that cannot afford the registration fees and in some cases even the travel to attend.  Over these years, many men have been given support through the generous donations of others.  Be part of supporting these men, this year.


The MMC Archive Project (more below)
The MMC Archive Project is a multi-year effort that entails digitally remastering the lectures, stories, readings, poems and discussions that were taken over the 30 year history of the MMC.  This effort is costly, time consuming and when finished will be a world treasure.


Tuition Scholarship Assistance for 2014

 
Support men that cannot afford the registration fees for our annual Men's Conference.  In some cases the funds will cover travel costs as well.   
Supporting us helps real men.  Men that are young, old, middle age, senior and elder are all represented at the conference.  By putting your hands up and supporting men in this real way you are making a real-world difference.  We are also offering perks such as books, downloads, DVD's, and rare lectures or readings from world class poets like Robert Bly and all his friends from over the years.
 We seriously need to reach our goal, but if we fall short all the proceeds will be still get the men that need it.

The MMC Archive Project
The MMC Archive Project is a multi-year effort that entails digitally remastering the lectures, stories, readings, poems and discussions that were taken over the 30 year history of the MMC.  
There are countless treasures among these recordings from Robert Bly, Martin Shaw, Daniel Deardorff, Robert Moore, William Stafford, Michael Meade, James Hillman, Lewis Hyde, Malidoma Some, Franic Weller, Doug Von Koss, Thomas R. Smith, Miguel Rivera and many more.. 
You can hear samples of these remastered files on the MMC website, powerful segments like the 25th retelling of the Iron John story


Youtube Playlist: IRON JOHN - PARTS 1-4


Also see various other segments on the MMC website -  http://www.minnesotamensconference.com/main/ 
 
  Rebuilding Community 
By definition the MMC is a gathering of men and a way for men to practice and to interact with each other in community.  The value of reaching out and being open to communicating and to be heard and witnessed by other men is at the core of reclaiming the self, the family, the village and the world around us. The MMC has been conducting it's annual event for 30 years and look many generations into the future as we establish new roots and honor the efforts of many men from its past.
Robert Bly, the MMC and thousands of men it has touched have been talked about on national television, countless radio programs and inside the halls of numerous universities.  Robert Bly's Minnesota Men's Conference and supporting the growth and evolution of men in today's world are inseparable. 
  Risks & Challenges 
Although the Minnesota Men's Conference has been around for a long time, we find ourselves having to evolve in a new culture with new challenges.  The MMC nearly disappeared just a few years ago due to the waining health of it's founder Robert Bly and related financial impacts.  
Through the deep commitment of the new board of directors and a the enthusiasm of a world class operational team the MMC seeks to re-establish itself and offer it's own treasures to many thousand more men.  
We need your financial contribution and word-of-mouth exposure to do that.

THANK YOU and BLESSINGSJohn ErnstExecutive Director

story:
[english story below]

RÉPANDRE DE LA MAGIE, ENSEMBLE

J'ai besoin de votre aide pour continuer de répandre de la magie dans les rues de Montréal. J'ai prévu 6 nouveaux projets et votre contribution est essentielle à leurs réalisation. Pour chaque don, une chouette contrepartie vous sera offerte.

Depuis 2009, je conçois et réalise des projets participatifs à Montréal et dans mon quartier pour rassembler les voisins et leur donner l'occasion de se raconter. Depuis la Petite fille aux allumettes sur Waverly en 2012, j'ai orchestré 8 projets dans le Mile End dont 1 seul a bénéficié d'une subvention. 

UNE FÉE DANS LES RUES DE MONTRÉAL

Depuis 2 ans, on m’appelle la Fée du Mile End.  J’explore mon quartier afin de créer des expériences infiltrantes, participatives et rassembleuses qui encouragent les gens à se rencontrer et à se raconter.  L’amour dans le Mile End, La mer, Ici un souvenir, Là où l’amour coule et Écrire une fleur ont déclenché des rencontres inusitées et créé des liens entre voisins et passants à travers des “dispositifs-signalétiques” sérigraphiés, cousus, imprimés au pochoir ou étampés, attachés aux clôtures, enroulés autour des arbres, imprimés sur le trottoir ou les vitrines et collés sur les murs. 



MA DÉMARCHE FÉÉRIQUE

J’élimine l’écran. J’amplifie le no-tech parce qu’il est aussi poétique. Je cultive l’offrande dans un contexte marchand. Je privilégie le relationnel et les histoires plutôt que l’économie. J’imagine de nouvelles façons d’échanger. Je préfère les traces écrites plutôt que numériques. Facebook, oui, mais aussi la boîte aux lettres! Je déambule dans la ville autrement que dans le cyberespace. J’ai une responsabilité citoyenne, je suis engagée. J’orchestre des situations de rencontre pour que les gens se racontent. J’aime les inconnus, en français et en anglais! La machine, oui, mais toujours en lien avec la main. Le trottoir est mon jardin.



CALENDRIER DE LA FÉE URBAINE 2014-2015

Voici un petit aperçu des 6 projets dont je rêve jour et nuit pour cette année qui vient. Ils seront orchestrés au gré des saisons dans l'espace public.

Tendresse postale : a été inspiré par l'annonce de la disparition des facteurs à domicile et un fait divers lu sur Facebook qui racontait le manque de tendresse dans la ville. Depuis le 1er janvier, et pendant un an, j'envoie une «lettre-banderole» par jour à quelqu'un avec qui j'ai eu une connexion au café, sur Facebook ou dans la vie. 365 caresses postales auront été cartographiées et envoyées par la poste d'ici le 31 décembre.  Un événement surprise impliquant les personnes à qui j'aurai envoyé une tendresse postale est prévu en janvier 2015.  Ce projet est en route.    [Choisissez la contrepartie «Caresse postale» inspirée de ce projet pour répandre de la tendresse à travers le monde!]



Les Voisinanges : est né suite au suicide d'un voisin. Il s'agit de mettre en place un système où des voisins pourront transformer un instant de tristesse, de découragement ou de solitude en rencontre surprenante.  Via des boîtes aux lettres jaunes installées à travers le quartier, on vous offrira un instant de bonheur : la possibilité de cuisiner, de jardiner, d'une session de tricot ou autre activité pour rentrer dans un nouvel univers. Une fois testé et amélioré, ce concept pourrait s'implanter dans plusieurs quartiers de Montréal (ou ailleurs)! Ce projet est en démarrage (repérage, recrutement, prototypage). 

Même avant d'exister concrètement, cette idée a reçu beaucoup d'attention médiatique. Vous pouvez suivre le projet sur Voisinanges. 


Un dessin à la fenêtre (les fenêtres) : est un conte de Noël qui se racontera au fil des jours dans les rues du Mile End. Chaque jour, du 1er au 24 décembre, à l'aide du calendrier de l'Avent conçu pour l'occasion, vous ouvrirez la fenêtre du calendrier pour connaître l'adresse où suivre le conte. Comme une chasse au trésor urbaine, voisins et passants seront invités à lire 24 fenêtres résidentielles transformées en 24 pages d’un conte écrit sur-mesure. Un dessin à la fenêtre retricote à la fois l’espace urbain et le maillage entre les voisins. La rue devient vivante, métamorphosée et chargée de magie en attendant Noël. Ce projet sera réalisé du 1er décembre au 5 janvier. [Réservez la contrepartie «Calendrier de l'Avent» qui rajoutera plein de magie à cette expérience ambulante!]


La bénédiction des vélos : est né des derniers événements tragiques impliquant des cyclistes et inspiré d'une tradition que j'ai vu en Bolivie. C'est un rituel annuel que je désire instaurer dès qu'on ressort enfin nos vélos afin de protéger les cyclistes le temps d'une saison complète. Je vous garde la surprise mais tous les Montréalais y seront conviés!  Ce rituel aura lieu le 30 mai devant l'église Saint-Jean-Baptiste. [Réservez l' «Atelier déco vélo» offert en contrepartie pour rendre cet événement encore plus festif!]


Le cortège : est inspiré du fait que le Mile End compte la plus grande concentration d'artistes en Amérique du Nord. Il permettra aux artistes de se retrouver dans la rue avec leur oeuvre lors d'une déambulation festive pour qu'on puisse enfin voir qui sont ces créateurs dont on parle tant. Des peintures seront portées, dessins et gravures seront dévoilés, des sculptures seront tirées sur roulettes, des masques seront portés et des performances seront itinérantes... Le tout culminera par un happening champêtre «là où tout est possible». Ce projet sera réalisé à la fin juin.


Le premier repas : est inspiré d'un épisode télévisuel de Master Chef Australie qui m'a été raconté. J'ai immédiatement eu envie de créer une expérience similaire, mais dans la vie, au coeur de la ville. Il s'agit d'un repas en plein air concocté et cuisiné en pleine rue à partir des aliments amassés chez les résidents, orchestré par un grand chef et tout un voisinage. Un projet collectif qui rassemblera tout un quartier. Le nom de chaque famille qui invitera le chef et son équipe à fouiller dans son frigo ira dans un chapeau. 100 noms seront pigés, ils seront les 100 convives!  Ce projet sera réalisé à la fin août.


LA FÉE DOIT CONTINUER D'EXISTER

Même si mes initiatives sont éphémères, elles ont une portée durable. De concert avec les voisins, les résidents et les commerçants, chacun de mes projets participe à la vitalité sociale du quartier  Et puis on n'arrête pas de me le dire... on en veut encore!


MÊME LES FÉES NE PEUVENT VIVRE D'AMOUR ET D'EAU FRAÎCHE 

Le financement servira à la réalisation des 6 projets décrits ci-haut. Je travaille en moyenne 3 mois à temps plein sur chacun de mes projets et je passe à travers la plupart des étapes suivantes :

·  conception / recherche / prospection 

·  repérage territorial et humain / rencontres

·  évaluation de la faisabilité d’un projet et sa pertinence / demande de soumissions 

·  fabrication de maquettes / tests 

·  gestion des inscriptions et informations reçues

·  stratégies de mise en œuvre et de déploiement dans le contexte spécifique

·  correction de texte / mise en pages / graphisme / impression 

·  matériaux / fabrication

·  démarches auprès de partenaires ou de collaborateurs (demande de permission)

·  installation dans l'espace public

·  stratégies de diffusion

·  documentation (photo + vidéo)

·  démontage



Je vous ai concocté une liste de contreparties originales et uniques. Plusieurs sont liées à des projets passés ou futurs. Vous les trouverez dans la colonne de droite. 

Que vous puissiez ou non contribuer financièrement, merci de partager ce projet avec vos voisins, vos amis, votre famille et tout ceux qui aiment la magie dans la ville! Vous pouvez utiliser les outils d'Indiegogo, Facebook, le courriel ou même la boîte aux lettres pour répandre la nouvelle.

Vous pouvez me contacter à : vr.patsy@gmail.com pour obtenir plus d'information sur mes projets ou cette campagne de financement. 

Visitez également mon site Internet à patsyvanroost.com et suivez-moi sur Facebook ici.




HELP MAKE MY NEW PROJECTS HAPPEN!

I need your help to continue spreading my magic in the streets of Montreal. I've designed 6 new projects for the year to come but I need a hand... a bunch of hands actually! I've created a collection of really fabulous perks you can choose from in exchange for a donation.

Since 2009, I've been designing and orchestrating participative art projects in Montreal and in my Mile End neighbourhood. I try to provoke encounters between strangers and neighbours and design devices through which they can reveal a bit of themselves in public space. Since the Little Match Girl On Waverly in 2012, I've orchestrated 8 projects in the Mile End only 1 of which received financial support.



A FAIRY ON THE SIDEWALKS 

For the past 2 years, I have been known as la Fée du Mile End (the Mile End Fairy). My artistic actions become charged with meaning thanks to the ties created between people during their participation. Connections are triggered by signs that appear gradually within a chosen neighbourhood (Love in the Mile End). Whether in the form of an object, accessory or signage, and whether printed on acetate, silkscreened onto fabric, stitched or even incorporating sound, my devices can be found taped to a front door, attached to a fence, wrapped around a tree or printed on the sidewalk (The Mile End Sea) where they reveal a little bit about peoples' stories. All these stories have the power to transform a place, a street, a neighbourhood (Here A Memory). Neighbours finally meet. Strangers discover each other (Where Love Flows). Relationships are created. A feeling of belonging is strengthened. A community is activated. Art makes an appearance in our day-to-day life and the sidewalks bring people together (A Written Flower).



MY FAIRY MANIFESTO

I like to get rid of the screen. I believe low-tech is sexy. Where you’re supposed to sell, I choose to gift. Stories, not economics, are at the heart of my projects. I dream up new ways to interact. I prefer printed traces to digital ones. I use Facebook, but also the mailbox. I walk the city differently than I navigate in cyberspace. I belong to a community and design projects aimed at making it a better place. I get people to meet and share their story. I love strangers, in English and in French. The sidewalk is my garden.



THE YEAR OF A FAIRY 2014-2015

The following are short descriptions of 6 projects I've been dreaming about night and day. With your help, they will happen this year, somewhere in Montreal, in mailboxes, on the sidewalks, in windows, in a church and out on the streets!

Postal Tenderness was inspired by the news that Montreal letter carriers will soon be a thing of the past and by an article posted on Facebook that insisted that the city of Montreal lacks tenderness. Between January 1st and the end of this year, I will have mailed one letter a day to someone with whom I connected over coffee, on the sidewalk, in real life or on Facebook. A total of 365 caresses will have been put on the map and delivered by a mailman or woman by December 31st. A very special event involving all the people who will have received tenderness by mail will take place in January. This project is already up and running!  [Get the "Tenderness" perk inspired by this project to spread tenderness across the world]


The project Voisinanges [a combination of the French words for "neighbour" and "angel"] was designed in the wake of the suicide of one of my neighbours. The idea is to set up a system by which neighbours make themselves available to share a moment with another neighbour, to pull them away from their distress, from their sadness, perhaps to make a new friend. By way of yellow mailboxes installed throughout the neighbourhood, a neighbour will get to experience a moment of happiness, whether in the form of a meal, a gardening session or with knitting needles... anything to help them get out from under their black cloud and into a new active experience. Once tested and improved, this idea could be implanted in other parts of the city and around the world! This project is in its start-up phase.

This idea received a lot of media attention even before it was implemented. You can follow the entire process here: Voisinanges. 


Un dessin à la fenêtre (A Drawing in the Window) is a Christmas story that will be presented outside, in the streets of Mile End. Guided by the custom-designed Advent Calendar, you will open a new window each day from December 1st to the 24th to discover the address of the page of the day. Like a treasure hunt, neighbours and passersby are invited to walk outside and read the story written for the occasion by a neighbour-writer, and posted directly on 24 windows. The sidewalks will become alive and infused with magic while we all wait for Christmas. Although the story will be written in French, English-speaking neighbours can be found somewhere along the streets to translate. Just ask and you shall find... Meet strangers along the way! This project will take place from December 1st to January 5th. [Get the perk "Calendrier de l'Avent" to add loads of fun to this magical experience!] 


The Blessing of the Bikes was triggered after several accidents involving cyclists in Montreal at the beginning of the biking season. I was reminded of something very special that I witnessed in Bolivia and was inspired to adapt it and redesign it as a new protective ritual for cyclists... just as they take their bikes out again after the long winter. I won't go into too much detail (an element of surprise is fun!) but I can tell you that all bike lovers will be invited to take part in this very special event! This event is planned for May 30th in front of Montreal's Saint-Jean-Baptiste Church . [Reserve the perk "Bike Deco" to dress up your bike for the occasion!]


The Parade is inspired by the fact that the Mile End is home to the biggest concentration of artists in North America. It's time that we actually see who these artists are and that we bring them and their work out of the studios! During this carnival-like parade, the artist and their work will be celebrated together. Paintings will be carried, drawings and etchings should be framed, sculptures can be wheeled, masks should be worn and performances performed... all the way to the Champ des Possibles, a field where "tout est encore possible". This happening will wind its way through the streets of the Mile End at the end of June.


The Meal was inspired by an episode of MasterChef Australia I heard about. I immediately redesigned this experience for the city. The Meal is conceived and cooked in the middle of the street from ingredients foraged from neighbours' fridges and pantries. A shared, communal and collaborative experience orchestrated by a celebrated chef with and for an entire neighbourhood. Each household that invites the chef and his or her team of neighbours to collect ingredients will be entitled to a seat at the meal. One hundred names will be picked from a pot: they will be the 100 seated guests.  This meal will be shared at the end of August.


WHY THE FAIRY SHOULD CONTINUE TO EXIST

Even though my projects may be short-lived, their effects are long lasting. By encouraging social connections between neighbours, residents and store owners, they foster a close-knit community. And the truth is, people want more!



EVEN FAIRIES CAN'T MAKE IT WITHOUT MONEY! 

Your donations will help in every steps of the creative process for the 6 projects described above. Each time I design a new project, I go through all or most of the following steps over a three month period:

· design / research / exploration 

· scouting for locations / participants + meetings

· evaluating the relevancy and feasibility of a project / price requests 

· building prototypes / tests 

· managing registration forms / information received

· implementation in public space and specific contexts 

· proofreading / editing / layout / graphic design / printing 

· materials / production

· finding partners and collaborators / asking for permission

· installation in public space

· spreading the news / contacting media

· documentation (photo + video)

· dismantling



I have put together a collection of unique perks, many directly inspired by past projects or projects to come. I hope they will tempt you to make a donation! You will find them to the right of this text.

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, I would love for you to share this campaign with your neighbours, friends, family and anyone you know who loves my kind of city magic. You can do so through Indiegogo, Facebook, e-mail or even the mailbox... if you still have one. 

Feel free to contact me at: vr.patsy@gmail.com for information on my projects or this campaign.  

You can also check out my website at patsyvanroost.com or follow me here on Facebook.

Même avant d'exister concrètement, cette idée a reçu
beaucoup d'attention médiatique. Vous pouvez suivre le projet sur Voisinanges. 





Un dessin à la fenêtre (les fenêtres) : est un conte de Noël qui se racontera au fil des jours dans les rues du Mile End. Chaque jour, du 1er au 24 décembre, à l'aide du calendrier de l'Avent conçu pour l'occasion, vous ouvrirez la fenêtre du calendrier pour connaître l'adresse où suivre le conte. 

Comme une chasse au trésor urbaine, voisins et passants seront invités à lire 24 fenêtres résidentielles transformées en 24 pages d’un conte écrit sur-mesure. Un dessin à la fenêtre retricote à la fois l’espace urbain et le maillage entre les voisins. La rue devient vivante, métamorphosée et chargée de magie en attendant Noël. Ce projet sera réalisé du
1er décembre au 5 janvier. [Réservez la contrepartie «Calendrier de l'Avent» qui rajoutera plein de magie à cette expérience ambulante!]





La bénédiction des vélos : est
né des derniers événements tragiques impliquant des cyclistes et inspiré d'une tradition que j'ai vu en Bolivie. C'est un rituel
annuel que je désire instaurer dès qu'on ressort enfin nos vélos afin de protéger
les cyclistes le temps d'une saison complète. Je vous garde la surprise mais tous les Montréalais y seront conviés!  Ce
rituel aura lieu le 30 mai devant l'église Saint-Jean-Baptiste. [Réservez l' «Atelier déco vélo» offert en contrepartie pour rendre cet événement encore plus festif!]


Le cortège : est
inspiré du fait que le Mile End compte la plus grande concentration d'artistes
en Amérique du Nord. Il permettra aux artistes de se
retrouver dans la rue avec leur oeuvre lors d'une déambulation festive pour qu'on puisse enfin voir
qui sont ces créateurs dont on parle tant. Des peintures seront portées, dessins et gravures seront dévoilés, des sculptures seront tirées sur roulettes, des masques seront portés et des performances seront itinérantes... Le tout culminera par
un happening champêtre «là où tout est possible». Ce projet sera réalisé à
la fin juin.





Le premier repas : est inspiré d'un épisode télévisuel de Master Chef Australie qui m'a été raconté. J'ai immédiatement eu envie de créer une expérience similaire, mais dans la vie, au coeur de la ville. Il s'agit d'un repas en plein air concocté et cuisiné en pleine rue à partir des aliments amassés chez les résidents, orchestré par un grand chef et tout un voisinage. Un projet collectif qui rassemblera tout un quartier. Le nom de chaque famille qui invitera le chef et son équipe à fouiller dans son frigo ira dans un chapeau. 100 noms seront pigés, ils seront les 100 convives!  Ce projet sera réalisé à la fin août.





LA FÉE DOIT CONTINUER D'EXISTER

Même si mes initiatives sont éphémères, elles
ont une portée durable. De concert avec les voisins, les résidents et les commerçants, chacun de mes projets participe à la vitalité sociale du quartier  Et puis on n'arrête pas de me le dire... on en veut encore!



MÊME LES FÉES NE PEUVENT VIVRE D'AMOUR ET D'EAU FRAÎCHE 


Le financement servira à la réalisation des 6 projets
décrits ci-haut. Je travaille en moyenne 3 mois à temps plein sur chacun de mes projets et je passe à travers la plupart des étapes suivantes :
·  conception /
recherche / prospection 
·  repérage
territorial et humain / rencontres 
·  évaluation de la
faisabilité d’un projet et sa pertinence / demande de soumissions 
·  fabrication de
maquettes / tests 
·  gestion
des inscriptions et informations reçues
·  stratégies de
mise en œuvre et de déploiement dans le contexte spécifique
·  correction de texte / mise en pages / graphisme / impression 
·  matériaux /
fabrication
·  démarches auprès
de partenaires ou de collaborateurs (demande de permission)
·  installation
dans l'espace public
·  stratégies de
diffusion
·  documentation
(photo + vidéo)
·  démontage




Je vous ai concocté une liste de contreparties originales et uniques. Plusieurs sont liées à des projets passés ou futurs. Vous les trouverez dans la colonne de droite. 

Que vous puissiez ou non contribuer financièrement, merci de partager ce projet avec vos voisins, vos amis, votre famille et tout ceux qui aiment la magie dans la ville! Vous pouvez utiliser les outils d'Indiegogo, Facebook, le courriel ou même la boîte aux lettres pour répandre la nouvelle.
Vous pouvez me contacter à : vr.patsy@gmail.com pour obtenir plus d'information sur mes projets ou cette campagne de financement. 
Visitez également mon site Internet à patsyvanroost.com et suivez-moi sur Facebook ici.





HELP MAKE MY NEW PROJECTS HAPPEN!
I need your help to continue spreading my magic in the streets of Montreal. I've designed 6 new projects for the year to come but I need a hand... a bunch of hands actually! I've created a collection of really fabulous perks you can choose from in exchange for a donation.
Since 2009, I've been designing and orchestrating participative art projects in Montreal and in my Mile End neighbourhood. I try to provoke encounters between strangers and neighbours and design devices through which they can reveal a bit of themselves in public space. Since the Little Match Girl On Waverly in 2012, I've orchestrated 8 projects in the Mile End only 1 of which received financial support.





A FAIRY ON THE SIDEWALKS 
For the past 2 years, I have been known as la Fée du Mile End (the Mile End Fairy). My artistic actions become charged with meaning
thanks to the ties created between people during their participation. Connections are triggered by signs that
appear gradually within a chosen neighbourhood (Love in the Mile End). Whether in the form of an object, accessory or signage, and whether printed on acetate, silkscreened onto fabric, stitched or even incorporating sound, my devices can be found taped to a front door, attached to a fence, wrapped
around a tree or printed on the sidewalk (The Mile End Sea) where they reveal a little bit about peoples' stories. All these stories have the power to transform
a place, a street, a neighbourhood (Here A Memory). Neighbours finally meet. Strangers discover each other (Where Love Flows). Relationships are created. A feeling of belonging is strengthened. A community is activated. Art makes an appearance in our day-to-day life and the sidewalks bring
people together (A Written Flower).



MY FAIRY MANIFESTO

I like to get rid of the screen. I believe low-tech is sexy. Where you’re supposed to sell, I choose to gift. Stories, not economics, are at the heart of my projects. I dream up new ways to interact. I prefer printed traces to digital ones. I use Facebook, but also the mailbox. I walk the city differently than I navigate in cyberspace. I belong to a community and design projects aimed at making it a better place. I get people to meet and share their story. I love strangers, in English and in French. The sidewalk is my garden.


THE YEAR OF A FAIRY 2014-2015
The following are short descriptions of 6 projects I've been dreaming about night and day. With your help, they will happen this year, somewhere in Montreal, in mailboxes, on the sidewalks, in windows, in a church and out on the streets!
Postal Tenderness was inspired by the news that Montreal letter carriers will soon be a thing of the past and by an article posted on Facebook that insisted that the city of Montreal lacks tenderness. Between January 1st and the end of this year, I will have mailed one letter a day to someone with whom I connected over coffee, on the sidewalk, in real life or on Facebook. A total of 365 caresses will have been put on the map and delivered by a mailman or woman by December 31st. A very special event involving all the people who will have received tenderness by mail will take place in January. This project is already up and running!  [Get the "Tenderness" perk inspired by this project to spread tenderness across the world]



The project Voisinanges [a combination of the French words for "neighbour" and "angel"] was designed in the wake of the suicide of one of my neighbours. The idea is to set up a system by which neighbours make themselves available to share a moment with another neighbour, to pull them away from their distress, from their sadness, perhaps to make a new friend. By way of yellow mailboxes installed throughout the neighbourhood, a neighbour will get to experience a moment of happiness, whether in the form of a meal, a gardening session or with knitting needles... anything to help them get out from under their black cloud and into a new active experience. Once tested and improved, this idea could be implanted in other parts of the city and around the world! This project is in its start-up phase.
This idea received a lot of media attention even before it was implemented. You can follow the entire process here: Voisinanges. 


Un dessin à la fenêtre (A Drawing in the Window) is a Christmas story that will be presented outside, in the streets of Mile End. Guided by the custom-designed Advent Calendar, you will open a new window each day from December 1st to the 24th

to discover the address of the page of the day. Like a treasure hunt, neighbours and passersby are invited to walk outside and read the story written for the occasion by a neighbour-writer, and posted directly on 24 windows. The sidewalks will become alive and infused with magic while we all wait for Christmas. Although the story will be written in French, English-speaking neighbours can be found somewhere along the streets to translate. Just ask and you shall find... Meet strangers along the way! This project will take place from December 1st to January 5th. [Get the perk "Calendrier de l'Avent" to add loads of fun to this magical experience!] 


The Blessing of the Bikes was triggered after several accidents involving cyclists in Montreal at the beginning of the biking season. I was reminded of something very special that I witnessed in Bolivia and was inspired to adapt it and redesign it as a new protective ritual for cyclists... just as they take their bikes out again after the long winter. I won't go into too much detail (an element of surprise is fun!) but I can tell you that all bike lovers will be invited to take part in this very special event! This event is planned for May 30th in front of Montreal's Saint-Jean-Baptiste Church . [Reserve the perk "Bike Deco" to dress up your bike for the occasion!]

The Parade is inspired by the fact that the Mile End is home to the biggest concentration of artists in North America. It's time that we actually see who these artists are and that we bring them and their work out of the studios! During this carnival-like parade, the artist and their work will be celebrated together. Paintings will be carried, drawings and etchings should be framed, sculptures can be wheeled, masks should be worn and performances performed... all the way to the Champ des Possibles, a field where "tout est encore possible". This happening will wind its way through the streets of the Mile End at the end of June.



The Meal was inspired by an episode of MasterChef Australia I heard about. I immediately redesigned this experience for the city. The Meal is conceived and cooked in the middle of the street from ingredients foraged from neighbours' fridges and pantries. A shared, communal and collaborative experience orchestrated by a celebrated chef with and for an entire neighbourhood. Each household that invites the chef and his or her team of neighbours to collect ingredients will be entitled to a seat at the meal. One hundred names will be picked from a pot: they will be the 100 seated guests.  This meal will be shared at the end of August.



WHY THE FAIRY SHOULD CONTINUE TO EXIST
Even though my projects may be short-lived, their effects are long lasting. By encouraging social connections between neighbours, residents and store owners, they foster a close-knit community. And the truth is, people want more!



EVEN FAIRIES CAN'T MAKE IT WITHOUT MONEY! 
Your donations will help in every steps of the creative process for the 6 projects described above. Each time I design a new project, I go through all or most of the following steps over a three month period:
· design / research / exploration 
· scouting for locations / participants + meetings
· evaluating the relevancy and feasibility of a project / price requests 
· building prototypes / tests 
· managing registration forms / information received
· implementation in public space and specific contexts 
· proofreading / editing / layout / graphic design / printing 
· materials / production
· finding partners and collaborators / asking for permission
· installation in public space
· spreading the news / contacting media
· documentation (photo + video)
· dismantling



I have put together a collection of unique perks, many directly inspired by past projects or projects to come. I hope they will tempt you to make a donation! You will find them to the right of this text.
Even if you are unable to contribute financially, I would love for you to share this campaign with your neighbours, friends, family and anyone you know who loves my kind of city magic. You can do so through Indiegogo, Facebook, e-mail or even the mailbox... if you still have one. 
Feel free to contact me at: vr.patsy@gmail.com for information on my projects or this campaign.  
You can also check out my website at patsyvanroost.com or follow me here on Facebook.

story:
What The Mighty Food Fight is about...

You could have southern fried tofu with coleslaw and chipotle salsa, or breaded aubergine with spinach, sweet onions and smoked paprika tahini sauce. Throw in a side of cajun style okra or perhaps battered pickles?

Or how about a dozen huge vegan donuts covered in mini Oreos, salted caramel, chocolate-peanut butter or filled with jam delivered to your door on Friday?

Hungry yet?

You guessed it we're a wonderfully gluttonous couple of vegans with a food truck called René, an old Citroën HY van, serving amazing vegan food to the people of Bristol. Homemade, plant-based and delicious lunches since end of October 2014, with lots of folks already carrying a well-stamped loyalty card!

Oh yes, our customers. We love them so much! We know it's sounds a little over the top, but we really do. Vegans, non-vegans, lunch-breakers, sugar-seekers and the odd canine friend, they have all been so lovely, and supportive too.

Hannah and Isabel who started The Mighty Food Fight met at a punk show and discovered their love for vegan food and a passion for bringing it to the masses. We do it for the animals but also because there are so many plants that taste bloomin' amazing! We fell in love with René's cute and charming ways and just went for it!

We've got big plans to take their food to places in Bristol, for example, we've just done a few popup dinners with much-loved Korean in Bristol restaurant Sky Kong Kong! We're on a mission. Despite this, we want to keep making tasty things in our home kitchen and carefully consider all their menu choices.

We think that the fact that a little boy, on his birthday, specially requested a trip to The Mighty Food Fight to get a donut from the 'Donut Ladies', and have them sing happy birthday to him, says it all!

Here's the deal...

This has been such an awesome adventure, but René, our food truck, is currently in our local Citroën garage and needs to have major repair work before he can get back out on the road. We spent lots of time and funding getting him to near perfect health before we set up, and we're so sad he's poorly.

  • We need about £750, which is the estimate we've been given by the garage, to cover his cylinder head being replaced and all the spark plugs too. He's old so the parts are hard to come by.
  • We'd like to say thank you to anyone who can help us reach this goal with donuts and other treats from The Mighty Food Fight! Have a look at the perks on the right.
  • If we don't reach our goal, any funds raised will go toward paying our garage bill!

What it will mean to us...

We can't easily describe how much this will mean to us, but...

  • We think that The Mighty Food Fight brightens up our pitch area and is a little blue gem in a concrete jungle!
  • Our customers have told us our donuts really brighten up their day! We want to get back to them.
  • We're feel like we're helping to show people that vegan food can be really delicious!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help but just can't contribute right now, it would be super helpful to us if you could:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Find us on social media and share away!
www.themightyfoodfight.com
www.facebook.com/mightyfoodfight
www.twitter.com/mightyfoodfight

Thanks for reading, 

Hannah, Isabel and René.

story:
A Family For Every Child is a nonprofit organization in Eugene, Oregon. Our mission is dedicated to finding loving, permanent families for every waiting foster child. 

As a child grows older, we expect their ability to fully function in society to grow as well. From an early age, many of us are taught basic skills in life, usually from our parents, other family members, mentors, and maybe even friends. These skills may be as simple as washing laundry or more difficult like balancing your money. 
Unfortunately, many foster children are not provided with lessons as such. Here at A Family For Every Child, we provide a free "Life Skills" program offered once a month to foster children and their mentors. This program is very important to us as we want to create opportunities for these children and lead them towards a successful life. 
Previous classes have included: Basic finance for all ages, a resume writing workshop, and everyday personal care. Our next class will focus on Internet Safety. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $500. 

The money raised from this campaign will help our organization grow the life skills program. Items that we are hoping to purchase include: Binders, Notebooks, Pens and Pencils, Snacks, and much more! 

    The Impact

    As a society, we can change these children's lives for the better. By providing them with knowledge and support, we are aiding in their future success. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      - Help get the word out: share this campaign with your friends! 
      - Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. 
      - Please email Kristi at Kristi@afamilyforeverychild.org regrading questions or more information about the program.

story:
Short Summary

Langston Dwellings Community Gardening program is based on the concept created by resident Kenneth Butler, in 2007. Using Organic Gardening and Exercise to improve ones quality of life and reduce preventable health issues. With over forty years of gardening experience, Mr. Butler has been the garden manager at Langston Dwellings for the past seven years, he coordinates the community garden sit up, programs and managed the day to day operations, holding various gardening classes, work shops, summer camps to teach the community the benefits of organic gardening, Taking kids to other gardens, farmers markets, to passing out the fresh fruit and vegetables to our seniors.  Mr. Butler assisted in the creation of two other housing gardens, A Rooting DC, presenter. Guest speaker on To Heal DC radio show on WPFW 89.3 FM, numerous news paper articles and blogs featuring Mr. Butler and his work at Langston Dwellings.  Last year he resigned for health reasons and others were brought in to operate the garden, that didn’t happen. Heart broken not seeing the garden and never wanting to see this happens again!  Mr. Butler, still very much involved in the lives of our kids, the community and knowing the importants of the effects this garden had on our kids and community.  Decided to return in 2014 to coordinate the refurbishing of our community garden programs and managed the day to day operations once again. But only if an Advisory Consultation on restoring our garden could be done and a committee of his peers were involved in redesigning it, adding new tools and putting in twelve raised beds and drip irrigation are part of our new garden design.  Needing to reduce maintenance and upkeep time on all involved in or participating in the gardening programs, raised beds were the way to do this.

What We Need & What You Get

As you can see in our pitch image Langston Dwellings also has a floral garden in need of assistance too.  Although we all would love to see drifts of color, wild flower prairies or bushes of tomatoes growing. We're still $ 10,000.00 away from getting our feet wet.  With estiments ranging from $6,500. to $7,500.  for lumber and hardware to build twelve 8x4x1 feet and one 25x12x1 feet raised bed and install drip irrigation. With your contributions, Langston will be able to have an Advisory Consultation on restoring and redesign our garden, purchase lumber and hardware to build our raised beds, buy mulch and pavers, install irrigation and in bed drip lines to improve our production output and water conservation. With the additional $3,000 requested we will be able improve and complete ground elevation and purchase a variety of new and reused tools and build a new tool shed to protect them.  Last year most of the tools were borrowed and never returned, so we’ll doing most of the preparation work for 2015 by hand.  With five fruit producing trees that need to be maintained, pruning, pest and disease control, as well as organic sprays, keeping down the risk of fungal infections and environments suitable for pests. Your assistance will ensure our Healthy Community Program (LIVE)  and the community garden continues, Designed to provide children grades 3rd through 8th grade with a safe and academically engaging environment when the school day ends. The aim of our garden camps and  programs is to strengthen our students academically and team-based self-esteem building activities, individual skills and learning enrichment activities consisting of field trips, cooking classes, physical education and gardening.

    The Impact

    Langston Dwellings Healthy Community Program (LIVE)

    Goal is to transform our traditional garden into a raised bed one with irrigation by 2015. Reduce the amount of water used, labor and time is takes to maintain our garden plots, floral and vegetable gardens as a whole.  Increase our programs outreach to other communities and Improve our educational missions: To bring green living, better nutrition and wellness to  Langston Dwellings and all public housing communities. Though Low Income Vegetable Gardens and Exercise. 

    •To educate, the community about the issues of hunger and nutrition.

    •Improve residents eating habits and choices though educational workshops.

    •Increase environment awareness and community health.

    •Increase physical activities and fitness.

    •Increase consumption of fresh fruits and vegetables. 

    •Join in the greening of public housing communities. 

    •Educate about the Farmers Market Nutrition Programs (FMNP) and (SNAP) 

    WIC vegetables and Fruit Cash – Value Checks (CVC)

    Risks & Challenges

    Because we are a low income public housing complex. We never charged much, only $15.00 per year, per family plot, with over eighty percent of our residents living on a fixed income. Fund raising has been difficult within the community. Even if we'll have to do this in sections. We welcome volunteers to assist with the organization of events, participant’s activities, and fundraising events and ideas.

    Labor with any project can limit what can and can not be done on any given day. Even with the assistance of DCHA, to meet our deadline of completing installation of our new garden by October 31, 2014 we have included additional funding into our campaigns funding request for labor.



    Other Ways You Can Help

     Langston is special, the District of Columbia first and oldest housing complex, just celebrating our 75th Diamond jubilee in May 2013.  Even if you can't make a monetary contribution, there is other ways you can contribute Gifts-in-kind are tangible gifts of personal property, such as books, school supplies, technology, artwork (slcuptures), tools, garden tools or equipment. We welcome volunteers to assist with the organization of events, participant’s activities, and fundraising.  You can also help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. So don’t forget to view us on Facebook or use the Indiegogo share tools! That in itself would mean a lot to us. On behalf of the Residents of Langston Dwellings and the Langston Dwellings Community Garden, I wish to thank you in advance for your help and assistance in restoring the pride and glue of this community. Langston Dwellings Community Garden.

With the additional $3,000 requested we will be able improve and complete ground elevation and purchase a variety of new and reused tools and build a new tool shed to protect them.  Last year most of the tools
were borrowed and never returned, so we’ll doing most of the preparation work for 2015 by
hand.  With five fruit producing trees that need to be maintained, pruning, pest and disease control, as well as organic sprays, keeping down the risk of fungal
infections and environments suitable for pests. Your assistance will ensure our Healthy
Community Program (LIVE) 
and the community garden continues, Designed to provide children grades 3rd through 8th grade with a safe
 and academically engaging environment when the school day ends. The aim
 of our garden camps and  programs is to strengthen our students academically 
and team-based self-esteem building activities, individual skills and learning enrichment activities 
consisting of field trips, cooking classes, physical education and gardening. 
  The Impact 
Langston Dwellings Healthy Community Program (LIVE)
Goal is to transform our traditional garden into a raised bed one  with irrigation by 2015. Reduce the amount of water used, labor and time is takes to maintain our garden plots, floral and vegetable gardens as a whole.  Increase our programs outreach to other communities and Improve our educational missions: To bring green living, better nutrition and wellness
to  Langston Dwellings and all public housing communities. Though Low Income Vegetable
 Gardens and Exercise. 
•To educate, the
community about the issues of hunger and nutrition. 
•Improve
residents eating habits and choices though educational workshops. 
•Increase environment awareness and community health. 
•Increase physical activities
and fitness. 
•Increase consumption of
fresh fruits and vegetables.  
•Join in the
greening of public housing communities. 

•Educate about the Farmers
Market Nutrition Programs (FMNP) and (SNAP)   
WIC vegetables and Fruit Cash –
Value Checks (CVC)
  Risks & Challenges


Because we are a low income public housing complex. We never charged much,
only $15.00 per year, per family plot, with over eighty percent of our
residents living on a fixed income. Fund raising has been difficult within
the community. Even if we'll have to do this in sections. We welcome volunteers
to assist with the organization of events, participant’s activities, and
fundraising events and ideas.
Labor with any project can limit what can and can not be done on any given
day. Even with the assistance of DCHA, to meet our deadline of completing
installation of our new garden by October 31, 2014 we have included additional
funding into our campaigns funding request for labor. 

  Other Ways You Can Help 

 Langston is special, the District of Columbia first and oldest
housing complex, just celebrating our 75th Diamond jubilee in May
2013.  Even if you can't make a monetary contribution, there is other ways you can contribute Gifts-in-kind are tangible gifts of personal property, such as books, 
school supplies, technology, artwork (slcuptures), tools, garden tools or equipment. We welcome volunteers to assist with the organization of events, 
participant’s activities, and fundraising.  You can
also help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. So don’t
forget to view us on Facebook or use the Indiegogo share tools! That in itself would
mean a lot to us. On behalf of the Residents of Langston Dwellings and the Langston Dwellings Community
 Garden, I wish to thank you
in advance for your help and assistance in restoring the pride and glue of this
community. Langston Dwellings Community Garden.

story: My friend Rita Lambert (formerly Moser) has been deeply impacted by the Aurora, CO theater shootings this past Friday. Rita has lost her only grandchild, Veronica Moser, and her 25 year old daughter, Ashley, is in critical condition having suffered bullets to her throat and abdomen. Ashley still requires additional surgeries to remove a bullet but, in all likelihood, she will remain paralyzed. They are facing burial costs and huge medical bills. Thank you for your help and prayers.

Thank you for your help and prayers.

story:
Short Summary

Sharpe19 is an amazing person with plenty of time to help people out. Her popularity of her suits has grown over the last year or so to the point that she's started to amass a large band of followers. One of the cons she would love to attend is the Eurofurence con in Germany, I thought it would be an awesome surprise to her for her fans and followers to get her there without the worry of affording it all, just so her and Pizzawolf can relax and enjoy themselves.

What We Need

Breaking it down, this is what I made it out to cost:

  • $2496 for return plane tickets for them both (correct at time of press..)
  • $720 for the entrance to EF13 plus early entry and late leaving, as well as entrance to the stage and sponsorship pack.
  • Emergency Money Fund of €500 in case of illness/problems/excess baggage or any other unknown factors.
  • Buffer of $500 for the rise in plane costs for next year as well as con fee's increasing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • You could offer to donate art to the cause for X amount donated.
  • You could offer transport to and from airports.
  • You can even spread the word around in what we are trying to do.

I'm not expecting to make the full amount, but anything we can make to help towards the cost of bringing them to EF19 would be amazing. Please guys, every dollar counts, plus any peices of art that you would like to donate into the pot as a thank you would be amazing too!!

story:
Connected, we grow! 

Join us in “barn-raising”.  Barn-raising is when rural farmers (or a wiki community) gather together to build and have a good time doing it! You can be a big part of making it happen. You can learn about the project, track its progress, contribute at the level you feel comfortable, and receive tangible rewards. You can pass the movement along to friends who might also want to join in.

 

Help make this dream happen. Our Connection goal is to raise awareness about Dreamfish Place Nairobi by warming the place up with YOUR cozy awesomeness, wherever you are! Our Growth goals are to rally $15,000, book our guestrooms and collaboration venue, and sponsor work retreats for women and youth entrepreneurs.  We have given ourselves until July 24th to meet our goals.  When we raise the first $12,000, then a generous donor has pledged to pitch in the last $3,000 to make our final goal of $15,000.

About the Project

Dreamfish Place Nairobi offers collaboration accommodations for change agents and entrepreneurs. On five acres near the Nairobi National Park, close yet outside the bustle of downtown Nairobi, capital of Kenya, we we also offer residencies to visiting technologists, artists and contributors in Dreamfish community.  Financially and physically,  Dreamfish Place supports the Dreamfish Cooperative. 

 

What Dreamfishers say:

"Instead of working alone in Tanzania, I was invited to be artist in  residence in Nairobi, to help to make for this amazing place. It has helped me grow, understand East Africa more, meet and work with so many wonderful people from all over the  world and share experiences in a ridiculously happy family of friends. This place is beautiful, expansive, inspirational, magical and peaceful. The perfect place to let yourself free. "

Imraan Osman, artist and web designer

 

"I am encouraged and inspired by the great support system at Dreamfish. I now  see Dreamfish Place for what it is: an oasis for the realization of  dreams. And my dreams already seem to be taking shape here."
Joan Opiyo, Social Media consultant

 

"Coming  here to Dreamfish Place has made me see that there are connections here that  can help us to get clean water to the Maasai community so that girls can  go to school. I am very excited about being here, love the energy of  the place".
Therese Helm, Maasai water project, Collaborate 4 Africa

"A  beautiful retreat in the capital of Kenya...If you are looking for  inspiration, peace and harmony - with both people and nature - Dreamfish  Place is the place for you. It certainly was for me!"
Eckhart Schleberger,  International Development consultant


Our Story

From San Francisco to Kenya - Dreamfish is a peer-to-peer global collaboration network distributed in 26 countries and co-owned by hundreds of women and youth entrepreneurs in developing countries and professionals that want to change the world.Many of come from the streets and margins of global society. We are creative, diversely-abled and oriented. Until now, we have operated by the tenacity, generous sweat and faith of volunteers and donors across the world. We have worked for this dream: a world where people can work like humans, together with love and respect. A world where all people can flourish in  livelihoods.  We worked together by web and phone.  In cafes and art studios. We worked late at night, after day jobs. Some of us have never met in person, yet we are close in our love for humanity.

 

Being human, we longed for physical contact and a place to gather and share. Now, we also urgently need a way to generate sustainable funding for the cooperative to support a full-time staff, so that we can more fully serve our mission. Thus, the idea for Dreamfish Place was born. Dreamfish Place Nairobi is the first of several Dreamfish Places in the world to come. 

 

So, on April 1st,  2011, we arrived with two suitcases and a dream. Weeks later,  more Dreamfishers arrived to help.

 

We came by long bumpy bus rides on dirt roads from Tanzania. We came by planes from Austria and California. We came from rural villages, urban slums and Silicon Valley.

(putting up the 30 ft internet pole)

We got to work.  Joan Opiyo is telling our story. Joe Bogner, our lead volunteer developer in Ohio, is donating web hosting. Emmanuel Okyere in Ghana is offering sys admin.  Imraan Osman made a brochure and this fun illustration. Steve Martin and Johannes Klose made the videos for this campaign.  Community Leadership Summit West, a community of open source community managers, is sponsoring a year of server costs for our collaboration service, Dreamfish Pad.  


Camille Harris and Californian Dreamfishers have put together a load of donated household goods. African Dreamfishers have donated art. Our partners, Collaboration 4 Africa, showed up virtually to offer help. Reach and Teach is offering distribution for our rural Maasai Dreamfishers and social impact projects benefiting from Dreamfish Place to reach an international market.

 

In our first weeks in Dreamfish Place, we have made things happen. Rich in spirit, but still scarce in cash flow, we are swimming hard! To make furniture, we innovated, using recycled materials.

 

We reached out to people to share our dream. We hosted guests from six countries in our new guest rooms, hosted four community events, facilitated collaboration among four African social justice projects, and coached local women and youth in internet skills training.

 

Now, to realize the  potential of our dream, we are asking you to join us and help. 

 

You Get Real Value & You Create Real Value

 

 You get real value.

You can book a stay at Dreamfish Place, sponsor a Dreamfish membership or sponsor Dreamfishers doing what you care about.

 

You create real value.

Every dollar spent will make a meaningful impact in individuals’ lives.  Funds collected here will be used for the following:


  • Food and skill development: For $5, you feed a local youth dreamfishing to gain work experience and professional skills
  • Furnishings: Through Love Shack, an educational NGO enabling children to go to school, your funds will sponsor a collective of rural women to weave woven stools in Dreamfish colors and make furnishings from recycled clothes.
  • Interactive Artisan workshop huts: Local eco artisans and artists-in-residence making objects that enable collaboration ( ie blackboards, tables) from recycled materials.
  • Computer lab and network: Laptop repair to enable internet and software development skills for local women and youth and extend wireless network throughout five acres for open air collaboration.
  • Shipping donations: Dreamfishers in the U.S. have donated 700 pounds of essential supplies. Help ship the donations to us in Kenya.
  • Increase sharing: Improve core aspects of Dreamfish services to improve knowledge-sharing between online community and rural low-income Dreamfishers.
  • Growth: With $1000, you enable Dreamfish to hire staff so that Dreamfish can do so much more for individuals' growth.

Can We Go Beyond Our Goals?

YES, we can.  We can book up to 28 people in our accommodations and there is no limit to the amount of funds we can raise. All additional funds raised will be put to good use. 

 

What Happens If We Don't Raise Our Goal?

All reservations and rewards will be honored.  We will get all the funds raised regardless. However, if we make the first $12,000, then we will get the last $3,000 from a matching donor. But, if we raise only $11,000, we will lose the matching pledge and also be charged 4% more by Indiegogo. 

 

When Will You Receive Your Reward?

As soon as we reach our funding deadline, we will start booking your reservations and getting rewards out to you. If you want to get started right away, just let us know and we'll swim, swim! Email support@dreamfish.com

story:
Please note: All contributions to this fundraising campaign will be processed via our 501(c)(3) non-profit ally Reclaiming, so your donation *IS* fully tax-deductible!

About Terra's Temple

Terra’s Temple is a sacred space and a nexus for community committed to honoring and celebrating Mother Earth, in all her forms. You can come to the Temple to rejuvenate, meditate, and heal in mind, body, and spirit. Our regular events aim to help you connect, create, and regenerate through a wide array of resources and support. Our most-attended current offering, Day of Renewal, is an open invitation to the community to visit Terra’s Temple and receive healing sessions from a diverse group of volunteer practitioners. Other offerings include a women’s Red Tent circle, lectures, drama, music, and various classes.

The Importance of Terra's Temple:

There was once a time when there were countless sacred places on our planet that were dedicated to the reverent aspects of Mother Nature.  Historically there were temples that offered opportunities for connecting with the various mysteries of the Earth and greater cosmos, but most have been subsumed into other structures, such as churches devoted to more institutional religions. In our modern world there are currently few sacred spaces explicitly dedicated to Mother Earth, either in the Bay Area or elsewhere.

We are living in a time in which global warming, mass extinction, deforestation, overpopulation, lack of clean water, hunger, poverty, war, and many other planetary wounds have peaked beyond crisis. Although here in the Bay Area, we have a plethora of citizens committed to making a positive difference in the global issues facing us, in this urban environment people are often overworked, overcommitted, and feel an absence of belonging and interconnection.

Terra’s Temple has created a beautiful and sacred space where people can come to rest, heal, and connect with themselves, their community and the planet. In this place they can receive blessings, participate in rites of passage ceremonies, pray/meditate, and expand their sense of self to include the larger web of life they are an integral part of. Festivals and various annual events have been creating temporary sacred spaces for years, but few permanent sacred spaces have been maintained in the urban area. It takes time, commitment, resolve to follow through, and attention not only to spirit but also to the mundane details—all of which we have successfully accomplished over the last five years.

Growing Into Our Next Phase:

Terra’s Temple has essentially reached the limitations of our current location to serve the community. In order to expand our capacity for Day of Renewal, host larger gatherings for popular inspirational speakers, be more accessible to the public, and simply craft a more devotional atmosphere, the Temple must spread its branches and grow. The Temple has thrived in its current incarnation for five years, but sustainable service has been our priority, not profit, so we’re reaching out and asking the community for help to achieve the next phase of our vision.

We Found a Potential New Space!

 

We have already identified an available property in Berkeley, California that would be a perfect new home for Terra’s Temple. As you enter the space, which was once the Little Chapel of the Flowers, you breathe into high vaulted ceilings and are struck by light streaming through a stained-glass image of two trees intertwined in mutual support. The architecture is humbly elegant, simultaneously intimate and reverent, a rare find indeed. An additional wing of the building provides multiple rooms for healing offerings, and there is even more connected space that the Temple could potentially blossom into in the future. The space is beautiful and spacious with the added bonuses of being more accessible, closer to public transportation (Ashby BART) and improved parking for cars and bikes.

After spending the past several months scouring for potential real estate, we now have a very tangible goal, and not only the passionate conviction in our mission, but a destination address, concrete numbers to work with, and a deeply considered business plan to back it up. Terra’s Temple is already making progress towards incorporation and receiving official 501(c)(3) non-profit status, but we need additional funding to complete and file the paperwork. We have identified the need for three paid positions in order to move forward with sustainability and success. Expanding capacity and services will require hiring a part-time administrator, a part-time events co-coordinator and a part-time trainer and manager. Moving into the new space will require down payment of first and last month’s rent and a security deposit. And because we are committed to shepherding the Temple through this growth process with pragmatism, we’re seeking funds to not only make this initial move, but also to give us a reasonable buffer for a couple of months as we build momentum, spread the word about our expanded capabilities, fill the calendar with additional events, and increase membership.

What We Need:

We need $39,660 to launch this next phase of our growth. Unfortunately we will also need an additional $3000 to cover the overhead percentage of using this fundraising website. $2700 of funds raised will cover our incorporation and non-profit preparation and filing. $20,600 will cover the security deposit and 3 months of initial rent for the new space. $1,000 will cover moving expenses, and $15,360 will cover the first few months of managerial and administration salaries until our programs become self-sustaining.

If by chance we don't reach our full goal, whatever money is raised will be prioritized towards the following:

Initial $2700 raised -> Non-profit designation
Next $5000 raised -> Admin position
Additional $ -> Suspense account towards new space

Help us take the leap!

There are times in life when you’ve been preparing, planting seeds, watching the skies, and waiting until that right moment for what seems like forever. And then out of the blue, the opportunity you’ve hoped for presents itself, your dreams suddenly become real, you’re forced to confront your fears of change, and you either take that leap of faith, or you step back and wait another cycle. We’ve waited long enough, and we’re ready. This is Terra’s Temple’s leap, and with your help, we can land in this magical new sacred space and welcome even more of the community to share in healing, connection, and collaboratively creating all that your Temple can become. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute directly, there are still ways you can help!

Spread the word!!! We need this to go as far as it can! You can use the sharing tools, Facebook, and other social media!

Also, we can always use toilet paper--Just saying. Plus volunteer help, there is so much to do to make a Temple function. If you have skills, we'll put them to use!
Please get in touch at (510) 601-6198 or info@terrastemple.com.

THANK YOU!!

Expanding capacity and services will require hiring a part-time administrator, a part-time events co-coordinator and a part-time trainer and manager. Moving into the new space will require down payment of first and last month’s rent and a security deposit. And because we are committed to shepherding the Temple through this growth process with pragmatism, we’re seeking funds to not only make this initial move, but also to give us a reasonable buffer for a couple of months as we build momentum, spread the word about our expanded capabilities, fill the calendar with additional events, and increase membership.
What We Need:
We need $39,660 to launch this next phase of our growth. Unfortunately we will also need an additional $3000 to cover the overhead percentage of using this fundraising website. $2700 of funds raised will cover our incorporation and non-profit preparation and filing. $20,600 will cover the security deposit and 3 months of initial rent for the new space. $1,000 will cover moving expenses, and $15,360 will cover the first few months of managerial and administration salaries until our programs become self-sustaining.
If by chance we don't reach our full goal, whatever money is raised will be prioritized towards the following:
Initial $2700 raised -> Non-profit designationNext $5000 raised -> Admin positionAdditional $ -> Suspense account towards new space
Help us take the leap!
There are times in life when you’ve been preparing, planting seeds, watching the skies, and waiting until that right moment for what seems like forever. And then out of the blue, the opportunity you’ve hoped for presents itself, your dreams suddenly become real, you’re forced to confront your fears of change, and you either take that leap of faith, or you step back and wait another cycle. We’ve waited long enough, and we’re ready. This is Terra’s Temple’s leap, and with your help, we can land in this magical new sacred space and welcome even more of the community to share in healing, connection, and collaboratively creating all that your Temple can become. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute directly, there are still ways you can help!
Spread the word!!! We need this to go as far as it can! You can use the sharing tools, Facebook, and other social media!
Also, we can always use toilet paper--Just saying. Plus volunteer help, there is so much to do to make a Temple function. If you have skills, we'll put them to use!Please get in touch at (510) 601-6198 or info@terrastemple.com.
THANK YOU!!

story:
My husband is starting to dress up our cat so here we are...

Hi,

For those of you who don't know us, our names our Sam and Megan.  I am 33 years old and Sam is 46 and we have been married for 4 years.  We have been trying to have a baby for 3 years and last year we started fertility treatments.  We went through all of the testing and did 3 rounds of IUI's (which is a basic fertility treatment) with no success.  Our doctor informed us that IVF was the next step and he felt our chances were very good.  The cost of IVF is $22,000.  We were disappointed because this was something we knew we would not be able to afford.  We started researching our options and found a private grant that we applied for.  We made it to the top 10 out of 400 applications but they could only give away 5.  Again, we picked ourselves back up and started looking into adoption or foster care.  Then on Valentine's Day 2012 through a series of coincidences and fate, we received a call from the fertility clinic that we have been given a $12,000 grant and have two years to use it!  We have regained our hope and we just need a little bit of help to get the rest of the way.  We have listed our goal as $10,000 but any money that is contributed will go to the cost of the IVF which we are hoping to do towards the end of the year.  Asking for help is not something we are used to doing, we work hard but we are so close to this dream that we feel if there were ever a time to reach out, it's now.  We are very excited about becoming parents, we hope that if you can't contribute that you will help us spread the word.  We appreciate it and well so does the cat...

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Asya, I am 15 years old and am the owner and designer of Stinky Feet Gurlz.  I started She Is Worth It!, a foundation that brings awareness and action to Child Sex Trafficking AS WELL AS funding (paying for) unprocessed, backlogged rape kits, to help make a difference in all of our towns. I have been trying to partner with a few organizations to gain my 501(c)(3) status but after a few difficulties with potential board members, I decided to try and raise the money on my own.  That's where crowd funding comes in.
 
Many children (as young as 9) are forced to perform sexual acts up to 25-30 times a day. The United States is a major hub for these children and we are seriously lacking in EDUCATION .  We plan to start here, in the United States first, visiting schools and educating our youth before working our way into other countries.

Right now, across America, there are approximately 400,000-500,000 untested rape kits sitting in police evidence storage facilities and crime labs.

I'm ready to change those numbers.  Will you help me?

What We Need & What You Get

So...where will your money go? Excellent question! We are totally transparent:

  1. First and foremost, we need our 501(c)(3) status.  That alone will cost us about $2,000. 
  2. We need a better website and online presence.  Right now we are using a free site, built by ourselves, and unfortunately, it shows. That should cost $500 or more.
  3. And if, God willing, there have been very generous donors and we have money remaining, we will use that to fund our first rape kits which cost between $1,000-1,200 each.
  4. And from there, we will work our way into every county and state until every official recognizes that children are NOT prostitutes, they are victims who need rehabilitation, hope and love. I need funds to help me travel to schools all across America to educate our youth on the dangers of these predators and WHO they are targeting.  Our youth MUST become aware in order to protect themselves!
  • $6,200 is our first goal, but even if we don’t reach our entire goal, we’re going to use every single dollar to its fullest potential to get our registered 501(c)(3) status and the other items that will launch this cause into something national and someday global.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money doesn’t grow on trees, so if you can’t donate right now, we understand. You can still help us out by sharing this page with everyone you know! Use the Share Buttons below to Facebook it, Tweet it, blog it, attach it to one of those forward e-mails your great-aunt Virginia and Uncle Bob sends you everyday. Odds are, you know people who would love to donate to this cause.

 

From the bottom of my heart,

Asya

IF YOU WOULD RATHER MAIL A CHECK INSTEAD OF DONATING ONLINE, PLEASE MAKE YOUR CHECK OUT TO "SHE IS WORTH IT" AND MAIL TO:

She Is Worth It

PO BOX 2622

Covina, CA 91722


Check out our She Is Worth It! website
Track our progress on She Is Worth It! Facebook
Follow me on Stinky Feet Gurlz's Facebook
Follow our Twitter account @sheisworthit
Follow on our Twitter account @stinkyfeetgurlz
