story:
Bringing Kids and Family Closer and Safer

Welcome Indiegogoers, to the Photojima Campaing

My name is Mark Hollas, father of three and producer / founder of Photojima.com - a private photo collecting, sharing and storage platform for

  • families looking for better privacy and security for their pictures, especially of children, but want an easy way to share.
  • families to connect and create family photo albums together
  • families to preserve their digital memories for years to come,

This project has been in the making since 2010 and has had some ups and downs. (read section below on "What Drives Me" to learn more or read the in depth article here http://bit.ly/T8oFjg)

I am here on Indiegogo raising funds to launch Photojima and to fund a new set of features that will bring kids closer to their families. Not just Mom and Dad but the Aunts, Uncles and the Grandparents that the kids may otherwise not have many chances to see. They will also be able to interact with their own friends. This will be done inside a safe and secure private network of family members

Kids will be empowered with the ability to:

  • Upload photos and sync their devices.
  • Use drawing tools to decorate pictures and create works of art.
  • Create collages and scrap books together with other family memebers.
  • Create collages and scrap books together with their friends (approval from parent required) 
  • Send greeting cards such as "thank you" cards to family members.
  • Send and recieve mail from family.

     

* Photojima is user ready and can be found @ www.photojima.com

Where are Your Contributions Going?

Contributions to the goal of $50,000 will be going to "starting up" the site and the company, obtaining proper accreditation for handling the security of children and families online, marketing and the ongoing development, staffing and running costs

Membership in FOSI: Family Online Safety Institute http://www.fosi.org/about-fosi.html

  • $15,000 / year

Development

  • Privacy model for kids accounts.
  • Scrapbook and collage making tools.
  • Greeting card tools. 
  • Mobile apps for all major platforms.
  • PC and mobile device syncing.
  • HD video storage

Marketing 

  • Direct advertising on target specific sites like family/mom blogs.
  • Advertising through ad networks
  • Affiliate advertising programs
  • On location promotional kiosks at family oriented events

The Impact you Will Make

Photojima is striving to provide ways to maintain the privacy and security of children online while not compromising on the ease and joy of sharing pictures. Photojima will help to keep family of all ages connected, keep images of children out of the public and keep parents in total control of how their private photos are viewed.

Families will benefit from stronger bonds and a growing collection of family memories that can be preserved over time. 

Kids will benifit by having fun sharing and creating with family, getting to know their relatives better, no matter what the distance between them.

Kids will have fun interacting and creating together with their own friends while learning how to use social tools.

Kids and Parents will all benifit from the peace of mind knowing that they are inside a safe and controlled environment.


What's in it for you.


Other than the satisfaction of knowing you are helping protect the privacy of millions of children by keeping their images off unsecured network sites with little or no ablility to remove them permanently. I am pleased to offer some great perks like...

$5 - Access to private beta for new kids area including access to new tools.

$10 - Lifetime access to premium tools for kids

$25 - 20 gigabytes of free storage on Photojima for a year.

OR

$100 - limited edition t-shirt 

other apparel include camera straps, caps, polo shirts, camera tote bags AND a Canon Rebel t4i Camera with Lens Kit or ad space on Photojima

* all apparel designs use the Photojima Palm Tree Logo and are limited edition only available to generous contributors 

Other Ways to Help

Share this campaign with friends who have children or others who are concerned about privacy. Share Photojima to your Facebook or Twitter using the share tools available on this page, or share on LinkedIn if you got it.

You could also come try out the site for free www.photojima.com and comment back. I would love to hear your thoughts on the site.


What Drives Me.


First, as a father of three young children I have concerns about their privacy and security. Not only in regards to how they access the internet and who they communicate with but also in regards to future privacy issues that could arise as consequence of how we (their parents) post images today.  

On March 11th, 2011 a major earthquake struck off the North West Coast of Japan sending a massive tsunami inland devastating communities and  hundreds of thousands of people and inundating the Fukushima Nuclear Power Facility. My family and I were living in Fukushima City at that time. Fortunately for us we did not live close enough to the coast to incur any damage but we had our own surprise in store as the nuclear plant spewed radioactive fallout right to our front doors. 

Months later I visited the tsunami sites where I once took my family for a day at the beach and fresh seafood and saw the extent of things. I realized how easily everything can be taken away, erased. I realized it is not important just to save data and back it up some where, you also need to connect others to it or it will become lost.

Second, (like I can actually put these in order) is as a father of three I have always been very weary of posting pictures of my kids on social sites because once online, exposed, those pictures can be collected my anyone and used for any purpose. I feel that as a parent one must take responsibility in protecting their children online just as one would if walking in a crowded shopping center. To help parent do this I want to provide ways share pictures just as quickly and conveniently as one would do on a social network while keeping their children’s privacy intact

story:
Short Summary

(en Francais en dessous)
Here is our facebook page.

My wife and I are going back to Belgium at the end of June.

After serving a year and a eight months at Host as manager, I feel it is time for a new step for us.

Our dream is to open my own coffee shop in our hometown Tournai. We would do that, just the two of us and serve exquisite coffee, teas, cakes and pastries.

What We Need & What You Get

Even though we have some savings to invest, we would need an extra £10.000

  • £5000 would go toward equipment: a good espresso machine, 2 grinders, some side equipment.
  • The other £5000 would go toward furniture, decoration, building a nice bar.

The Impact

After having been trained by World Champion and US Champion Barista and working in different top quality coffee shop in Los Angeles (Taza, Coffee by the boks, Rose City Coffee), Antwerp (KoffieKlap, Caffenation) and last but not least HOST in London, where I managed to feature in London Best Coffee, on London Best Coffee Map and in London Coffee Guide, I would like to put all that baggage toward opening my own shop and serving the best coffee.

We want to create a space where community and creativity are encouraged, where people want to come to meet others or just to spend some relaxing time. I would like to facilitate new monastic meetings in the space before and after business

Risks & Challenges

Tournai being a smaller city, the main risk would be that it is not successful enough. 

That being said, we would be the first real coffee shop in town (and the best of course) and being from that city, my wife and I are already well connected there.


Melodie et moi avons le projet d'ouvrir Humble Coffee a Tournai. Apres avoir ete forme par le champion mondial et la championne US 2x de barista aux Etats Unis, apres avoir travaille dans certains des meilleurs coffee shop de Los Angeles, Anvers et Londres, il est temps pour nous de revenir a la maison et de s'y poser.
Cela fait un moment que nous desirons ouvrir notre propre etablissement, et le moment et l'opportunite se presentent enfin a nous.
Dans ce lieu nous y servirons un cafe d'exception (torrefie par Caffenation anvers) ainsi qu'une selection de patisseries, gateaux, thes et boisons non alcolisees, faits maison ou produit localement.
Notre espace se voudra simple et accueillant, ou la creativite est encouragee et le contact humain favorise. 
Nous mettons un accent important sur l'artisanat et aimons partager notre passion des bonnes choses ET des bonnes personnes.
Dans l'attente de vous y voir.

story:
About Me
Originally, I am from North Dakota!  I came to Pittsburgh for grad school and never left.  I had never been to Pittsburgh before I moved here and was transplanted directly into Homewood!  Immediately, I felt a strong connection to the neighborhood because of the openness and welcoming attitude of the residents.  I've worked in Homewood for the last 7 years and am now lucky enough to be a property owner of a vacant lot where I can continue to invest in the area that I love so much!

About The Project
Working in Homewood has allowed me the opportunity to hear first-hand what one of the most disenfranchised neighborhoods in the city desires to see in its future. Once you meet a resident who has lived in Homewood for decades, one of the first conversation topics will assuredly be about ‘the way Homewood used to be’ – the liveliness, the bustling businesses, and the sense of community.


Presently, Homewood does not have an outdoor community-friendly space to host various activities. Kenny’s will be a platform for these creatives to showcase their product, whether that be artwork, music, or classes for wellness. 

The events schedule will reflect the residents’ vision for the site, including regular outdoor yoga classes, an art market, and a music showcase featuring musicians from the community and regional acts. We will also have annual signature events: a fundraiser, an open spoken word community day, and Cancers and Cookies - a summer birthday celebration. The site will also be available for usage by community members for activities such as family reunions, networking events and mixers, community days and cookouts, etc.

Bringing the residents’ vision to life and giving the neighborhood a positive, open atmosphere to promote health and wellness, arts and culture, and entrepreneurs and existing businesses will be a tremendous win for the community.

What We Need
The funding will be utilized to supplement some of the initial grading and landscaping work that will be required to prepare the lot for this season's activities.  The site currently has gravel that will need to be removed, the area will need to be leveled, and then subsequent activities include general landscaping, such as planting grass will occur.  The big push will be for the existing fence to be rebuilt. It is presently in a state of disrepair, so needs to be upgraded for the summer's activities!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!

Once you meet a resident who has lived in Homewood for decades, one of the first conversation topics will assuredly be about ‘the way Homewood used to be’ – the liveliness, the bustling businesses, and the sense of community.Presently, Homewood does not have an outdoor community-friendly space to host various activities. Kenny’s will be a platform for these creatives to showcase their product, whether that be artwork, music, or classes for wellness. The events schedule will reflect the residents’ vision for the site, including regular outdoor yoga classes, an art market, and a music showcase featuring musicians from the community and regional acts. We will also have annual signature events: a fundraiser, an open spoken word community day, and Cancers and Cookies - a summer birthday celebration. The site will also be available for usage by community members for activities such as family reunions, networking events and mixers, community days and cookouts, etc.Bringing the residents’ vision to life and giving the neighborhood a positive, open atmosphere to promote health and wellness, arts and culture, and entrepreneurs and existing businesses will be a tremendous win for the community.What We NeedThe funding will be utilized to supplement some of the initial grading and landscaping work that will be required to prepare the lot for this season's activities.  The site currently has gravel that will need to be removed, the area will need to be leveled, and then subsequent activities include general landscaping, such as planting grass will occur.  The big push will be for the existing fence to be rebuilt. It is presently in a state of disrepair, so needs to be upgraded for the summer's activities!Other Ways You Can HelpSpread the word about the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!

story:
ABOUT ME : ELLE

Hello World!
My name is Elle. I'm an Atlanta based artist and entrepreneur. Originally from Tulsa, OK,  I came to Atlanta to continue my personal transformation and to live my dream of becoming a business owner and vocalist.  Southern hospitality; the history; culture; business climate, music and film industries, and the canopy of trees over the city are aspects of Atlanta that attracted me.

I've been an entrepreneurial creative for most of my adult life. Cultivated in church and refined by Jazz, my voice has taken me to to Asia and Africa where I lived abroad for 8 years--mostly in Ghana and Japan. Fitness, dance and yoga instruction, along with my Reiki practice, have sustained me as well. My ability to market my talent and skills successfully, and ultimately serve customers well, has helped me build positive relationships and amass clientele. 

Listen to the Music @ https://soundcloud.com/evolution-liberated

Everyday I am growing in awareness, maturity and self love as a woman awakening to her divine purpose. Now is the time to fully embrace my spiritual, artistic and entrepreneurial journey as I take on the challenge of running a consignment boutique and recording the album that I have always wanted to. The call to look within, empower women and girls, and encourage practices that sustain and protect the natural Earth has inspired me to intentionally pursue my passion and creatively become the change agent who I know I am. 

The seeds of intention for Psycho Sisters Outlet Boutique have been planted.  I affirm endless profitable transactions and positive interactions with the community I serve and aim to help women express themselves through fashion.

I have already started operating the store and making online sales as well. This fundraising campaign is to help me buy the store and reimagine it. 

What I Need & What You Get

Context, Funding Needed & Where It's Going:

The store had a soft launch 45 days ago. Being in Little 5 Points, I have seen increased foot traffic as summer approaches, leading the clothes to practically sell themselves from the time I open the doors to close. Without marketing or the shop receiving the proper care and attention that it deserved  prior to me taking over, the store has broke even and then some. The former owner and Psycho Sisters partner has experienced a sudden life change and now needs to sell it before leaving the country at the end of the month. My challenge is to raise $25,000 BEFORE May 26th. Sudden? Possibly so. But I believe that the opportunity would not have presented itself this week if I unable to seize it. (Side Note: The shop owner and original Psycho Sisters founder interviewed many interested parties to sell the shop to, Other people had money in hand but they chose me based on how our intentions for the shop and our outlook on life align.)
Set up costs the that seller needs to recoup:

  • $6500: Initial Set Up costs leading up to and since the soft launch- Mannequins, racks, paint, clothes, hangers, shelves, etc.
  • $3600: Deposit and 1 Month Rent @ $1800.00 per
$10,100 buys the store. If, for some reason we fall short of $25,000, paying $10,100 to  buy the shop is top priority. (Keeping in mind that I am already in the shop and operating as the owner--sink or swim I'm all in and moving forward with this)

The shop is set up and operating but is a blank canvas. The remaining $14,900 will go towards business costs, rent, essential equipment, clothing stock, marketing, and minor cosmetic upgrades that will give the shop personality. 

  • Business Costs: Business License; Insurance; Registration with the Sec. of State for tax purposes: $1000.00 
  • Rent: $1800.00 to put me ahead my 1st month
  • Essential Equipment: $3400.00: iPad point of sale system; iMac for bookkeeping and online store; Camera and Alarm Installation; safe; DSLR camera, tea kettle
  • Clothing: The store gets new clothes every week on consignment. I need to spend $2500.00 on buying clothes from the public and opening accounts with new wholesalers so I can get 100% of the profits from a section of clothes in the shop to combine with the 60% I get from the consignment shipment every week.
  • Marketing: $1500.00: Website; Facebook and online ads; SEO; premium online seller accounts; flyers; promotion; branding
  • Cosmetic Upgrades: $4700.00: Flooring; signage; curtains; storage containers; decor. 

To show my appreciation for your contribution I will share my gifts with you throughout the summer. Friends who contribute $50, $75, and $150 or more will receive the opportunity to attend an outdoor yoga class, jazz concert or both, led by me, with raw vegan refreshments included.  


The Impact


I'm a young woman who left the midwest to travel the world in search of herself. In silence what I found was my voice  and a strengthened connection to the Earth and my higher self. Now I've landed in Atlanta and am poised to make my dreams my reality in the city that embodies THE DREAM. 

I'm taking on entrepreneurship and expanding creatively as a woman and as an artist. I want to film the experience this summer as I take over the shop, live in Little 5 Points and explore the city. I plan to share my journey with you online and in person when we meet for yoga, jazz and community building  with the hope that it inspires you to wake up to your divine purpose, find your authentic voice and live into being what makes you come alive. I plan to reach out to organizations that are at the intersection of fashion, faith, the arts, women's health, entrepreneurship and sustainability to build a movement that showcases the City of Atlanta in a positive and attractive way while inspiring personal and communal transformation 

As I film the progression of the store I will also include beauty and health tips; yoga instruction; motivational speaking and healthy food choices. 

I'm excited this project will require me to use all of the tools that I have acquired in my life experience.  I'm forced to be present, grateful, authentic, vulnerable, focused, organized and living in the now. Life is a bunch of fleeting moments and I want to catch the feeling of everyone of them. I want the shop and the lifestyle I promote to be inspirational and supportive of women. The store is likely the most affordable, trendy clothing store in Little 5 Points. I will definitely reach out to women's shelters and girls programs to seek out ways we can work together.

I will also be adding natural products like vegan lip balm to the store and promoting conservation in the Little 5 Points retail district by giving shoppers who bring their own reusable bag to use while they shop a discount.


Risks & Challenges


Psycho Sisters has been around for 25 years and is a staple in Atlanta fashion. The founder of Psycho Sisters and the former owner of the outlet store that I am taking over have been very supportive of this transition. We have a great space in Little 5 Points. We're heading into the busy summer season when tourist and locals alike are out and about in Atlanta. We have a steady supply of unique, fashionable and affordable clothes. With the flagship store already established, I have 25 years of resources and mentorship available to me. Yes, as an entrepreneur there will seen and unforeseen challenges that arise but I am thankful and appreciative that I have so much support around me and all parties involved want this to be a success. 

I need your help to raise the capital quickly.  When we do I will move forward in updating the business' licenses and taxes, implementing technology for proper accounting and  inventory systems, and making some cosmetic upgrades. Beyond that it's all marketing and serving customers excellence daily.

In 2 weeks we need $25,000. I'm excited and blessed to be in this situation. 

I liken it to new home construction--the house has been built and now I get to customize it with the colors, flooring, faucets, doors etc that I want.

I quit my job. I moved to the Inman Park/Little 5 Points neighborhood and the store came to me. I attracted it now I must have the faith to embrace it fully.  I've taken the risk, now I'm rising to the challenge. Are you with me!?  


Other Ways You Can Help


Contribute Today and join me in Atlanta this summer for fashion, fun, music, yoga and transformation.

Feel free to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign if you support personal transformation, women in entrepreneurship, expressing yourself and sustainability.

Share on social media. 

Visit Psycho Sisters Landmark Boutique today!

story:
Short Summary

I am so happy to announce that I have signed a lease and will be opening my very own Nail Art Studio called BRUSHED UP in October 2016! Having worked at an inspirational nail salon in Manhattan for the past couple years, I have been joyfully exposed and skillfully trained at the craft of ‘nail art’. Starting a business has always been a goal of mine and after many years and ideas later it has finally happened.

I have decided to launch a crowdfunding campaign as an effort to furnish and stock my new space with a variety of polish colors as well as natural and organic products used throughout the services. The studio is geared towards a one of a kind nail experience. We will be working on the natural nail only, while offering a variety of nail art looks and treatments to promote natural nail health. If you guys like the idea and are in a position to donate I would be beside myself in appreciation! (You also get some great discounts and gifts!)

PROGRESS!!!

What We Need & What You Get

In order for me to get fully operational in the new space with staff, I need about $8,000. Furniture, equipment, products and a talented staff adds up a bit!

  • $1500 Autoclave; to ensure hospital grade sterilization of tools
  • $1000 Equipment; A/C Unit, Refrigerator, Lamps
  • $3000 Inventory & Supplies
  • $2500 Furniture & Decor

In addition to a superior service experience, all of our services are performed using only natural and organic products!

Here are some things you can look forward to:

  • Peace of Mind: We ensure your skin and nail health are getting the very best care. You never need to worry about toxins or parabens or any of that other stuff we can’t pronounce.
  • Drinks: We will have a variety of drink options to refresh or wind down with.
  • Look book: Our elegantly crafted menu of designs guarantees a consistent & flawless experience every visit.
  • Treatments: We want your natural nails at optimal health even if your dont like to get crazy with our designs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and that totally OKAY!!

If you are socially connected I would LOVE a 'like' or a 'follow' and any efforts to share this campaign won't go unnoticed!!

Facebook: @brushedupnails
Instagram: @brushedupnails

story:
About Minh Tuyền 

She was in her last year of specialist training as an anaesthetist.

Tuyền was the only child. Her parents just moved from Vietnam to Australia for less than a year. She was kind, inspiring, caring and passionate about charitable works.

Our Donation

In memory of Tuyền, we are raising AUD 1,000 to send presents and flowers to Tuyền's parents on special occasions, and to sponsor May (a 10 years old disadvantaged girl in Vietnam) for two years. 

After this time, we may raise more money, or the sponsorship will be taken up by one of Tuyền's friends.

story:
Why help?


Malaysia has always been called a food paradise. But around the world, many people don't have the luxury of eating out - or eating at all.

We are asking restaurants and cafes to pledge 10% of their profits on a selected day (or days) to help feed the millions hit by Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines. The state of destruction has left entire regions of people displaced, with children roaming the streets for food as relief aid struggles to reach them.

Proceeds from this campaign will go to Citizens Disaster Response Center (CDRC), a grassroots NGO in The Philippines which works on the frontlines of delivering food and other much needed supplies.

How you can help:


Are you a business? Drop a message via our Facebook page. Make a pledge to share a percentage of your earnings to help feed people who desperately need it.

Not a business? Donate directly as an individual here, or ask your favourite restaurant to join the campaign. If you, the customer, tell them how much it means, they are more likely to say "yes".

What your money means...

  • USD 10 will feed a person for 2 days
  • USD 25 will provide shelter for a family of 5
  • USD 60 will feed and provide shelter for a family of 5

About CDRC

THE CITIZENS’ DISASTER RESPONSE CENTER (CDRC) is a non-government organization that pioneered and continues to promote community-based disaster management in the Philippines. CDRC operates nationwide through a network of regional centers affiliated with the Citizens’ Disaster Response Network and through people’s organizations.

Organized in 1984, CDRC focuses its assistance to the most affected, least served and most vulnerable sectors of the population through preparedness and mitigation, emergency relief, and rehabilitation programs.

About Passionation

Passionation is a KL-based collaborative of friends who want to use their skills for social change. The current collaborative is led by Karen, Tamanna and Ling, three friends with experience in NGO and policy work, media strategy and communications.

Find out more at


www.facebook.com/foodforphilippines

www.facebook.com/passionation.co

http://www.cdrc-phil.com/

story:
Ghana Lives

I am raising money to travel to Ghana and be a source of transformation. We will supply an entire community with medical supplies, food and leadership training. This is an opportunity to be the change you want to see in the world. Every dollar counts:

  • $1100 will create an amazing platform for growth. Did you know most families live on less than $2 a day? Can you imagine the gift of $1100!? You are making an impact beyond your wildest imagination! We will provide food, medical supplies and school necessities to the village of Begoro. 
  • Funds will also support the facilitation of a powerful leadership workshop with international transformation coach Bettie J. Spruill. This workshop will be the source for continued transformation in Ghana through the empowerment of one community from the inside out. This is the gift that keeps on giving. 
  • YOU are here because you are a giver. You believe in our cause. You see the difference we can make. You are my partner in transformation! THANK YOU!

My heart is so grateful for all you have given. Your love and support is the catalyst for me to live my vision. Thank you. 

The Village of Begoro

"For over 13 years now, in April of 2000, I adopted Begoro, a village in Ghana, Africa. Since then, I along with a team of volunteers, raised thousands of dollars to bring coaching and training to the people of that community to develop vision, leadership, and strategies and practices of sustainability for the individual and community. This April 2014 marks 14 years since my commitment to support the people of Africa in awakening to their greatness and what's possible when people explore who they are, really, and are given the opportunity to transform. We are Bringing Transformation to Africa. Imagine what's possible. Join us." ~ Bettie J. Spruill

What We Need and What You Get! 

Here is where your money goes:

  • We will provide school necessities, food, medical supplies and LOVE! 
  • I am your ambassador for change. I will support Bettie J. Spruill in the facilitation of a powerful workshop created specifically for the people of Ghana.
  • Please let me know any special requests you have for me while I am in Ghana!
  • I am also a freelance writer and online marketing consultant. Please ask how I can support you! 

The Impact

You will make a HUGE difference. Families in Ghana live on less than $2 a day (if they are lucky) your gift will literally transform an entire family for a year. The workshop you are supporting will be the source of transformation for generations to come:

  • Save a life. 
  • Create leaders.
  • Feed a child. 
  • Receive the gift of giving.
  • Empower our planet. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in other ways:

  • Send me travel advice!
  • Share my message with your friends. 
  • Be a space for change. Take a quiet moment to send me good vibrations ;) 

In Gratitude,

Kyla Rae ~ The Ghana Community

Be a space for change. Take a quiet moment to send me good vibrations ;) 
In Gratitude,
Kyla Rae ~ The Ghana Community

story:
10 word pitch: Low-income student leaders need your help to attend life-changing camp

 THE YOUTH LEADERSHIP COLLECTIVE STORY

Last summer, my partners and I started Youth Leadership Collective with the motivation of engendering students with leadership based on their personal and community development. There are a host of successful leadership programs tailored to give students public speaking skills, event management experience, and business acumen, but while students are told they can make a change and given skills they can use, they need an impassioned why and how.

In addition to discovering effective methods of delivering these intangible qualities and lessons to youth, Youth Leadership Collective is committed to reforming the way students view extracurricular activities in their high school careers. Entrepreneurship, although a powerful tool for change, has also disillusioned students from their high school clubs and cultures and has brought attention to "robotic volunteerism." Other organizations fill in this void with dances and parties, but we don't want to give up on the regular old service club. We want to rejuvenate and revolutionize student leadership and bring back wholesome leadership development, bonding, and focused community change to schools.

We want to build a culture of leadership based on humanity: interaction with and caring for others and the recognition and creation of strong self-identity, in schools, outside schools, and beyond. One of the ways we will do this is through our high school student-run (as all our programs will be) youth leadership summer camp, Generation 2014.


 WHAT´S DIFFERENT ABOUT GENERATION 2014?

  • Full-fledged Passion - The way we see each year that we will create the camp is to "Give delegates (campers) an experience just as good, or even better than you had." Our training entails a ton of personal investment, and this empowers our camp team to serve a greater and unified purpose.
  • Flexible and Multi-faceted Curriculum - With extensive leadership camp and conference experience, our team will not only develop a comprehensive camp curriculum, but also be open to whatever best practices should be used through effective feedback systems and collaboration with other youth leadership organizations such as YLA and CASC.
  • Greater Personal Development through Community - A number of the camp activities and traditions within Generation 2014 entail a significant amount of imbuing unity and bonding between various camp groups. We take a very serious approach to group dynamics and relationships and how these will expedite leadership development.
  • Sustained Impact - I was thoroughly impressed our camp counselor interviewees who stated that they wanted to keep in constant contact with the delegates. They want to see lives they changed continue to put the motivations and convictions gained from camp to use.
  • Extended Empowerment through Accessibility - A huge problem with youth leadership programs is the attrition caused by inaccessibility to leadership opportunities. Selective interview processes for teams following leadership programs create false hierarchies that say "We just taught you how to be a leader, but you're still not good enough." While YLC cannot create an optimal executive leadership team of 100 students, we CAN and WILL provide challenging and crucial leadership opportunities through an unrestricted catalog of mentorship programs, event committees, SASSI, and sustained dialogues inside and outside schools.


 THE COSTS

We've set the registration fee to attend this 5-day, 4-night camp at $350. This only covers lodging, food, and transportation. Other leadership camps can run for only 3 or 4 days and cost from $400-$600, but we wanted to make this opportunity as affordable for everyone, whether they demonstrate financial need or not.

With a total of 100 participants, we're expecting delegates to request approximately $5000 in financial aid based off of past leadership camp experiences, and we want to meet this need 100%.

Our team of 22 high school peer counselors is already committed to raising a total of $7000 to create a fund for the high ropes courses activities that aren't covered by the registration fee, staff backpacks, camp t-shirts and lanyards, special equipment and gift costs, and a portion of the financial aid. 

This leaves about $3000 in scholarship funds to be raised, and my partners and I are already financially supporting this camp through venues for preparation days, supplies, transportation, food for camp counselors, and covering the cost for insurance and organizational fees.

The $2000 goal is not all we intend to fundraise, but this is our online fundraising goal. If you can support through services or in-kind donations that would also help tremendously

Of course, to pursue a sustainable business model we will be furiously seeking out grants from corporations and foundations come May and I am currently meeting with nonprofit professionals such as the CEO of OneOC and the youth advisor for Youth Leadership America, but until then we are waiting on the IRS to approve our 501(c)3 application submitted in November and need to guarantee that we will meet this need.


 HOW CAN I BE A PART OF THIS MOVEMENT?

  • All supporters are sending a message to the camp counselors, delegates, and YLC members by telling them "we believe in your leadership development and want to see you accomplish your goals." One of the greatest things I've learned is effective framing of simple messages like that can go very, very far.
  • All supporters who give $25 or more will have the opportunity to BE A PART OF GENERATION 2014 even though they won't physically be present. I will message you with details regarding each perk and the specific impact you will make, since we want to keep as much of the camp activities a surprise as possible.
  • Check out our website, Facebook, and Twitter!
  • Contribute to our blog
  • If you're a current freshman, sophomore, or junior, or know someone who might be interested, look into applying for our Student Board of Directors or starting a club at your school!
  • Contact me at nathan.yoo@youthleadershipcollective.org if you're interested in talking about youth leadership, community change, or anything in general! I'd love to hear your thoughts and see how we can incorporate your leadership experiences into making our camp even better!


 WHAT ELSE IS GOING ON WITH YLC?

Like us on Facebook and Follow us on Twitter to keep updated on all our activities!

This Spring and Summer, we'll be:

  • Hosting a Student Speaker Seminar at the Santa Ana Zoo
  • Starting up our entrepreneurial education initiative, SASSI
  • Establishing contact with interested club applicants to train them and build relationships from the spring semester, through summer, and all the way until September

In September, we will:

  • Have a full-fledged regional youth leadership council to oversee events and committees in Orange County
  • Begin our club curriculum of club consulting, easily accessible in-school leadership activities, and sustained dialogues on community change
  • Begin our Nexus Youth Forum series

story:
Short Summary

I’m the publisher of Midwest Wine Press, the only publication focused on the wine and hard cider industry in the central United States.  The mission of Midwest Wine Press is to grow and support our regional wine industry.  Regional wine is good for the environment, good for rural economies and just plain good!

Since inception, Midwest Wine Press has written more articles about Midwest wine than any other publication.  For wine consumers and tourists, Midwest Wine Press has winery and varietal profiles that help increase demand for Midwest wine. 

For wine industry professionals, Midwest Wine Press has exclusive articles and news about growing grapes and making wine in cool climate regions. 

Increasing regional wine production and consumption benefits everyone. Shipping wine across the continent or the globe is inefficient and dependent on petrochemicals.  Of course, we don’t expect people to drink only Midwest wine.  But by drinking local wine, we can improve both the environment and the local economy.

I spend much of my time and resources actively promoting Midwest Wine.  Whether it’s public speaking at consumer events, conducting wine tours or writing about Midwest wine, I am 100% behind Midwest regional wine. 



What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $3,500.  These funds will be used to pay for generating new and original content related to Midwest wine.  Some funds will also be used for operational expenses like web hosting, database management and distribution of our subscriber email blasts.  We also plan to upgrade the website during the next 60 days. 

What You Get

$10- Recognition as a supporter in Midwest Wine Press.  A list of contributors of $10 or more will be published on the home page during January 2014. 

$30-  For contributions of $30 or more, you’ll receive a copy of “Hybrid Wine Making,” an e-book containing more than dozen Midwest Wine Press articles about making wine from cold hardy, hybrid grapes.

$60- For contributions of $60 or more, you’ll receive an invitation to a Midwest wine tasting in downtown Chicago.  There will be over 20 wines from across the region poured for your enjoyment.  (Attendance is limited to the first 20 contributors of more than $60.)

The Impact

Over 100,000 unique viewers have visited Midwest Wine Press since our inception a little over two years ago.  Thousands of these viewers have sought more information by clicking winery and wine trail websites.  Having a quality internet publication devoted to the Midwest wine industry helps to grow the market for regional wine. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please go to Midwest Wine Press at www.midwestwinepress.com to learn more about Midwest wine.  Subscribing to Midwest Wine Press is easy and free.  As a subscriber, you'll receive an email once or twice a month alerting you to the lastest news about Midwest wine.

story:
Welcome to Hytality!

Discover your best life.

Being a pharmacist isn’t easy. And we found out along the way that other health care providers, technicians, nurses, doctors and dentists don't have it easy either so we're expanding our message!

We're all about living your best life. With Style, Energy, Balance, Travel, Giving and more advice geared towards everyone that works within the field of healthcare!

It’s time for all of us to live the #HyLife

Hytality is an amalgamation of Hygieia (the goddess of health, cleanliness and sanitation) and vitality.
How you can be a part of Hytality!

For about about the price of a speciality cup of coffee, you can help bring Hytality to life! Interested in growing your lifestyle brand? Consider joining us as an advertiser. We invite pharmacy associations to join us too and have created special pricing just for you. 

It's easy to get lost in the search for quality information. That's why we're getting specific. We're getting customized. And we're inviting you to join us! We're asking for $60,000 to help us launch Hytality. By contributing you'll allow us to develop

  • A unique and interactive web site to engage the readers of Hytality
  • Video production
  • A VIP Launch Party in Austin, Texas (Date TBD but between October 18–22, 2014) 

Content & Contributors

Hytality is a quarterly online magazine but will also be available as a print on demand and as a subscription.

Our contributors will provide . . .  

Style  - we'll bring you the latest trends in fashion, for what to wear inside your pharmacy to looking your best at one of the various pharmacy conferences. 

Giving  - the future of our profession is made possible through the many non-profit organizations.

Pure  - you inform your  patients on how to care for their health and wellness our contributors will do that for you!

Energy - it's shape up time and we're here to help with tips and tricks you can incorporate into your hectic work schedule.

Balance - taking time for you is important, our contributors will give you the information you need to zen out.

Home - they say home is where the heart is, but style and comfort is where the soul dances!

Travel - should a trip to a conference be a vacation as well? And if not, where should you travel to? Can you make it a work trip and get a tax deduction?

Finance - the best things in life are free, but we'll tell you how to squirrel away those hard earned funds!

About Us

In 2011, Tacit Almonds, LLC launched Pharmacy Marketing Quarterly because there was no open access to marketing information for independent pharmacy owners. Now entering it's fourth year, Pharmacy Marketing Quarterly is read by over 6,000 print subscribers. In 2012 Scot Maitland, our Founder and Publisher, beat cancer and that propelled him to find ways to reduce his stress and enjoy his life more. Now he's ready to take that message to the healthcare community.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Help us spread the word! Currently Hytality is on Facebook and Twitter. Follow us, like us and share us with your friends and colleagues! Have a suggestion for a topic or article? Post to our social media and let us know!
